Job Description:
At SoftWear Automation, we are working to fundamentally change the way people make and buy textiles in a way that hasn’t happened since the industrial revolution. Leveraging our founder’s key insight in computer vision, we are combining robotics, computer vision, and some clever and custom software to automate textile and clothing manufacturing.

We are looking for software engineers to build out our design-to-product CAD software pipeline as well as help us write robot control code. You must absolutely be able to handle a variety of languages and problems and move quickly. For our current problems, C++ or Python and strong math skills are required. Background in modern web technologies is strongly preferred.

You must be an engineer with experience on a tangible product, not just websites.

Duties and Responsibilities:
Work on design-to-product pipeline
Develop low-level robot control code
Design and develop systems-level software/firmware
Technical Skills:
Good C and C++ programming skills
Strong algorithm and math skills required
ROS experience
QT experience a plus
Feedback/control and signal processing skills a plus
Image processing experience a plus
Linux background a plus
Microcontroller/real-time experience a plus
Education and Experience:

Due to overwhelming growth we have multiple openings at both a mid level as well as at a senior level; our entry-level team is well staffed.

Minimum experience:
BS in Computer Science or Electrical Engineering with embedded experience plus 3+ years of relevant experience, (or)
Master’s degree in Electrical Engineering or Computer Science plus 2 years of relevant experience.
This is a $100B industry, and we are growing rapidly and hungry for new talent. If you’re a kick-ass problem solver looking for a new challenge working with a top notch team, send your resume.

Pittsburgh, PA, USA
Full Time

Email Me This Job

THE GIG


RoadRunner is looking to hire a well-rounded and ambitious full-stack engineer to join our team!

We currently manage Recycling and Waste Management in multiple markets and are looking to grow our operation and technology this year. RoadRunner is planning to change the way people recycle while introducing tech into the industry that has never been done. We operate with many moving parts and there is no shortage of areas to improve on with excellent engineering.

We are looking for a grounded, ambitious, and detail-oriented software developer. Solid computer science fundamentals is required as well as an openness to use different technologies. Exposure to full-stack web development is a requirement for this position as well as experience with at least one popular front-end framework.

The main objective of this position is to build the foundation for RoadRunner's customer-facing applications. For the past two years, we have centered our technology around the core internal operations of the business. However, as we grow into more markets and productize our services, we will need to build a suite of applications for our clients.

RoadRunner is looking to provide a top-notch customer experience and the technology to back it up. You will work alongside a variety of disciplines including sales, design, and operations to develop high quality products. You will gain valuable system level experience as you integrate your work with our current technology and have the opportunity to develop brand new green-field projects.

Not only is this a great opportunity to help us grow our tech stack, but you'll also learn a lot about the Recycling and Waste Management industry and have the opportunity to be part of a growing startup.


REQUIREMENTS
Exposure to full-stack web development
Experience with at least one popular front-end framework

PERKS & BENEFITS
Full benefits package including health, dental, and vision insurance
401k
Commuter Benefits
Paid company holidays.
Company events, annual off-site retreat, happy hours, and other social events.
15 Paid Time Off days per year + 2 personal floating holidays
Outstanding company culture.

Job Title: Loan Operations Manager and HMDA Specialist
Job Description:
Job Description *
Title: Loan Operations Manager and HMDA Specialist *
Reports To: Executive Vice President / Chief Risk Officer *
JOB SUMMARY *
As Loan Operations Manager, this individual will be responsible for actively managing personnel and processes related to loan documentation and loan servicing. This responsibility includes creating efficiencies through planning, assigning, and directing the orderly flow of the loan process after approval and through closing. The candidate should have a thorough knowledge and understanding of the bank’s loan documentation software, as well as the legal criteria and compliance regulations that impact the loan documents for the various loan types.

This person will be responsible for reviewing the loan documents for accuracy and in accordance with bank policies and regulations. This person will also be responsible for managing the loan title policy process, the appraisal management process, and the bank’s loan-related insurance coverages. Strong communication and training skills are critical for success in this position.

Further, this individual should be a proactive and influential leader, while maintaining positive working relationships.

As HMDA Specialist, this individual will have ownership of the HMDA reporting process. The HMDA Specialist will ensure timely and accurate completion of the HMDA Loan Application Register. This person will be responsible for ensuring appropriate HMDA documentation within the loan files, as well as adverse actions and withdrawals.
ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES (*Other duties may be assigned.)
_Loan Operations Manager: _
Actively manage the loan pipeline and the orderly flow of the loan process after approval and through closing, ensuring proper segregation of duties and accuracy.
Actively manage the loan documentation process, which includes thoroughly understanding the LaserPro loan documentation system, reviewing and appropriately implementing LaserPro updates and enhancements, and determining the proper documentation requirements for each loan type while taking into consideration both the required legal criteria and compliance regulations. Be proficient at establishing LaserPro templates for all loan types within the system administration function.
Responsible for the review of loan documents for accuracy according to bank policies, compliance regulations, and legal criteria, including verification of proper approval, of terms and covenants in the credit presentation, and of accurate signature authority on the documents. Ensure all “Prior to Close” criteria have been completed.
Oversee the appraisal management process, ensuring due diligence is performed for potential appraiser candidates, ordering and understanding the various appraisal types, maintaining an active list of appraisers for each market area, and ensuring the appropriate level of review for appraisals.
Responsible for the loan title policy, opinion, and search processes, which includes ensuring that exceptions are properly cleared to provide the bank with clear title. Also, responsible for the review of final title policies and opinions.
Oversee the loan servicing process, which includes ensuring the accuracy of the posting of loan and escrow payments, the generating of loan payoffs, the disbursing of funds, the calculating of interest accruals, the timely sending of system notices to customers, and the completing of mortgage releases.
Responsible for all processes utilized to maintain lending insurance coverages, including coverage for mortgage loans, vendor single interest (VSI) insurance for vehicles, force-placed coverage, private mortgage insurance (PMI), and flood insurance coverage for properties located in a special flood hazard area.
Oversee the construction loan draw process including equity contributions, inspection reports, draw packages, waivers, and date down endorsements.
_HMDA: _
Responsible for and have ownership of the HMDA mortgage loan reporting process.
Responsible for the timely and accurate completion of the HMDA Loan Application Register.
Responsible for appropriate HMDA documentation within the loan files, as well as adverse actions and withdrawals.
Assess the adequacy of and adherence to internal credit policies and loan administration procedures.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE*
Bachelor’s degree (B. S.) from a college or five to ten years of banking-related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
LANGUAGE SKILLS*
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret software application updates, technical procedures, and governmental regulations. Ability to write reports, correspondence, and procedure manuals. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from managers, employees, customers, regulators, board of directors and the general public.
MATHEMATICAL SKILLS*
Ability to work with mathematical concepts. Ability to apply concepts such as fractions, percentages, ratios, and proportions to practical situations.
TECHNICAL SKILLS *
Ability to utilize computer word processing and spreadsheet software for data analysis and report preparation. Good knowledge of banks data processing system reports and procedures as they relate to the departmental operations.
TRUSTBANK CORE VALUES*
Embrace and promote the TrustBank Culture and Core Values in all aspects of your duties. Understand the highly confidential nature of the information being worked with on a daily basis.

Cosmic Pet is a multi-branded, international company that designs and manufactures pet products for cats and dogs. Formerly known separately as Hyper Pet, R2P Pet, Our Pets and Pet Fusion, the combined company is an industry leader of innovative and stimulating pet toys and accessories that help strengthen the bond between pets and their parents.

Our mission is to lead in the pet industry by developing iconic and trend-setting products that create value for our partners by delivering great experiences for pets and their families. Cosmic Pet continually strives to exceed the expectations of all our customers while providing only the best for our four-legged friends.

Overview:

Cosmic Pet is seeking a full time DBA to work mostly remotely. Some travel expected to our headquarters located in Wichita, Kansas, in order to better understand processes and end user needs, etc. The DBA will manage, maintain, develop, and administer the databases in our environment including, but not limited to: SQL, Snowflake, and Postgres.

Cosmic Pet currently has an on premise SyteLine 9 ERP which is integrated with a cloud-based WMS, an on premise rapid pick system, and multiple EDI systems (which are in the process of being consolidated to Dell Boomi). The near term goal is to migrate the on-premise SyteLine system to AWS and maintain the existing integrations as well as potentially developing more in the future as business needs evolve. Cosmic Pet also has an existing AWS environment which hosts the EDW (Snowflake) and BI (Alteryx, Postgres) systems. The administration, maintenance, and development in these databases is also included in this role.

Responsibilities:

Overall / Database (SQL/Snowflake/Postgres):

· Administer, maintain, develop, and customize databases to exceed minimum business requirements

· Partner with the BI team to develop views, tables, etc. as needed

· Coordinate with IT team regarding security for and within databases

· Perform and test routine database backups and restores

· Define database driven application architectures and overall structures

· 1+ years Snowflake / data warehousing experience desired

· 1+ years Postgres experience desired

· 2+ years cloud (AWS) experience preferred

· 5+ years ETL

· 10+ years of system and database administration

· 10+ years business system analyst including functional/technical spec development

· 10+ years project management

· Willingness and ability to further develop programming skills and/or learn a new programming language

· Significant Distribution/Manufacturing Industry experience

· Ability to follow support / incident management requirements

· Excellent troubleshooting techniques and abilities

· Proactive, ability to adapt to change and keep current on emerging technologies and behaviors in support of information technology and system efforts

SyteLine:

· Administer, migrate, maintain, and customize Syteline 9 ERP to exceed minimum business requirements

· Program within the SQL environment (creating views, triggers, stored procedures) including SQL-based queries

· Develop, code, install, test, debug, and document backend software applications using appropriate editors

· Perform and test routine SyteLine system backups and restores

· Partner with IT team to ensure EDI integrations and flows are accurately reflected in SyteLine and make necessary corrections with a sense of urgency

· Report Writing, Customizations, Modifications

· Provide training for end users

· Module Installations

· Experience with at least one upgrade/implementation

· Experience with multiple integrations including Warehouse Management Systems, EDI platforms, etc.

· SyteLine hosted on AWS experience a plus

· 5+ years Mongoose

· 5+ years Dataviews

· 5+ years Syteline/CSI programming *_REQUIRED _*

· Custom form development

· EDI experience preferred

· Experience with the following SyteLine 9 modules:
Forecasting
Advanced Planning / MRP
Inventory
Customer Orders
Materials Management
Shipping/Logistics
Finance/Accounting
Supply Chain Management
EDI
Doc-Trak
Manufacturing
Technical Level:

· Senior

Pump Technician - Mechanical Assembly – 2nd Shift*
Rotating Equipment Repair Inc.,* based in Sussex, WI, leads the power generation industry in aftermarket pump repair, replacement part manufacturing, and field installation and commissioning since 1982. Specializing in high pressure multi-stage boiler feed pumps, RER provides its customers with high quality engineering services, repairs and parts for centrifugal pumps through the utilization of highly skilled professionals, cutting edge technology, and proven work methodologies. RER has proudly been awarded Milwaukee Journal Sentinel’s Top Workplace for the last 8 consecutive years!
We offer a full benefit package including Health Insurance, HSA with generous Company contribution, Dental Insurance, Vision Insurance, Short-term and Long-term Disability, Life Insurance, AD&D Coverage, 401(k) with Company contributions, Paid Holidays, Paid Time Off and more!
Summary*: Under the direction of the Plant Manager, the Mechanical Assembly Technician performs all tasks necessary to disassemble and re-assemble customer pumps, ensuring the highest-level quality at the lowest possible cost, and meeting customer delivery requirements and company performance standards, in accordance with company policies and procedures.
Essential Duties and Responsibilities *include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Follow procedures to disassemble pumps and parts, blast & clean parts, and re-assemble of pumps and parts. Must be able to perform this task independently.
Hand dress (grind) parts for proper appearance or functional dimensions.
Check parts for run-out. Make gaskets as needed.
Ensure part sizes and dimensions are accurate.
Chase threads and tap holes when needed.
Operate lift equipment and cranes to safely move parts and pumps.
Prepare pumps for shipment, following procedures.
Paint pumps and components.
May perform welding activities, to include pad welding, tack welding, build-up and filling, and maintaining proper levels of materials and supplies.
May operate balance machine to balance pump components according to procedures and specifications.
May sandblast and clean pumps and components.
Complete special projects as assigned.
Complete and maintain all required paperwork, records, documents, pictures, etc.
Follow and comply with all safety and work rules and regulations.
Maintain a clean and organized work environment.
Be respectful to co-workers and be part of an environment that fosters teamwork.
May be asked to work overtime at short notice.
May travel to customer locations to assist with disassembling and re-assembling of pumps up to 15% of the time.
Qualifications: *
Requires a high school diploma or GED and one to three years of related experience; or a combination of education and experience.
Must obtain lift equipment certification & OSHA training after hire. May require welding certification.
Requires the ability to operate a variety of small hand and power tools, precision measuring devices, cranes and lift equipment, and tool room machines. May require the ability to operate welding equipment.
Prior knowledge and/or experience with pump operation, fabrication, or repair is desired.
Ability to read and interpret documents such as blueprints, safety rules, operating and maintenance instructions, and procedure manuals.
Ability to prepare routine reports and paperwork.
Ability to communicate effectively with customers and other employees of the organization.
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent.
Ability to apply common sense understanding to carry out detailed but uninvolved written or oral instructions.
Ability to deal with problems involving a few concrete variables in standardized situations.
Requires the ability to operate a computer, keyboard and job-related software.
Requires the use of safety glasses and shoes, hearing protection, hard hat, welding helmet and gloves, face shield, dust mask, respirator, hot mitts and rubber gloves as dictated by the work being performed.
Work Environment & Physical Demands: *Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
Frequently exposed to work near moving mechanical parts and airborne particles. The employee is occasionally exposed to work in high, precarious places and fumes or to wet or humid conditions (non-weather); toxic or caustic chemicals; outdoor weather conditions; extreme heat (non-weather); risk of electrical shock and vibration.
The noise level in the work environment is usually moderate to loud.
While performing the duties of this Job, the employee is regularly required to stand and use hands to finger, handle, or feel. The employee is frequently required to walk and talk or hear. The employee is occasionally required to sit; reach with hands and arms; climb or balance and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl. The employee must frequently lift and/or move up to 25 pounds and occasionally lift and/or move up to 40 pounds.
Specific vision abilities required by this job include Close vision, Distance vision, Peripheral vision, Depth perception and Ability to adjust focus.
Visit www.rerpump.com for more information on our company!

Oakley, the leader in transportation service is looking for a Field Supervisor to join our team as we continue to grow and provide superior service to our customers. The Field Supervisor is responsible for planning, leading, organizing and coordinating the daily operations of our drivers in the field.

Responsibilities:
• Supervise and dispatch drivers daily as they deliver from the farms to the facility.
• Monitor the transportation to ensure that drivers are properly utilizing and implementing organizational objectives as dictated by management.
• Daily tasks include supervising employee performance, allocating driver assignments, ensuring compliance with safety standards, and communicating customer service.
• Communicate daily with customer on starting farm locations and direct drivers to locations.
• Coordinate safe routes to drivers to and from the facilities.
• Collect daily paperwork and input into computer data base.
• Provide support to Driver Managers
• Advise and communicate with customer daily (logistics, and day to day issues)
• Communicate with breakdown on maintenance issues
• Move equipment when needed.
• Work week expectation: During season (October thru May) 7 days a week if customer facility is operating). After season 40 hours a week minimum.

Educational Requirements:

• High school diploma/GED or equivalent experience.

Skills and experience:
• Demonstrated knowledge, skills and ability in people management.
• Bilingual (English/Spanish) preferred.
• CDL class A recommended
• Must be able to multitask and meet deadlines under pressure.
• Good organization skills customer focused and problem solving
• Computer skills using one or more spreadsheet and word-processing software application programs. Excel, Word, Google docs.

Summary: * A full time position, Monday thru Friday, 40 hours week 8:30 to 5pm. Responsible for verifying and obtaining required documentation for title orders by performing the following duties:
Duties and Responsibilities* include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Introduction call to new clients/applicants with an overview of what to expect.
Prepares and reviews customers’ documentation to verify that all application data is complete and meets establishment standards. Records stages of files as they progress throughout the life-cycle of the transaction.
Documents all interactions/actions for each transaction in system notes throughout the life-cycle of the transaction.
Reviews weekly Manager Report and performs follow up duties/actions required to keep file statuses/completed task information up to date
Ensures all documentation is accurate and correct throughout the process.
Informs supervisor of discrepancies in title or survey. Informs Reader(s) of status of orders to ensure file stages move to the next phase efficiently.
Provides additional documentation to lenders/ attorneys as required.
Orders legal documents per requirements.
Verifies accuracy and required legal documentation for each transaction.
Reviews preliminary title reports to verify property address, vesting and additional items to order endorsements from title insurance companies.
Verifies all final fees on settlement statements and prepares the closing packages for the closer.
Responsible for ensuring closing funds are disbursed/issuing wires.
Sends out required documents, submits documents for recording/ Closing Department as required.
Reviews all executed legal documents for actual closing of each transaction.
Ensures all conditions placed upon file are received, correct and approved by the Title Officer.
Performs other related duties as assigned.

To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. Position: Credit & Collections Manager

Compensation: Salaried

Office Hours: M-F from 8:00am – 5:00pm; daily and/or weekend overtime varies as needed.

Benefits: Health, dental, and vision company plans with partial health plan support.

401K: Available at 90 days with partial company match after 1 year.

Minimum Requirements
5 or more years of relevant work experience.
Strong work ethic, self-starter, and good moral character.
Ability to work within a team environment as well as independently.
Strong customer service experience including a common sense approach to handling collections.
Highly detail oriented and able to keep detailed records on credit applications, credit decisions, collections efforts, etc.
Strong communication skills both written and verbal. Ability to speak/present clearly and confidently in front of a group.
Strong Microsoft Office experience with strong internet research skills.
Strong ability to learn different computer software programs.
Ability to file and organize physical and electronic files in a proficient manner.
Additional Desired/Preferred Requirements
4-year college degree, preferably with a business major.
Credit & collection experience with a manufacturing company in a competitive industry.
Credit & collection experience with customers in construction, retail, distribution, and/or manufacturing industries.
Filing lien experience within Ohio.
Small claims court experience within Ohio.
ERP Experience
Duties
Contact as many customers as possible daily via phone, email, mail etc. Clearly and carefully documenting the results of each of these communications in the ERP system.
Prepare credit applications in a timely manner to extend credit utilizing proper procedures to determine the amount and nature of the credit extended. Follow up daily communicating the results of the credit application process to the appropriate parties.
Answer credit reference requests for current customers in a timely manner.
Prepare bi-weekly AR account notes to management.
Attend and facilitate when necessary various weekly, monthly, quarterly and ad hoc meetings about various aspects of the credit and collection process.
Management of professional collection firms utilized as well as interviewing prospective collection firms, etc.
Manage and file liens as needed.
Attend small claims court as needed.
Provide assistance and training to SealMaster Franchise owners and employees in the area of credit and collections.
Assist accounting department with documenting and processing credits for returns, adjustments, and other deductions.
Any and all other administrative duties to assist management as needed.

Job Description:

• Demolition Superintendent

Job Purpose:

• Demolition Superintendent shall plan, supervise, coordinate, and execute field operations managing both subcontractor and self-performed work on residential and commercial demolition projects.

Job Duties:

• Supervise demolition projects crews and subcontractors.
• Manage onsite work self-performed by OCM crews.

• Communicate and coordinate with client or owner’s representative.

• Apply for and manage permits.

• Procure Materials / Equipment Rental for demolition work as needed.

• Value engineer designs and direct work to take place in a most efficient manner continually striving to improve efficiency demolition efforts in the field.

• Actively supports and adheres to the company safety policies and OSHA Standards.

• Consistently anticipates and meets or exceeds the expectations of internal and/or external customers.

• Supports company efforts to obtain new work by remaining alert to business opportunities and sharing information with appropriate company personnel.

• Supports the company's efforts to become a learning organization by teaching, coaching and mentoring others.

• Manages the demolition plan for the successful execution of the work. Coordinates the means and methods, manpower, equipment, and material resources required to accomplish this goal.

• Prepares the Monthly Progress Report in coordination with the appropriate people. Uses available reports to manage costs and prepare accurate cost projections.

• Prepares the original CPM Project Schedule. Coordinates incremental schedules with the Field

Superintendent or General Foreman and subcontractors for monthly updates.

• Conducts weekly subcontractor coordination meetings. Reviews short duration schedule responsibilities.

• Prepares daily field status reports.

• Reviews the Procurement Schedule. Identifies items which could cause detrimental schedule problems for the project. Researches alternatives for the Project Managers approval.

Job Description & Requirements: This position must be capable of performing the majority of required vehicle maintenance and repairs on with minimal support from others.Works with the assistance of a Fleet Maintenance Technicians (“FMT”) 3, Lead Fleet Maintenance Technician, Fleet Maintenance Supervisor or Fleet Manager, when performing highly technical or intricate diagnostic type repairs. Task assignments are directed by shop management to encourage experience and skills development. The FMT-2 technician works under minimal supervision of Management, exercising some judgment and discretion in resolving issues or making repairs.
Key roles include all technician tasks including, but not limited to the following:
Interacts with drivers to properly determine root cause of complaint once assigned a task.
Performs preventive maintenance, facility maintenance duties, utilizes key functions of shop management system and other electronic systems available, works in accordance with all federal/state and corporate compliance guidelines (i.e., safety, DOT), replaces defective components as instructed, other support duties as required.
Diagnoses complex mechanical and electronic problems utilizing diagnostic computer when applicable, acts as mentor for FMT-1 technicians, completes complex and detailed mechanical inspections and repairs with minimal supervision, demonstrate the ability to access and use internal and external maintenance documents
Maintain equipment to desired performance levels.
Complete work orders in a timely manner maintaining high quality standards
Keep management informed of safety, operator and equipment observations and concerns
Perform prescribed Preventative Maintenance.
Ensure all paperwork is filled out in a clear, legible and accurate format, and completed with required information.
Ensure all required information is documented in accordance with SOP’s.
Utilizing continuous improvement mindset, assist in identifying opportunities to improve processes.
Follow Good Manufacturing Practices.
Maintain a clean, sanitary and safe work area.
Follow all required work safe practices. This would include wearing of all required PPE in designated areas, confined space safety, safe chemical handling, fall restraints, etc.
Responsible for food safety, pre-requisite programs and food quality related to designated area.
Report any food safety and food quality related issues to management immediately.
Perform other duties as assigned.

High School Diploma or equivalent preferred.
Must have a minimum of 2 years of experience with mechanical repairs and diagnostics on heavy duty and medium duty equipment.
Able to add, subtract, multiply and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions and decimals.
Mechanic Certifications and CDL-A preferred.
Refrigeration license required.
Must be able to stand, walk, kneel, bend, reach, crawl required for virtually the entire shift.
Able to lift up to 50 pounds and assist others when lifting is required. Manipulation of tools, equipment and truck component is required.
Must be computer literate, and have experience with engine, ABS, transmission, etc. diagnostic equipment and software.
Must be able to work in a dusty, greasy environment with moderate to high noise volume.
Must be willing to work flexible hours including overtime, weekends and holidays.
Be able to effectively work in a team environment.
Effective verbal and written communication skills.
Ability to work in a fast paced environment.
Must be able to pass all pre-employment screens (including drug, background and criminal checks).

Job Title: Sales & Customer Service Assistant Manager - Self Storage
Job Description:
SALES AND CUSTOMER SERVICE ASSISTANT MANAGER - SELF STORAGE*
Stor-N-Lock Self Storage, with 22 locations in the western U.S., has an opening in *Gypsum, CO* for an Assistant Store Manager to oversee all aspects of a state-of-the-art storage facility. We are looking for a driven, motivated self-starter that enjoy building rapport with customers and solving their storage needs. This position is in a great retail sales environment without the retail hours! Schedule is Sunday-Wednesday.

At Stor-N-Lock Self Storage, the role of the *Assistant Manager *is an integral part of creating a comfortable and welcoming environment for our customers, providing a clean and safe place to work, and connecting with our customers to identify their needs and to surpass their expectations. Stor-N-Lock Self Storage is looking for people that have a high level of engagement, the ability to adapt to a variety of customer personalities, and the desire to love what they do with the utmost integrity. If this sounds like you and want to join a great organization, then we look forward to hearing from you!
Responsibilities*
Successful Assistant Managers achieve financial objectives by:
Managing cash with precision and balancing receipts, conducting collection efforts, posting payments and processing daily bank deposits accurately and timely as well as maintaining accurate records.
As an Assistant Manager you’ll oversee assistant managers to maximize property performance. Showing and leasing self-storage and parking spaces.
You will handle customer inquiries (whether by telephone or in person)
You will have the opportunity to recommend and implement aggressive off-site marketing programs based on competitor information and your own great ideas.
Our Assistant Managers consistently provide excellent customer service by welcoming customers in a friendly and professional manner.
Our customers are what makes our business possible. You will get to build a dedicated customer base by providing great customer experiences and surpassing customer expectations.
You will get the opportunity to sell high quality retail merchandise such as boxes, locks, tape and other moving/packing supplies.
Fortunately, our Assistant Managers aren’t stuck inside an office all day. They enjoy working outdoors. Assistant Managers spend about half of their time out on the property walking and tending to the facility to ensure it is kept to a high cleanliness standard. This includes cleaning units, sweeping, mopping, changing light bulbs and other general maintenance duties.
Successful Assistant Managers are required to perform at a high level with minimal supervision, but also are team oriented.
As an Assistant manager you will manage the day to day operations of the business by utilizing industry specific software.
Qualifications*
Successful Assistant Managers must have strong sales and customer service skills
Candidates could have experience from various fields such as retail sales, restaurant, sales associate, and other customer focused sales roles
Energetic, outgoing, customer-oriented personality with the ability to work effectively with limited supervision.
Prior leadership roles and experience supervising others is preferred.
A High School diploma /GED equivalent. College education a plus
Ability to perform light maintenance.
Strong Computer Skills
Minimum two year Customer Service and/or Sales experience
Valid driver’s license with access to reliable transportation
Benefits*
Salary and performance bonuses
Health insurance compensation
IRA program with company match
Paid vacation and sick leave
A rewarding work environment
Great company culture
Additional Information*

Our company, Closet Factory, is the Custom Storage Solution Authority, serving the worldwide need for custom space organization throughout the home. We design, sell, build and install custom closets, home offices, garages, home theaters, pantries, bookshelves, and more. Our products are of the highest quality. We have been in business for over 30 years and have locations throughout the country. We have experienced substantial, long-term growth and as a result are searching for another member to add to our close-knit team of people to manufacture and install our products.

Our factory produces all of the wood parts to our complete product line using the 32-millimeter system. Members of our factory prepare each job and check it for accuracy and quality before it is loaded into our vans and sent to the client's home for installation.

Role and Responsibilities

Primary responsibilities will revolve around the creation of production files to be run on our 3-axis CNC router used to create our clients projects. Design files are created by our Design Consultants, and it is the responsibility of the cutlister to make the modification necessary to produce the project, including the following tasks:
Review of Design/Sales Data for completeness
Communication with Design Consultants and Production to assure all required data to manufacture, order specialty items and install our products is present
Creation of instructions and modification of drawings to list installation steps, as required.
Specification of special orders to support the build requirements of client projects
Updating of our design software with updated components, accessories, etc
Communication with Installers when questions arise.
Additional responsibilities
Working for a small company means that additional responsibilities may be presented at times.
Qualifications and Education Requirements

High School Diploma or equivalent required.

Associate’s or Bachelor’s Degree a plus.

Very high math competency and basic algebra a necessity.

Familiarity with the metric system a plus.

Preferred Skills

Proficiency with Microsoft Word and Excel required.

Experience with any 3D CAD system a plus.

Woodworking or cabinetry installation experience a plus.

Demonstrated, strong attention to detail is required.

Evin at Oconomowoc is an 80-unit senior living community that includes Independent Living, Assisted Living, and Memory Care. We are looking to add a Head Cook to our team!

The Head Cook is responsible for providing outstanding customer satisfaction through directing the on-site food services program. Under the direction of the Executive Director, this is a hands-on management position that will directly oversee all aspects of culinary services provided to our residents.
ESSENTIAL RESPONSIBILITIES* include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Responsible for menu planning, menu design, food costs and fulfilling dietary restrictions of residents.
Monitor food preparation methods, portion sizes, and garnishing and presentation of food in order to ensure that food is prepared and presented in an acceptable manner.
Monitor budgets and payroll records, and review financial transactions in order to ensure that expenditures are authorized and budgeted. Manage the monthly budget to maintain profit & loss goals. Ensure labor expenses are in line with other costs and pricing objectives.
Recruit, train, schedule and manage wait staff and culinary staff; including adherence to HR policies and procedures, maintaining employee files and managing the performance of the staff.
Ensure the restaurant, kitchen and surrounding area is clean, orderly and safe for residents, staff and visitors.
Investigate and resolve complaints regarding food quality, service, or accommodations.
Arrange for equipment maintenance and repairs, and coordinate a variety of services such as waste removal and pest control.
Complete all daily, weekly and monthly reports on a timely basis.
Ensure compliance with state health and safety regulations and prepare for inspections.
Schedule and receive food and beverage deliveries, checking delivery contents in order to verify product quality and quantity.
Provide catering services to resident activities and special events.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES
This position has direct supervisory responsibilities over the wait staff and kitchen staff.
QUALIFICATIONS
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily. The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skills and/or abilities required. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

· Bachelors Degree in food service management or a related field, or an equivalent combination of education, certification and experience.

· A minimum of four years of progressively responsible experience in a food service operation, including at least two years of supervisory experience.

· ServSafe Certification or certification within one year from date of employment.

· Knowledge of quality food service preparation and service techniques and standards.

· Knowledge of state health and safety regulations and requirements.

· Knowledge of supervisory practices and principles.

· Ability to effectively communicate via written or verbal methods.

· Computer proficiency, including Microsoft Office© - Word and Excel, as well as other industry-related software.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:
401(k)
401(k) matching
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Weekends
Experience:
Cooking: 1 year (Preferred)
Pay Frequency:
Bi weekly or Twice monthly

The Auditor Supervisor position provides comprehensive advanced supervisory support to the Auditor staff of Pathology Billing Services, LLC, to enhance the efficient operation of the department. All work generated is expected to be verified for accuracy. All employees are responsible for supporting the company’s goals and mission, by following all company policies and procedures.

ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS:
Act as first line supervisor to all Auditor employees of PBS, LLC.
Review Clin-Path Pathology and Pathology Specialists of Arizona billing accounts. Add CPT codes, ICD-9 and ICD-10 codes as necessary, making corrections as appropriate.
Acts as coordinator for information needed to accurately audit and code hospital and ancillary service center patient charges.
Works with management to train staff on auditing/coding
Ensure that all locations and auditors at PBS have cross training coverage available.
Complete routine QA for auditing staff.
Works with management to generate required PQRS reporting.
Provides support to billing staff for appeals and grievances for denied previously audited claims.
Maintains current knowledge on CCI, LCD, MUE and CMS billing guidelines and reports changes to management in a written format to include recommended change in coding process.
Reports any inconsistencies in coding to management in a written format.
Generate routine and impromptu reporting for the staff as it pertains to managing the workflows ensuring the integrity of the coding.
Verify all workflows are continuously maintained timely and accurately.
Prepare recommendations for problematic payer trends and present, in writing to the Administrative Director.
Report any known backlogs, in writing, to the Administrative Director, with a recommendation for resolution.
Provide a written report of outstanding tasks and projects to the Administrative Director on a weekly basis.
Draft office policy and procedure, to include updates as needed; submit to the Administrative Director for approval.
Coordinate department and company operating procedures with all other intercompany management to ensure that all departments correlate for a successful outcome.
Remain available to assist with cross-coverage as needed.
Maintain and support a working knowledge of HIPAA, government and all applicable compliance standards.
Adheres to all office procedures and guidelines.
Management of staff: *
Prepare work schedules, verify hours worked, approve time off requests and monitor PTO schedules for hourly rate employees.
Assist with the interview and recruitment of PBS, LLC employees.
Assist with the annual evaluation and disciplinary action of PBS, LLC employees.
Monitor the staff’s daily activity and interact with them at a minimum of three times daily.
Coach employees and provide manageable goals when they are not reaching quota in either quality or quantity.
Review and respond to employee questions, concerns and issues within a 24-48 hour period.
Implement training to staff using current accurate documentation and document training process using established company status and progress procedures.
Report any disruptive behavior patterns to the Administrative Director with a recommendation of resolution.
Maintain anecdotal notes of discussions or intermittent occurrences as they pertain to individual employees.
Support and enforce policy and procedure to all staff members.
ADDITIONAL FUNCTIONS:
Remain available to interact with difficult clientele telephonically
Assist with billing duties as needed.
Assist with special projects as needed.
All duties as assigned.
Assist the Administrative Director with employee evaluation, written and verbal reprimands.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS:

· Five years of advanced billing support experience in a corporate setting.

· Knowledge of business software including word processing, spreadsheets and application presentations.

· Exceptional verbal and written communication skills to be utilized in interfacing with all levels of management.

· Excellent organizational skills and ability to manage multiple and diverse priorities simultaneously, meeting deadlines as required.

· Ability to handle highly confidential information.

· Ability to exercise independent judgment.

· CPC certification preferred.

· Ability to lift a minimum of 35 pounds and sit for long periods of time.

Work Environment:

The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those and employee encounters while performing the duties of this job. Pathology Billing Services provides equal employment opportunities (EEO) to all employees and applicants for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, age, disability, and gender identity. PBS complies with applicable state and local laws governing nondiscrimination in employment in every location in which the company has facilities. This applies to all terms and conditions of employment including, recruiting, hiring, placement, promotion, termination, layoff, recall, transfer, leave of absence, compensation, and training.

Job Type: Full-time

Benefits:
401(k)
Dental insurance
Health insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Supplemental Pay:
Bonus pay
Experience:
Management: 5 years (Required)
Pathology Billing: 5 years (Required)

Coding Certification (Preferred)

One location

pbsaz.com

Software Developer - Integration*
Immediate Opening!*
A dynamic Akron / Cleveland area company is looking for an experienced software developer. The Integration Developer designs, develops, tests, maintains and enhances multiple systems serving internal users as well as our suppliers and customers. The Integration Developer interacts with IT and other internal business partners to deliver systems that advance company strategy and improve the enterprise capability of IT.
Candidates need to demonstrate experience in the following skillsets: *
· Proven technical expertise in the design, development, coding, testing, and debugging of enterprise software.

· Strong knowledge of web services (WSDL, Soap, Restful).

· Experience working with relational databases.

· Experience authoring and maintaining data access and / or database queries.

· Familiar with standard software design patterns, methodologies, and the MVC architecture.

· Proficient in the following technologies: C#, .NET, .NET Core, HTML5, CSS3, MsSQL, MySQL, ReactJS.

· Experience working with and/or administering Microsoft IIS

· Experience with SYSPRO’s ERP package a plus but not required
Candidates must be able to execute the following functions: *
· Creates and deploys code and configuration associated with support and project work across our application portfolio.

· Assists in creating, evolving and standardizing technical processes such as source code management, continuous integration, etc.

· Submits code and configuration with high levels of quality, performance, security, scalability and extensibility.

· Assists in the creation and evaluation of business requirements and project plans.
Other requirements include: *
· Takes pride in delivering work on time and with quality

· Good problem solving and decision making abilities

· Ability to learn quickly in a fast-paced environment

· Ability to both work independently and with teams

· Effectively juggles a continuous mix of support and project work

· Able to work off hours / provide on-call support when needed

The ideal candidate must be a self-starter, able to work independently, and have experience in the skillsets mentioned above. This position requires a highly responsible and organized individual with a good work ethic and a minimum of two years of experience using the tools and technologies noted above.

Compensation is commensurate with experience.

The MRI Tech is responsible for performing medical imaging examinations under the direction of a physician to assist in the medical diagnosis or treatment of illness or injury.

Job Essentials

Ensures proper patient identification, order verification, and prepares the patient for the exam.
Performs MRI examinations per department protocol.
Understands cross sectional anatomy and demonstrates anatomical positioning competency.
Critiques own films.
Completes studies within acceptable time limitations without compromising patient care or the quality of the examination.
In coordination with the radiologist, selects proper scanning techniques and protocols.
Demonstrates knowledge and understanding of protocol relating to contrast administration. As ordered by the physician and under radiologist or physician supervision administers intravenous contrast material to patients.
Practices appropriate infection control and sterile techniques.
Understands and operates all MRI equipment and related information systems appropriately to ensure that quality images are produced. Exhibits understanding and proficiency with electronic imaging.
Incumbent views, transfers, archives, and manipulates images.
Exhibits a working knowledge of the MRI scanner. Troubleshoots when needed and understands the shutdown and start up procedures.
Exhibits a working knowledge of the magnet, cryogens, gradient amplifiers, and all relevant computer hardware and software.
Understands the Quench procedure and when it should be performed.
Adheres to and understands the MRI safety policy and the FOUR ZONE concept.
Understands proper MR magnet safety in an event of an emergency.
Thoroughly and accurately completes all required documentation including time stamps and image storage.
Follows appropriate protocol for medical necessity, coding and charging, obtaining consents if necessary, documenting any events that may occur for quality, maintaining a current QC program for ACR and reporting any equipment failures or problems.

Minimum Qualifications

ARRT registered technologist.
and -
Current Utah State Licensure (for positions in Utah) in order to administer RX.
and -
Basic life support (BLS) certification for healthcare providers.

One year of experience in MRI.
and -
Post-hire expectation: Meets departmental IV certification competency within three months of hire.
and -
Post-hire expectation: (Where applicable) Must complete the controlled substance module within six months of hire.
and -
Post-hire expectation: (Where applicable) Must complete the initial moderate sedation module within six months of hire.
and -
(Where applicable) Must complete the initial moderate sedation module within six months of hire.

Preferred Qualifications

MR registered by ARRT.

Shift Details

Full Time, 36 hrs per week. Call shifts required.

Physical Requirements:

Hearing/Listening, Lifting, Manual Dexterity, Seeing, Standing.

Location:

Utah Valley Hospital

Provo

Utah

36

Job Title: Licensed Therapist or Licensure Therapist under supervision required
Job Description:
POSITION DESCRIPTION: *
Licensure or licensure under supervision required (LPC, LMFT, LADC-MH, and/or LCSW) to work with high risk youth & families. Therapeutic services to be delivered in the community, school and office setting. Continued employment contingent upon issuance of professional license within agreed upon time period.
POSITION QUALIFICATIONS: *
Master's degree in social work, psychology, counseling or a related field.Licensure or licensure under supervision required (LPC, LMFT, LADC-MH, and/or LCSW) Certified BHRS & Case Manager in addition to above license

Must have and maintain a valid OK state driver’s license

Provide individual, family, and group counseling for youth and families.
Offer the highest quality of professional counseling service in each counseling session.
Provide ethical counseling services congruent with agency policy and effective clinical practice.
Interact with youth and peers in a consistent, compassionate, positive and reasonable manner.
Monitor the progress the client is making toward his/her treatment goals.
Keep accurate and complete files on each client as outlined by agency policy and applicable Department of Mental health and Substance Abuse Services and CARF standards and criteria.
Make and facilitate appropriate and timely referrals (including inpatient and residential programs) as needed by the client to support their recovery, attain treatment goals, and to promote the client’s overall quality of life.
Meet established productivity requirements.
Supervise graduate student interns, practicum students and/or volunteers as needed.
Work flexible schedule to meet the needs of clients (some evenings required)
Assist in maintaining a work place environment conducive to good clinical practice.
Attend and be prepared for all relevant agency staff meetings and functions.
Provide support services to assist the agency in meeting its mission.
Represent the agency professionally in the community as needed.
Relentlessly show up and be present in young people’s lives, especially through times of relapse and crisis
Commit to engage in personal and professional growth and competence development, participate in organization training activities to increase capacity to serve youth every day
Keep supervisor fully informed at all times

Participates in team, shift change and staff meetings
POSITION REQUIREMENTS: *Two to five years’ experience in individual, family and group mental health and substance abuse counseling, experience working with high-risk youth, knowledge and understanding of adolescent and family dynamics, a variety of treatment modalities and mediation techniques, including substance abuse, knowledge and working understanding of the juvenile justice system, understanding of Medicaid system and agency certifications (ODMHSAS Standards and CARF Standards).
SKILLS/KNOWLEDGE: *
Ability to recommend and support changes necessary to improve program, ability to use MS Office software and database systems (i.e.JOLTS), advanced administrative abilities (organizing, time management, recording, reporting), must be able to communicate effectively, compassionate and tolerant of a wide variety of people, bilingual skills in Spanish a plus.

High school or equivalent (Required)

United States (Required)

One location

Health insurance
Dental insurance
Vision insurance
Retirement plan

The Wellness Nurse is an RN who provides wellness nursing care to the elderly residents living in a Bethany Community. The Wellness Department provides supportive services, including, but not limited to: home care, personal care, homemaking, light housekeeping, medication reminders, laundry/linens, and grocery shopping. The Wellness Nurse will work closely with the Director of Wellness to conduct assessments of residents and to develop individual care plans. The Nurse will also provide direction and support to the team of certified nursing assistants (CNA’s) who provide care to the residents. This wellness position provides emotional and social support to residents and families as they age in place in their community, and they will work closely with residents and families in order to provide a high-quality way of life by offering services and supports to residents for which they may qualify. The Wellness Nurse should have experience with and understanding of an elderly population and the associated programs upon which they rely, such as Medicare and Medicaid, as well as other state and/or federal programs.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS*
Develop individual care plans for residents based upon the assessment and physician’s recommendations. Interview residents, family members, and care givers as needed to develop an individualized care plan.
Provide formal case management (ie. evaluation of health, psychological and social needs, development of an individually tailored case plan for services and periodic reassessment of the resident’s situation and needs) for a resident when such service is not available through the general community.
Be available to meet with all residents regardless of program participation, to discuss health and wellness and to encourage participation in a program when deemed appropriate.
Be available and on-call during off hours to advise CNA’s when needed, or report to work to provide coverage in case of a staff shortage or schedule change.
Assist the Director with regular audits and reviews as needed, such as the bi-annual Assisted Living recertification.
Provide back-up nursing services to all Bethany sites as needed and requested
Participation as a member of the Bethany Professional Assessment Committee (PAC) which retains oversight for the HUD Congregate Housing Services Program (CHSP).
Coordinate care with the resident, family member(s), physician(s), insurance companies, Area Agency on Aging (AAA), Aging Service Access Point (ASAP) and other health care providers and relevant parties.
Attend training and professional development courses and sessions in order to remain current with the industry, health care programs, and initiatives.
COMPETENCIES*
Knowledge of Federal and State programs (Medicare, Medicaid, MassHealth, Group Adult Foster Care, Senior Care Options (SCO’s), Home and Community Based Waiver Program, Massachusetts State Home Care Program, PACE program)
Experience with home-care of community based software (or web-based) systems is required.
Knowledge of and experience with Electronic Health Records (EHR’s) is highly desired
Organizational skills, interpersonal skills, excellent verbal and written communication skills
Experience and ability to work with an elderly population.
Intermediate to advanced computer skills are required. Experience with Word, Excel and the internet is required.
PREPARATION, KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES*
A valid and current Registered Nurse (RN) license is required for this position.
A valid and current driver’s license is required
A minimum of 3 to 5 years of nursing experience is required.
Experience with an elderly population, the aging process, elder services, disability services, eligibility for and procedures of Federal and applicable State entitlement programs, legal liability issues relating to providing service coordination, drug and alcohol use and abuse, and mental health issues is preferred.
Demonstrated working knowledge of supportive services and other resources for senior citizens and non-elderly disabled.
Demonstrated ability to advocate, organize, problem solve and provide results for the elderly and non-elderly disabled.
WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS*
Ability to read, write and communicate in English is required.
Transportation availability and ability to travel between locations is required.
Ability to sit, stand, crouch, kneel, and lift up to 25 pounds is required.
Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $27.00 - $30.00 per hour

Benefits:
403(b)
Dental insurance
Disability insurance
Flexible spending account
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
Monday to Friday
Experience:
Nursing: 3 years (Required)
Location:
Haverhill, MA 01830 (Required)
License:
RN (Required)
Language:
English (Required)
Work authorization:
United States (Required)
This Job Is Ideal for Someone Who Is:
Dependable -- more reliable than spontaneous
Adaptable/flexible -- enjoys doing work that requires frequent shifts in direction

www.bethanycommunities.org

The ACTIA Group with companies in 15 countries is a world leader in the development and commercialization of automotive electronics, including EV powertrains, Li-ion battery packs, and battery management systems (BMS). ACTIA offers power dense, fully integrated EV powertrains ranging from 50 to 180 kW and various battery packs of different chemistries ranging from 12V to >600V. ACTIA Corp, located in Elkhart, IN, is the site in North America responsible for supporting domestic customers and programs.

Summary*:

Work as a cooperative member of the Engineering team to assist the department in producing a smooth, efficient flow of quality work through the department. Will receive direction and work assignments from other members of the Engineering department, in coordination with the immediate supervisor. Extensive electrical knowledge is expected with formal training or verifiable experience required.
Job Specific Competencies: *
1. **Engineering*
Databus messaging structure and its application
Small signal analog electronic design or display design
Electronic production process and methodology
Software design principles and acceptable practices
Understanding of project management
Electrical design of automotive electronics with an emphasis on identifying replacements for obsolete components and adapting circuitry to incorporate (E)
Supports Feasibility process (E)
Investigates new technologies and processes that can be used to create competitive products (E)
Researches engineering processes and methods to improve engineering efficiency (E)
2. **Quality*
Troubleshoots and performs root cause analysis of nonfunctional products (E)
3. **Documentation*
Produces documentation as required per ISO 9001:2015 and APQP processes (E)
Maintains time records and project reports (E)
4. **Manufacturing*
Aids in the construction of prototypes
5. **Collaboration*
Collaborates with all engineering teams (electrical, hardware, software and project management) and other departments to organize and administrate electrical sustainment projects (E)
Assists with product definitions
Provides technical assistance to customers (E)
Ability to train electrical engineers
6. **Legal Compliance*
Ensure legal compliance with state, federal and OSHA requirements
Ensure ISO procedures are followed
Maintain compliance with all company policies and procedures
Minimum Qualifications and Education*
Bachelor’s degree in EE or EET, or equivalent combination of education and experience.
3 years minimum experience
Proficient in OrCAD and Altuim
Highly motivated/organized
Strong leadership and communication
Effectively works with personnel at all levels
Results oriented; strong problem solving skills
Ability to read, speak, write and understand the English language
Ability to solve practical problems with a variety of concrete variables in situations where only limited standardization exists.
Working Conditions*
Movement
This position needs to occasionally move about inside the office and on the production floor. Frequently required to reach with hands and arms. Occasionally required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel objects, tools, or controls; and stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl
Operate/Use
Must be able to operate a computer and other office productivity machinery (i.e. copier, printer, calculator)
Ascend/Descend
Rarely ascends/descends stairs to reach archived files
Communicate
This position frequently communicates with co-workers, managers and supervisors. Must be able to exchange accurate information in these situations.
Transport
This position frequently lifts or moves 25 pounds, occasionally moves up to 50 pounds for various needs.
Work Environment
Relatively quiet but fast paced.
Travel
Occasional travel to customers and vendors, with overnight stays, may be required.

Are you a enthusiastic, motivated Software Developer interested in an opportunity to work in the Fort Wayne, IN area? Then join our team and contribute to programs that save lives and enable the freedoms we enjoy.

We are looking for Software Engineer to help with the continued results of our products, and development of next generation systems. Every day at Raytheon Intelligence & Space, our extraordinary engineers are empowered for excellence and inspired to invent in an inclusive environment where work-life balance is an elegant solution, not a slogan.
Typical job functions for Software Engineer include:

• Participation on collaborative, cross-disciplined integrated product teams, often employing agile software development techniques and resources to plan, design, develop, test, and integrate complex software and systems solutions.
• Being responsible for some or all of a Software product, contributing as a software team member.
• Responsibilities spanning the full lifecycle of product development, from architecture and design, through integration, test, and field support.
• Working in an Engineering organization with the highest software engineering process maturity level as recognized by the Software Engineering Institute.

Required Skills:
• Minimum 2 years of Professional Software development experience.
• Experience with C, C++, Java, or other computer languages.
• U.S. Citizenship status is required as this position will require the ability to access US only data systems
• Must have a BS / BA with a major in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Math, or other related field.
• Must be able to acquire SECRET Clearance within first year of employment.

Desired Skills:
• Experience with Agile lifecycle process including Scrum, Continuous Integration and Test Driven Development Methodologies.
• Experience with real-time operating systems (RTOS), embedded programming, processor/board architecture and design.
• Experience with some or all phases of software development: architecture, design, implementation, testing, and system integration.
• Experience in Communications (Radios) or Electronic Warfare domains.
• MS / MA with a major in Software Engineering, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Math, or other related field.

Raytheon Intelligence & Space is a developing provider of integrated sensor, communication and electronic warfare systems giving military compels accurate and timely actionable information for the network-centric battlefield. You will continue your career working on cutting-edge technology by day, while in your free time you can have perfect work-life balance in this family-friendly
small-town feel for a city its size.

We offer extensive reward and recognition programs in compensation, career development, health care, educational assistance, maternal and paternal leave, flexible work schedules, child/adult backup care, 401(k), paid holidays and paid time off. In addition, this position is eligible for relocation assistance.
169863

Raytheon is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, age, color, religion, creed, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability, or protected Veteran status.

Overview


This position is responsible for research, planning, design, and testing of software modules applicable to prototype medical devices or development tools.

Responsibilities


Essential Job Functions:
Implement software design proposals into prototypes.
Analyze potential algorithms and their potential for efficient embedded implementation.
Consult with other engineers or managers to evaluate interfaces between hardware and software, and define appropriate software architecture.
Research software design proposals, identify appropriate options, and perform experiments to determine potential software design feasibility or application.
Formulate and design software structure, for implementing scientific analysis and mathematical models to predict and measure outcome and consequences of design.
Evaluate prototype performance and recommend design modifications.
Create and release design requirement specifications and design description documents.
Qualifications


Required Education & Experience:

Bachelors Degree in Engineering, Biotechnology, Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Engineering Technology or equivalent technical Degree; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Required Knowledge, Skills & Abilities:
Experience in software development in an embedded system.
Experience with C code development, real time signal processing, and I/O control for microcontrollers.
Demonstrated proficiency working with computers and MS operating systems.
Knowledge of data acquisition tools and techniques.
Proficiency in data preparation, analysis, and presentation.
Self-Starter; Highly-Organized; Detail-Oriented; Highly-Motivated; Strong Problem Solver; Independent Worker & Strong Team Player; Analytical; Strong Interpersonal & Verbal/Written Communication;
Customer-Focused; Results-Driven; Initiative; “Can-Do” Attitude
Preferred Qualifications:
2 years of experience
Experience with ISO 13485.
Familiarity with the FDA GMP.
Experience in software development for medical devices.
Experience with assembly-level code development
Physical Requirements:
Able to sit, and/or stand for 8 hours a day.
Nonin Medical is an Equal Opportunity/Affirmative Action Employer - Minority/Female/Disabled/Veteran.

Renaissance Alliance Insurance Services (RAIS) is the industry leader for independent agency networks, with innovative high growth plans. Those with an innate drive to win will be a great fit for this role and rapidly expanding organization. RAIS provides technology, business services, and market access to independent agencies in New England and beyond. The company currently controls ~$750M in property & casualty insurance premiums across personal and commercial products. With aggressive goals set, RAIS plans to triple the size of the business in the next 4 years.

The Agency Growth Partner is responsible for managing assigned member agency relationships and activities. Paramount among the responsibilities are maintaining member satisfaction and fostering member premium growth.

This position is based in our Central Massachusetts office. Remote arrangements will also be considered. Frequent visits to our member agents across New England are required.
_EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE_*
Bachelor’s degree or equivalent in years of experience and training
Minimum seven years of insurance industry experience, preferably agency experience or company experience with a concentrated agency focus
Knowledge of Microsoft Office applications required including Excel and PowerPoint
Knowledge of agency management systems such as Vertafore AMS360, Applied Epic and EZ Lynx is a plus
_ESSENTIAL DUTIES AND RESPONSIBILITIES_*
Other duties may be assigned.
Engages in frequent contact with assigned RAIS agencies; visits agencies regularly to build and maintain positive, strong relationships; identifies agency concerns and communicates them to appropriate RAIS managers for positive resolution; follows-up with agency to confirm resolution.
Works to gain trust at all agency levels. Must be able to work credibly with agency principals, customer facing staff and all levels in-between
Utilizes a data driven approach to identify opportunities for innovative growth initiatives and works in cooperation with agencies to design these initiatives.
Leverages new technology and tools to deliver improved service capabilities designed to foster organic premium growth.
Applies critical thinking in analyzing agency metrics and regularly reviews and interprets key metric reports with assigned agencies.
Sets agency benchmarks and goals for growth initiatives based upon data analytics.
Designs and implements practices to improve efficiencies and increase agency growth, based on the specific commitment, capabilities and capacity of the agency.
Serves as a catalyst for RAIS programs and services to foster growth and efficiency in member agencies.
Trains agencies on new or enhanced RAIS operational processes, procedures, software and value-added services, either by training agency staff directly or by engaging appropriate RAIS staff.
Evaluates training tools and supporting documents for their usefulness to customers. Identifies and communicates areas for improvement to achieve maximum effectiveness for agency users.
Collaborates with RAIS managers and staff members in defining and designing elements required to deliver exemplary services and products for the benefit of RAIS agency members and their customers.
Documents agency visits and projects in appropriate data systems. Prepares and shares timely status reports based on this data.
Attends professional association, carrier, and industry educational and networking meetings as appropriate.
Maintains consistent corporate image throughout product lines, promotional materials and events.
_SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES_*
None currently

Job Title: Chief Pilot - 5 years Part 135 Experience Required
Job Description:
\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_\_
CHIEF PILOT Job Description *
Salmon, ID: Full-Time/Year-Round *
SUMMARY*
Gem Air is a small air-service provider based in Salmon, Idaho; our rural mountain town offers easy, out-your- backdoor access to rafting, fishing, mountain biking, hunting, skiing and more. Our mission at Gem Air is to provide our customers with safe, reliable, and clean air service from a courteous and professional staff.

We are looking for an experienced Chief Pilot to join our team as we grow. To thrive in this position, you’ll need to be an experienced FAR Part 135 pilot, be highly organized and comfortable managing paperwork and office duties, and be willing to learn and adapt. The workload and environment is seasonal, and very dynamic. Work demands in some seasons are high, with fast-paced, frequent changes to needs and schedules.

This position allows you to keep your pilot skills sharp and exercise your management skills at the same time.
There is room for growth within the organization. Please apply to this position only if you feel comfortable with the idea of staying with the job for 2+ years.
THE EXPECTATIONS AND RESPONSIBILITIES *
• Take pride in your work, and the work of your team members

• Conduct yourself in a professional, honest, fair, and ethical business manner at all times.

• Reports to the Director of Operations.

• Meets the requirements of FAR 119.71.

• Performs duties as a flight crewmember when required.

• Is responsible for maintaining a liaison with the Director of Operations in all operations matters.

• Coordinates training needs to ensure that adequately trained pilots are available for all trip needs.

• Is responsible for crewmember standardization.

• Ensures that a properly qualified Pilot-in-Command is designated for each flight.

• Ensures that revisions to the Operations Manual, Operations Specifications, FARs, and NOTAMs are made available to all pilots.

• Designates check airmen and aircraft flight instructors.

• Shall participate in the investigation of, and make a report to the Director of Operations, on any aircraft accident, reportable incident, records discrepancy, or airman flight violation.

• Is responsible, with the Director of Operations, for ensuring that pilot records are maintained to FAA standards.

• Is responsible for aircraft charts and related publications.

• Works closely with the Director of Maintenance to ensure that aircraft maintenance problems do not unnecessarily disrupt scheduled flight operations.

• Ensures that a copy of each load manifest, weight and balance form, is retained at the crew base for a minimum of 30 days.

• Is responsible for the aircraft's "stores" and other expendables used with the aircraft.

• Oversee hiring, training, and management of the flight team, to include responsibilities as a training captain and check airman

• Maintain excellent rapport and working relationships with all team members, governmental agencies, customers, vendors, suppliers, etc.

• Other duties as required
APPLICANT REQUIRED QUALIFICATIONS *
• Proven track record of organized and efficient paperwork management
• Extremely comfortable with computers and software
• At least 2 years management experience
• Must hold an ATP
• Minimum of 4000 hrs. PIC time
• Minimum of 5 years part 135 experience
• Backcountry and/or dirt strip experience
• Multiengine and turbine engine experience
• 500 hrs. Single pilot IFR PIC experience
• Training captain and check airman experience in part 135 environment
APPLICANT PREFERRED QUALIFICATIONS *
• Chief Pilot Experience
• Caravan PIC Hours
• Chieftain PIC Hours
SALARY AND BENEFITS *
• $60,000 and up, final salary DOE
• 401K eligibility after 6 months, up to 4% employer match
• Health Insurance Benefit
• Paid Vacation/Sick Leave

Job Title: Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer (Android Developer)
Job Description:
_To be considered for this position: You must currently reside in Colorado and be eligible to work in the US. Given the timeline for this position, we are currently not able to offer sponsorship, or consider those wanting to relocate._
\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\*\**
QualityLogic is seeking a *Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer (Android Developer) *to join our operations team. This job is well suited to individuals who have extensive experience with software quality assurance or mobile app development. Our Senior QA Engineers are expected to be able to build automation test frameworks, contribute to existing test automation efforts, and to mentor junior QA Engineers.

The ideal candidate will have strong software development skills in several programming languages, experience leading small teams of developers, and a proven track record in software development or quality assurance.

Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer (Android Developer) *_Required Qualifications_**: *
*Five years’ experience in mobile app development*
*Strong programming experience in at least one of the following languages: JAVA, Kotlin, Apple Swift*
*Experience with GIT and performing code reviews*
*Expert knowledge of SQL and no-SQL databases*
*Ability to write unit tests*
*Experience leading small development teams*
*Strong Analytical skills*
*Customer Focus and Relationship Building, including demonstrated ability to work well with business analysts, developers, management and end users*
*Have a positive, “can do” attitude*
Senior Software Quality Assurance Engineer (Android Developer)*_Preferred Qualifications_*:
Quality assurance experience, including documenting defects, building test plans, and performing exploratory testing
Experience with other programming languages such as Python and Ruby
