Job Title: Commission Only - Experienced salesperson - restaurant software.
Job Description:
We are looking for e*xperienced sales persons* only, specifically, sales to restaurants.

If you do not have recent or relevant sales experiencein your resume, respectfully, we will not accept your application. Thank you for understanding.

However, if your experience includes more than *2 years of sales to restaurants as a vendor or supplier* including cold calling, or some other type of service to small restaurants in your area, we want to hear from you.

Compensation is *Commission only,* and all Sales Contractors will be 1099 independent contractors. If you are not familiar with this lifestyle, it may not be for you. There is no health insurance, and no guaranteed income. You earn based on what you can produce. Please be aware of this up front since this type of compensation will not be suitable for most people's life situation.
Restaurants need our help*
Many local and regional governments have recently ordered that all restaurants shut down dine in service, or severely limit their capacity. As a result, all restaurants must have online ordering in order to survive in the new reality.

The existing well known platforms for online ordering and delivery are very expensive or difficult for restaurant owners to set up and use, and many do not connect restaurant owners directly to their own customers for feedback and follow up.

You can help them solve this problem. We are a small tech startup who have created an online ordering platform for takeout and car hop that is affordable, simple to use, and accessible for late adopters of technology in a number of ways. But we need your help to reach them.

We are searching for Outside Sales representatives and account managers willing to work as *independent contractors* in assigned territories throughout the United States.

Top performers could have the potential to earn a handsome income. Our associates earn 50% of net on all residual monthly subscription fees. Competitors charge in the range of $30 - $300+ per month for similar services, so you can do the math. We handle all the tech development and tech support for the platform. You handle customer service that is not tech related only for your clients, such as training and help with setup.
Why should you work with us?*
Be your own boss - make your own schedule, work at your own pace.
Residual Commissions – Sell once, keep earning every month. As long as the contract is active.
Growing Industry – Many tech startups in restaurant technology have gone from zero to billion dollar businesses, you can become an expert in that industry.
Earning Potential – As a sales agent, your ability to grow is limited only by your ability and ambition.
Flexible Schedule – You can create your own hours to best meet your goals.
Our Value Propositions – Our mission is to provide an overwhelming value for our clients.
Required Qualifications: *
As previously mentioned, this is an offer for an *independent contractor* as defined by your state of residence. Compensation is *Commission only*. All Sales Contractors are 1099 independent contractors and are responsible for incorporating for themselves within 30 days if not already incorporated.

We are primarily looking for sales experience, especially sales to restaurants, such as a restaurant supplier or service, who has many contacts with small businesses in their local area.
*2+ years experience selling products or services to local restaurants *in your area.
Motivated professional engaged in a long-term career in sales.
Self-starter, but able to work within a team environment.
Compassionate individual with a passion for helping small business owners succeed. Ethical behavior and integrity is required.
Background free from serious criminal offenses, current criminal investigations, or restraining orders.
Familiarity with social media and social media advertising.
Comfortable with software and technology or willing to learn.
Dedication to training to continuously improve as a salesperson.
Have own laptop, smartphone.
Ability to network and self-generate sales
Driver’s license, auto insurance, and vehicle required
Preferred Qualifications: *
Connections with many local independent restaurants
In some areas such as Southern California, it would be an advantage to be a native or fluent Spanish speaker.
Experience in networking within the community, especially restaurants.
Sales Representative responsibilities include: *
Cold Calling restaurants throughout assigned territory to sell online menu and online ordering Software As A Service (SAAS) products to restaurants.
Presenting our value proposition and cost-benefit analyses to existing and potential customers.
Maintaining positive business relationships to ensure future sales.
Negotiate prices and contracts.
Demonstrate products using phone and laptop, and emphasizes product features.
Set up and maintain account for restaurant by creating and updating online menus, or training their staff how to do it.
Take photos, or schedule local photographers, or train restaurant to take photos of menu items and upload them to the website.
Help restaurant set up Google My Business, Facebook Pages, Instagram etc.
Follow up on new leads and referrals resulting from field activity or lead generation.
Quotes and negotiates prices and credit terms and prepares sales contracts for customer accounts obtained.
Our company provides equal opportunities to all employees and contractors without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. We expect the same from our contractors, associates, business partners, suppliers, and affiliates.

\*\* Because of Covid-19, and that this role may require visiting restaurants in person (at your discretion). If so, you must be free from conditions that are considered as risk factors for Covid-19 infection as defined by the CDC. https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/need-extra-precautions/people-with-medical-conditions.html

You also may wish to interact with restaurant owners in person at times. If so you should be familiar with, and willing to take precautions such as wearing masks and social distancing as appropriate.

Job Title: LPN - Private Duty - Nights - $1,000 Sign-On Bonus
Job Description:
Description:

Offering Premium Pay, Comprehensive Benefits Package

including Paid-Time-Off, Vacation Pay and 401 (k) with company match

7:00 p.m. to 7:00 a.m. - 12-hour shifts

Week #1 - Monday/Tuesday/Saturday/Sunday

Week #2 - Wednesday/Thursday/Friday

Rotating Nights Every Other Week

Patient Home Location - Buchanan TN

Branch Office Location - Martin TN

Providing individualized care . . . one patient at a time

Who we are

AbilisHealth is a leading provider of home health and skilled private duty services. We cover 61 counties, with close to 500 employees serving nearly 4,000 patients in the past year. Our model of tirelessly serving patients, caregivers, and the community will become the industry benchmark. Our success is largely based upon hiring ambitious team members who provide outstanding patient care.

Caregiver opportunity

We are seeking an empathetic, motivated and committed individual to fill our compassionate Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) opportunity. The skilled LPN will provide nursing assessment, planning, and care to maximize the comfort and health of our patients and their families. If you have a heart to serve others by caring for patients’ individualized needs the way you'd care for the needs of your own family, we want you on our team.

What this role can offer you

In this role, you will provide direct patient care within a patient’s home. You will have the satisfaction of knowing you're ensuring the patient receives optimal care, by assessing, planning, implementing, reevaluating and revising care and coordinating resources. Among other responsibilities, you will update and maintain patient records and implement orders for medications and treatments.

What AbilisHealth offers

FUN, POSITIVE, and PROFESSIONAL culture
HIGHLY COMPETITIVE pay.
Be EMPOWERED by working INDEPENDENTLY with a FLEXIBLE work schedule
BENEFITS: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, and Life insurance plus 401 (k) with company match and Paid Time Off
Generous referral BONUSES
Continuing education and refresher training.

Responsibilities

Perform selected nursing procedures within the scope of LPN practice
Provide patient and family teaching according to plan outlined by the RN
Monitor patient's vital signs and make specific measurements and observations
Monitor and record intake and output. Report significant changes immediately
Observe, assess and record patient's physical and mental condition and reports any changes
Administer medications as instructed and as ordered by the physician and instructed by the RN. Document the patient's file accordingly
Attend and participate in multi-disciplinary patient case conferences, staff meetings and in-service education programs as assigned
Cooperate with on-call schedule, weekends and after hour visits, as necessary
. Requirements:
License Practical Nurse / LPN license in the state of Tennessee, in good standing
Previous experience in home health, skilled private duty nursing, hospice, hospital or skill nursing facility setting
Familiarity with medical software and equipment / Brightree aplus
Ability to build rapport with patients
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Reliable transportation, valid driver's license and current auto insurance

Observe and follow all safety policies and procedures in compliance with the organizational rules. Responsible for his/her safety as well as awareness of team safety.
Read job specifications and work orders to plan work procedures
Diagnose and repair engine issues with or without computer software
Diagnose and repair chassis, electrical system issues with or without computer software
Understand hydraulic and pneumatic concepts
Maintain a clean and organized work area and toolbox
Possible 5% to 10% of scheduled travel for service calls

Ability to follow instructions and be professional

All of our installers are familiar with installing power supply wiring and troubleshooting residential types of electrical components. Purpose/Summary:Under direction of the Application Development Manager, focuses on all code development and API integrations relating specifically to digital banking and other open API Digital Dept. systems during the project development stage. Responsible for thorough testing and complete documentation of all software development. Evaluates and modifies existing software as required and ensures completeness and accuracy of testing those solutions and their documentation. Documents, evaluates and updates developer standards around SDLC best practices. Works with Product Owners on expanding the use and efficacy of critical business systems. Manages and assists in implementation of new software integrations and Digital Dept. projects. Development will involve review of all enterprise-wide processes to streamline, reduce inefficiency and improve the member experience. Works closely with the Director of Digital Banking and other Digital Dept. staff on project and system reviews and makes recommendations to Digital Dept. management for implementation.

Essential Duties and Responsibilities:All duties and responsibilities align with Visions Federal Credit Union and are subject to reform at-will of the company. Job Duties include, but are not limited to:
• Ability to design, build, program, test and deploy code via multiple software languages using an Agile methodology. Responsible for working within a fast-paced environment working as part of a team to design, build, and support API integration for our staff and members.• Analyze new and existing systems and make recommendations to Digital Dept. management on methods and techniques to be used. Upon approval by the Application Development Manager, assumes the responsibility to carry out software development and enhancements utilizing modern development languages, ensuring that thorough testing occurs, data integrity is maintained, and documentation standards are strictly adhered to.• Work with staff and internal developers to execute strategic initiatives by analyzing and designing process work flows, building, testing and implementing development solutions and ensuring the quality of the system.• Assist clients and managers in the construction of Business cases and opportunity identification efforts to support the further adoption of development solutions throughout the organization.• Manage cross-functional projects to implement custom solutions to create efficiencies and improve the member experience.• Guide, mentor and motivate teams in the execution of day-to-day tasks and in the development of their development duties.• Document and evaluate Credit Union core business processes, enabling and governing processes and sub-processes.• Work as an advisor to other departments conducting streamlining efforts and evaluation.• Research IT systems, Symitar infrastructure, and other analysis tools to be used in development efforts and Digital Dept. initiatives and make recommendations to Digital Dept. management.• Participate in trainings to enhance skills and abilities in required coding languages, including tools and best practices.• Participate in all required and recommended training including, but not limited to, SDK training and demonstrate attained knowledge. Actively pursues and satisfactorily completes development plans.• Adhere to all Credit Union policies, procedures, and regulatory agency requirements including, but not limited to, training activities. Embrace and apply the Credit Union’s mission, vision and core values to all activities and responsibilities. Support the Credit Union’s initiatives by demonstrating teamwork and professionalism.

Job Description

Why consider OPI, and why do people dig working here?
Variety of consulting; new technologies, projects, and people on a regular basis.
Stability; we’ve been around since 1996 and have a diverse mix of clients and technologies to keep us busy, very busy. And we keep a bench. If you’re not on a project, you’re writing software for our internal business functions or you’re learning new technologies. It’s in our benefit to make our consultants as marketable as possible. That’s good for your career.
No politics or management; we don’t get in the way. Why sit in meetings all day when you can code and be productive?
Awesome benefits; free healthcare for your entire family (yes, free), 24 days of PTO + 10 days of sick time, quarterly profit sharing bonuses, you get paid OT, company trips (to Mexico), 3 company lake cabins/homes, various quarterly company events, new Macbook Pro’s, free beer/soda, chips, candy, and so much more.
You work with the best. Do an Object Partners search on LinkedIn and see the types of talent we hire. You truly get to work with intelligent, passionate engineers that share the same goal of building great software the right way.
Low company overhead. It all means more money back into our consultants pockets (profit sharing) or company trips and events to share in the financial success.

Qualifications

Architecture and design of highly available/scalable backend services
JVM service frameworks such as Spring Boot, Grails, Vert.x and Ratpack
Automated testing with tools such as Spock, JUnit and Cucumber
JVM languages such as Java, Groovy, Scala and Clojure
Relational database technologies such as MySQL, Oracle and Postgres
NoSQL technologies such as MongoDB, ElasticSearch and Cassandra
Messaging technologies such as RabbitMQ, Kafka, ActiveMQ, and Amazon SQS
Build tools such as Gradle, Maven and sbt
Cloud based systems such as AWS, Google Compute Engine, Heroku, DigitalOcean, OpenStack, and Rackspace
Passion for software development. Someone that loves what they do, that aren’t just in it for a paycheck. Do you have dev projects going on at home at all times?
Aptitude for learning. New projects, new teams, new technologies means having to adjust and learn all the time. You might get thrown on a Spring or mobile project as well, so having the ability to jump in and get your feet wet without hesitation is important. If you don’t want to grow and learn, we’re not a fit.
Positive, can-do attitude. We can teach the technology, but we can’t teach how to approach client challenges with a positive, helpful demeanor. The best consultants aren’t the most technical (although that sure helps), it’s the consultant that will do whatever it takes to see a client be successful, no matter what they throw at you.

Job Title: Software Engineer - Mission-Focused Integration (TS/SCI with Polygraph)
Job Description:
We're looking for game changers. People who love what they do and who they do it for. Providing consulting services in operational support, intelligence collection, reporting, and data governance, R2C is a leader in delivering solutions for high priority national security concerns. Are you ready for a change?

R2C is seeking Software Engineers to support a client's technical requirements on a mission-focused program within a challenging, dynamic setting located in the Washington Metropolitan Area.
We welcome the most challenging problems facing our national security and apply intellect, talent, and innovation to reach feasible and valuable solutions to each challenge. That means we expect our employees to bring their “A game,” and you have the right to expect the same from the company that employs you. We want to hear your ideas. We want to hear your concerns. We want to make sure you have what you need to do the best you can on the job and grow in your career with us over time. Almost all companies say they have a culture of inclusiveness and that they value employee input, but R2C puts that statement to work every day. It’s time for a change. Come and experience a company that actually cares.

Top Secret/SCI w/ Polygraph
Design, develop, test, and deploy COTS and custom components for systems
Assist in the installation, deployment, and maintenance of the COTS product
Perform configuration changes as needed
Interface with infrastructure teams during upgrades or troubleshooting
Support development and integration of new digital policies
Interface with customers for digital policy creation, policy ingestion, policy integration, and testing
Support implementation of an automated unit and integration testing capability for access control policies and other service components using Junit
Assist in creation of technical documentation
Support end user training on the creation and management of access control policies
Take customer requirements for enhancing custom web applications
Support the development of new digital policies
Interface with customers during digital policy creation, policy ingestion, policy integration, and testing

Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, Information Technology, or similar discipline
Must have an Active TS/SCI clearance with Polygraph
Experience developing, testing, deploying, and maintaining complex application programming interfaces
Experience designing, programming, testing, and delivering custom web applications in Java
Experience with development and integration with COTS applications in a virtual environment
Experience developing and deploying web-based applications on Tomcat and familiarity with JavaScript frameworks
Experience designing, configuring, performing, and evaluating results of back-end, service-based automated testing
Experience writing, testing, deploying, and maintaining complex LINUX shell scripts in a cloud-based, DevOps style environment
Experience with at least one scripting language
Willingness to learn digital policy authoring languages and skills including working with JavaScript, XACML, and COTS digital policy tools
Experience with Amazon Web Services
Rudimentary knowledge of Linux and shell scripting
Experience performing functional, integration, and unit testing
Experience with DevOps, automation and configuration management using tools such as Ansible
Experience with Puppet, Jenkins, and Github
Experience developing RESTful web services with JSON
Experience delivering enterprise level Identity and Access Management services
Experience with SQL, or willingness and ability to learn on basic SQL on the job
Experience developing within an Agile team environment
Experience with Certificate Management (x509)
Experience with overall troubleshooting and debugging in a production environment
Experience with all aspects of workflow tools to include: tool selection, design, implementation, integration, workflow and process design, workflow optimization, and workflow metrics
Experience with risk management to include identifying, citing, ranking, and establishment of appropriate mitigation approaches
Experience with the data management lifecycle, governance, and best practices
The Reports and Requirements Company, LLC (R2C) is a wholly owned subsidiary of Buchanan & Edwards, and provides consulting services in operational support, intelligence collection, reporting, and data governance. Located in Arlington, VA, R2C offers expertise on a variety of national security topics, with specific focus on operational support, technical operations, policies and management of large volumes of data, analysis of large amounts of data, & effective approaches to evaluating and sharing data, and innovative techniques for information collection. Our consultants develop and deliver training programs on subjects including cyber intelligence, data governance and information sharing protocols, intelligence collection, and reporting techniques. R2C has a mission first culture and boasts the benefits & perks of a small company with the resources, stability, and career mobility of a large corporation. R2C is dedicated to fostering, cultivating and preserving a culture of diversity and inclusion. We are committed to crafting a workplace that endorses creativity and innovation, and promotes engagement through open communication, acceptance of new people and ideas, and a supportive team dynamic. R2C is an equal Opportunity Employer – Minorities / Women / Veterans / Individuals with Disabilities / Gender Identity / Sexual Orientation.

About Us

Every Partner, Every Patient, Every Therapist Counts.

Resolute Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation, based in Dallas, Texas, provides premier inpatient rehabilitation services because our patients deserve it.

Every partner at Resolute Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation is committed to making an impact on the patients who they serve. Our patients are at the core of who we are. Here at Resolute Physical Medicine and Rehabilitation, we measure our success by the direct impact we have on improving the quality of life for our employees, patients and residents. Join us to be a part of the resolution patients deserve.

Responsibilities:

The Occupational Therapist is responsible for the assessment of referred patients, ranging in age from 18 years to geriatric who are experiencing medically complex conditions or medical surgical conditions requiring rehabilitation and/or wound care needs.

The Occupational Therapist duties include:

Assumes responsibility in the care of the patient. Performs complete, comprehensive evaluation of patients .
Accurately interprets evaluation findings.
Completes a written plan of care, develops goals based on evaluation findings, and develops a comprehensive program to attain goals.
Implements an occupational therapy treatment program and provides basic occupational therapy treatments.
Demonstrates competency in performing basic occupational therapy skills. Supervises COTA's and Rehab Technicians with regards to individual patient care treatments.
Assesses patients periodically to monitor progress towards treatment goals, and alters goals, plan or program as indicated.
Motivates and instructs patients/caregivers using appropriate methods.
Ensures safe care of patients while adhering to policies, procedures and standards, within budgetary specifications.
Demonstrates good basic skills in time management, supply management, productivity, and flexibility based on patient census and accuracy of practice.
Provides treatment in all areas of the department, which may include inpatient, outpatient, weekends and holidays.
Promotes individual professional growth and development by meeting requirements for mandatory/continuing education, and skills competency.
Supports department-based goals which contribute to the success of the organization; serves as preceptor, mentor, and resource to less experienced staff.
Assists in clinic education efforts, whether to patients, staff, hospital, system or the community
Perform additional duties assigned.

Qualifications

Minimum Qualifications:

Ability to project a professional image
Knowledge of regulatory standards, compliance requirements and hospital policies and procedures
Working knowledge and ability to apply professional standards of practice in job situations
Strong organizational and analytical skills
Working knowledge of computer and software applications used in job functions. (order entry, data entry)

Education and/or Experience:

Graduate of an accredited school for Occupational Therapy.

At least six (6) months of experience directly related to duties and responsibilities.

Certificates, Licenses, Registrations:

Current license for Occupational Therapist in state of employment.
Must maintain current Provider CPR certification throughout employment.

Psychiatric Case Management RN

La Clinica Wellness Center

Full Time/Hourly

Since 1989, La Clinica has strived to improve the quality of life for the diverse communities we serve by providing exceptional, culturally appropriate, accessible, affordable and compassionate quality health care. We serve all people in the Rogue Valley, especially those who face barriers to care. As a primary care medical home, La Clinica serves 30,000 patients annually throughout our six health care centers, 34-chair dental clinic, and mobile health center - a 40 foot converted RV. We are an innovative non-profit organization, and we commit to engage everyone in a welcoming, respectful, and loving way to maintain the dignity and value of all people. We do this work as a committed team that offers high-quality integrated behavioral health and dental care as well as prevention-focused services with an emphasis on wellness,

We are seeking a Psychiatric Case Management Nurse to be part of fast-paced Patient Centered Primary Care setting working closely with our psychiatric provider and their patient panel. The Case Management RN works collaboratively to assess, plan, facilitate and advocate for options and services to meet patient needs related to mental health, substance use and overall physical health through communication and available resources to promote quality cost-effective outcomes.

Responsibilities include the following:

Coordinates care of assigned high-risk and complex patients as identified by a psychiatric provider referral and risk stratification.
Maintains and manages a dynamic patient list for monitoring high-risk and complex patients to prevent and/or intervene early in the disease process. Provides patient teaching regarding diagnosis, treatment plan, medication and wellness. Uses motivational interviewing, goal setting and preventative techniques to lower patient risk of future disease or complications of disease.
Is knowledgeable in chronic disease management and other generalized health conditions as well as mental health and substance use disorder conditions.
Manages the Internal La Clinica Psychiatry Referral including scrubbing for clinical data and determining if referral clinically meets criteria for the Primary Care Behavioral Health Integration (PCBHI) FLOW Psychiatry Program.
Acts as a liaison to the Inpatient Psychiatry Unit and Emergency Department, the Primary Care Teams and Community Mental Health Agency’s to facilitate continuity of care.
Performs emergency Behavioral Health triage assessments on PCBHI Psychiatry FLOW patients who are in crisis and coordinates care with the Primary Care Teams, Behavioral Health Clinicians, wellness coaches, the Psychiatric provider and community partners to address the crisis.
The Psychiatric Case Management RN performs and tracks all clinical reminder activities that may include metabolic syndrome monitoring, medication adherence, AIMS, measurement-based care screenings, suicidal ideation screenings, alcohol and drug use screenings, and other specific program related screenings.
Initiates and facilitates patient centered staffing twice monthly with care team members (PCP, behavioral health, RN Case Manager, MA and community partners) for the development and revision of a comprehensive individualize plan of care with targeted interventions.
Assess barriers to care and provides resources as needed /available.

Education and/or Experience:

Required:

Minimum: Current Oregon RN unrestricted license
BLS HealthCare Provider (First Aid/CPR)
Commitment to working with community partners, patients and staff from a wide range of age, ethnic, economic, cultural and social background
Ensures timely access to care without judgement or bias
Excellent interpersonal communication and problem-solving skills
Skills to intervene and promote reconciliation, compromise and positive outcomes in difficult interactions
Skilled at using electronic health records as applicable to area of work (EPIC preferred)
Able to type a minimum of 40 WPM
Able to use basic computer software applications including word processing and spreadsheets

Preferred:

Bachelor’s degree in Nursing (BSN)
Two years’ experience in acute care or ambulatory care setting within the last five years
Population health case management experience
Experience working with patients with mental health and substance use conditions.
Effective verbal and written communication skills.
Strong analytical and critical thinking skills.
Basic knowledge of adult learning models

Benefits Include the Potential for the Following:
Medical, Dental, and Vision Insurance
Voluntary Accident, Short Term Disability, and Critical Illness Insurance
403(b) Retirement Savings Plan with Available Company Match
Organization Paid Standard Life Insurance
Flexible Spending Accounts (FSA) and Health Savings Account (HSA)
HRSA Loan Repayment Options (SUD, NHSC, NURSE Corps) and the Oregon Healthcare Provider Incentive Program
Wellness Programs Such as Cooking, Zumba, Yoga, and Gardening
Personal and Professional Development Seminars

Equity Statement:

At La Clinica, we commit to engage everyone in a welcoming, respectful, and loving way and to maintain the dignity and value of all people above everything else. These standards align with our organization’s vision of absolute excellence, open-hearted community, and well-being for all.

For more information, please visit our website at: https://laclinicahealth.org/patients/approach/

Overview:

Who is Virgin Pulse?

Virgin Pulse, founded as part of Sir Richard Branson’s famed Virgin Group, helps organizations build employee health and wellbeing into the DNA of their corporate cultures. As the only company to deliver a powerful, mobile-first digital platform infused with live services, including coaching and biometric screenings, Virgin Pulse’s takes a high-tech-meets-high-touch-approach to engage employees in improving across all aspects of their health and wellbeing, every day – from prevention and building a healthy lifestyle to condition and disease management to condition reversal, all while engaging users daily in building and sustaining healthy habits and behaviors. A global leader in health and wellbeing, Virgin Pulse is committed to helping change lives and businesses around the world for good so that people and organizations can thrive, together. Today, more than 3100 organizations across the globe are using Virgin Pulse’s solutions to improve health, employee wellbeing and engagement, reduce costs and create strong workplace cultures.

Who are our employees?

At Virgin Pulse we’re passionate about changing lives for good. We want to make a difference in the world by helping people be healthy so they can perform at their best, every day, at work and home. Our award-winning solutions support leading employers in improving and simplifying the employee health and wellbeing journey and engaging people in all aspects of their health. But our world-class products and programs are nothing without our people – the employees who design, build, promote, sell, test and perfect the latest innovations in workplace health and wellbeing. Our people are our top priority and we invest in their health and happiness. At Virgin Pulse, we have so much more than a strong, supportive company culture – have a shared vision for a healthier, happier world.

Responsibilities:

Who you are.

As a Senior Software Engineer at Virgin Pulse you will be working on a Digital Health SaaS platform that supports millions of engaged, active members in 20 languages across 190 countries, serving over 50 billion+ API calls every year to mobile and desktop users. As a Senior Software Engineer at Virgin Pulse you will be working with a passionate and strong team of engineers, product managers and UX Designers. With your strong background in cloud technologies and software architecture you will have the opportunity to develop, manage and optimize our tech stack and production pipelines. This work might include projects like building out new customer facing features, creating the APIs for new capabilities, data integration from our customers or partners, developing new strategies for managing our product stack or optimizing existing code to make it more performant. We are looking for someone with an appetite for growth and we offer the opportunity to learn directly from our highly skilled group of engineers.

You offer strength in production-ready code in Java, .Net or Kotlin using strong analytical skills. We value the desire and ability to learn quickly but familiarity with Angular and the AWS ecosystem would be a plus. Excellent problem-solving abilities, strong communication skills, and the desire and ability to self-start and time-manage in a fast-paced environment will set you up for success in our team.

What your typical day looks like.

Delivering production ready code in Java and Kotlin
Design, develop and deploy backend services with focus on high availability, low latency and scalability
Monitor, test, and continuously optimize your designs
Provide technical leadership and coaching to the more junior team members to enable them to build better software.
Master our development process, culture and code base, then think of ways to improve it and implement within our team.
Take operational responsibility for the services that are owned by your team, potentially including taking part in off hour calls with systems support team
Qualifications:

What you bring to the team.

In order to represent the best of what we have to offer you come to us with a multitude of positive attributes including:

Fluency in Java and/or .Net
4 or more years of experience developing services and APIs
A solid understanding of best practices for software development including testing, monitoring, and design
Desire to go beyond the functional solution to build maintainable and well tested code
A desire to partner closely with product managers to refine the product
Ability to articulate and champion design strategies related to scalability, maintainability, performance, security and usability.

What makes you stand out.

Experience with highly scalable systems in an AWS ecosystem
Experience with some of the tools in our tech stack, particularly Spring Boot, Cassandra, PostgreSQL and/or Elasticsearch
Experience with Continuous Integration and Continuous Delivery technologies like Maven, TeamCity, Ansible, Harness, Terraform, or similar.

Security Competencies:

Work to maintain system and data security at a high standard, ensuring the confidentiality, integrity and availability of the Virgin Pulse application is not compromised. Adhere to industry best practice coding standards and verify all code developed at Virgin Pulse is free from bugs and security vulnerabilities (OWASP/CWE).

Why work here?

We believe a career should provide competitive pay and benefits, a collaborative and supportive work environment, strong employee culture and cutting-edge technology and services — so many reasons to love it here.
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to any protected class status.

Job Title: Part-time Veterinarian: well-care +, no critical cases!
Job Description:
_Now hiring a part-time Veterinarian for our Port Richey clinic - located in the Tampa Bay area, 20min north of Clearwater. _
Work on the Sunnier Side of Veterinary Medicine*
No emergencies. No critical cases. Essentials PetCare is a modern, fast-paced, paperless clinical practice with a mission to help underserved pet owners give their companion animals the care they need.

We strive to provide the ultimate convenience and affordability for pet owners, so our business model is different. We have mastered the core care pets need, focusing on vaccinations, minor illnesses, wellness, and other preventative and diagnostic testing. We make regular referrals to a network of quality full-service hospitals for complex issues, advanced diagnostics, procedures, dentals, and surgery.
At Essentials PetCare, we have established medical protocols based on the latest guidelines and best practices. We employ modern medicine and high standards to ensure high-quality, efficient visits for our patients.

To make care as accessible and transparent as possible, our services and prices are posted on our website. Our clinics are conveniently located at the front of Walmart, with a separate exterior entrance. We are open evenings and weekends and offer online bookings to make it easy for pet parents to seek care.

Are vet school student loans weighing on you, or are you looking for supplemental income? No contracts and no production-based pay - we keep it simple. Beyond offering a competitive and dependable salary, we believe in work-life harmony and understand the importance of a career that allows you to enjoy your life.
Our day-to-day care is different *
Since we specialize in routine, preventative care, you’ll work in a less-stressful environment with a dependable schedule. A typical day in our clinic would include:
Examining patients utilizing established protocols based on the latest AAHA recommendations
Educating clients about their pet’s needs and zoonotic diseases
Entering complete medical records into online practice management software
Discussing lab results with clients
Providing guidance and oversight to support staff as it relates to patient care and case management
Referring clients to local full-service hospitals for complex issues, procedures, dentals, and surgery
Required for position *
DVM or equivalent degree and active state license
Capability of working in a fast-paced practice
High level of comfort with computers and digital medical records
Passion for client education
Apply today and learn more at: https://essentialspetcare.com*

MEMBERCLICKS IS LOOKING FOR A SOFTWARE ENGINEER TO JOIN OUR TEAM!


We seek a Software Engineer to help us build products that help associations serve their members and further their mission . We seek autonomous engineers who strive to understand the "Why?" behind their work. We seek people who see failure as an opportunity to learn and grow. We seek team members who understand the immense value of collaborating with others. You will join a team of thoughtful and engaged Engineers who value constant learning and self improvement.

At MemberClicks, we believe being an Engineer means being responsible for more than just pushing out quality code. We believe that getting closer to the people we build the software for is the key to making a product that helps good people to do more good things in the world. If that idea excites you, then come and join our Atlanta team and help us build great products.

Responsibilities include:
Work with team members to build features and products, from concept discovery through implementation.
Maintain software solutions after release, including bug fixes and performance tuning.
Help to define internal coding standards and mentor fellow team members.
Collaborate with external stakeholders outside of your team, especially customers.
Participate in the ongoing improvement of your team's Agile process and workflow.
Live out the MemberClicks mission and core values in your day-to-day work: autonomy, transparency and collaboration.
Signs that you're a fit for this job:
Familiarity with modern Javascript framework(s) like Angular, React, or Vue and server side technologies such as Node
Passionate about finding solutions to issues with a team.
Excited about working iteratively with a tight product feedback loop.
Effective communicator.
Working knowledge in a cloud environment such as AWS preferred.
We offer a competitive salary along with health benefits, including wellness! If you feel like a fit for this role, we'd love to hear from you.

As part of Factory Automation Robotics team, this person will be responsible for developing high-volume worldwide customer-facing software.

Why work at Epson?
Epson enables people worldwide to make, share and capture creativity and bring it to life. Epson technologies open the door to limitless opportunities in visual communications, robotics, sensing, and business and commercial digital imaging. As a global innovator Epson applies its cutting-edge technologies in markets including sports, fashion, augmented reality, and personal healthcare.
We also offer: Competitive salaries, excellent benefits (medical, matching 401k, retirement plan, holidays, vacation etc.), team environment, strong executive leadership and an enjoyable work environment with great people to work with!

What you will be responsible for:
Collaborating with Epson’s parent company in Engineering for the identification, definition, and review of software requirements for existing or new Factory Automation Robotics products
Designing and developing the software and supporting documentation to meet customer requirements, providing advanced technical support for Factory Automation Robotics products, and maintaining and troubleshooting Factory Automation Robotics local area network and server
Also responsible for leading/driving activities of the Epson America’s software development team

What you will be doing:

Software Design
Leads Epson America’s software development team through coordinating development direction, activities and schedules
Participates in gathering user/customer requirements for software from internal sources
Collaborates with Epson’s parent company in the definition and review of software requirements
Participates with Epson’s parent company in development of project plans (e.g., time estimates, specifications)
Develops software programs for new products within project timelines
Develops supporting technical documentation for products
Assists Epson’s parent company designers in solving complex technical problems

Technical Support
Interfaces with technical support teams to resolve advanced customer technical issues; escalates issues that cannot be resolved to management
Serves as a technical subject matter expert for Factory Automation Robotics products
Responsible for maintaining and troubleshooting Factory Automation Robotics local area network
Relationship Management
Builds strong relationships with peers, other departments, and managers to best meet company goals and objectives

About your experience:
Minimum 12+ years of experience in customer facing software
Experience developing products with: C#, C++, Microsoft windows and Linux
Robotics experience is a plus
Experience with graphical user interfaces
Completion of an undergraduate degree or equivalent experience

NEW OPENING! JOIN OUR TEAM!

LPN

We are currently recruiting for LPN. This position is responsible for providing care and nursing services for developmentally disabled residents, as well as ensures that residents are treated with respect and dignity, recognizing their individual needs, and encouraging their independence.

The LPN is responsible for:

· Assists in the Plan of Care for each resident.

· Assigns resident care to Certified Medication Aides and Certified Nurse Aides and supervise the completion of such assignments.

· Ensures that resident charts are in proper order.

· Performs nursing duties as needed.

· Administers medications and assist in ordering medications as needed.

· Prepares nurses notes, as required.

· Renders skill-nursing care, according to physicians’ orders, and in conformance with recognized nursing techniques and procedures, established standards, and administrative policies.

· Helps maintain a physical, social and psychosocial environment which will be conducive to the best interest and welfare of residents.

· Recognizes and interpret symptoms, report residents’ conditions , and assist with or institute remedial measures for adverse developments.

· Communicates with the Director of Nursing, building managers, and staff as needed regarding matters of importance to each position maintaining professional and courteous communications while also maintaining the privacy of protected health information as required by HIPAA.

· Maintains dependable and reliable attendance.

· Maintains a customer-minded approach with residents, their families, and all coworkers.

· Maintains a professional and courteous disposition.

· Abides by a professional code of ethics.

· Supports a dignified and caring atmosphere with residents, residents’ families, visitors and staff.

· Protects privacy and confidentiality of information pertaining to the residents, residents’ families, employees, facility information and records.

· Maintains a safe and secure working environment and practices safe working habits.

· Complies with the attendance policy.

· Maintains neat appearance, good personal hygiene and appropriate attire.

· Participates in training, in-services, and meetings as required.

· Performs other duties and responsibilities as directed.
We have a lot to offer!*
• Competitive Wages*
• Great Benefits Selections*
• Generous Paid Time-Off*
• Rewarding Work Environment*
Requirements:

Must have a current and valid LPN license in the state of Oklahoma in good standing with the Board of Nursing. A minimum of one year experience working in the nursing field.

Must have qualities of leadership, a genuine interest in serving individuals with developmental disabilities and related fields, the ability to work congenially with others, initiative, good judgment and dependability.

Must have a valid driver's license and access to a private vehicle for business use.

Personal computer experience including word-processing and electronic software knowledge is required. Strong written, verbal, and interpersonal skills are required.

Minimum of one year experience working with individuals with developmental disabilities preferred. Other preferences include: supportive attitude toward team approach.

Physical Requirements:

Physical requirements include frequent bending, standing, walking; continuous ability for speech communication and hearing in order to communicate with residents, employees and the public, vision for reading, recording and interpreting information, ability to stand for long hours at a time, and the ability to lift/carry a maximum of 25 pounds.

Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

Must have reliable transportation, valid Oklahoma driver’s license, auto insurance as required by the State of Oklahoma, must pass OSBI background check, and no prior listing on the Oklahoma Community Registry. Must utilize good communication skills and be a team player. Must attend and complete all required trainings and in-services. Must complete, at client’s expense, all state mandated training within the timeframes specified, including Medication Administration Training, CPR & 1st Aid, MOPI, and DHS training.

Job Title: PT Kickboxing Fitness Instructor (req. strong fitness background)
Job Description:
If you love being a fitness professional ... you’re gonna love us!*
If you’re tired of having to work for several studios and gyms just to make ends -meet ...

Keep reading.

iLoveKickboxing.com offers group classes in fitness kickboxing; it’s the world’s best fighters’ workout...without the fight! Nobody gets hit, hurt or made to feel bad. Helping our members get into the best shape of their life is our primary aim.

No kickboxing experience...no problem. We will train the right person to become a top-notch iLKB Instructor.

iLKB is a well-established, international-wide brand, committed to providing affordable, accessible and the best fitness classes to our community.

iLKB is currently established in 44 states and 3 countries. Our class formats target a wide range of clients' needs - from young to more senior, from beginner to advanced.

POSITION:

The responsibility of our iLoveKickboxing.com Sales and Fitness Training Specialist is to assist the Studio Manager with new membership sales by helping new members enroll and teach life changing fitness kickboxing classes. The Sales and Fitness Trainer also assists with retaining current members and the sale of iLKB apparel and products.

Kickboxing experience is not necessary however Group Fitness Sales knowledge or a fitness training background is preferred but not required.

REQUIREMENTS:
Excellent sales, communication, and customer service skills required
Goal-oriented, and the desire to earn a professional wage is a must
Ability to learn and use our iLKB software system
Ability to stand or sit for up to 8 hours throughout the workday
Must be fluent in English and have excellent communication skills via in person, phone and email
Must be able to work under pressure and meet tight deadlines
Must have proficient computer skills and familiar with using Social Media
Daily and/or occasional travel may be required.
RESPONSIBILITIES:
Execute our sales process for lead generation, follow up and membership enrollment
Conduct tours of our facility while establishing a relationship and targeting individual's needs and wants
Maintain acceptable level of personal sales production
Emphasize and enforce objectives of our studio as a fitness and wellness provider
Present available services and products to our current members
Book quality appointments to achieve monthly sales quota
Participate in special events (health fairs, grand openings, community and B2B events) to promote our studio
Assumes responsibility for developing and improving selling & enrollment skills
Other duties as assigned
COMPENSATION & BENIFITS:

This position offers a professional compensation level for Part Timers; based on experience.
Commission paid on sales
Opportunity for bonus based on performance.
Huge opportunities for growth within the studios including additional management positions
Job Type: Part-time - need a person that wants 15-20 hours a week, with the ability to flex up or down depending on the studio needs (with advance notice). Can move to Full-Time as performance dicatates if you want that.

Brown Memorial Home is looking for dedicated STNA’s to join our team. We are a not-for-profit skilled nursing home and assisted living, located in Circleville, Ohio. We have a low patient to aide ratio. We have 12-hour shifts and are currently looking for Fulltime Day-Shift STNA's.
Responsible to the following chain of command; Charge nurse, Assistant Director of Nursing and Director of Nursing.
Education: Completion of a state-approved certification training program or current state tested nurse aide status.
Responsible for providing direct resident care under the supervision of the charge nurse
Request clarification and or training procedures that are not clearly understood
Assist new employees in following established facility policies and procedures.
Identifies special resident problems and reports them immediately to the charge nurse.
Provides direct resident care as assigned, completing assignments accurately and timely.
Identifies safety hazards and initiates corrective action immediately.
Identifies resident problems and initiates corrective action immediately
Provides resident care while observing the implementation of "Resident Rights."
Participates in mandatory 12 hours of nurse aide in-services each year. Makes arrangements to make up any hours that are missing from scheduled in-services.
Attends staff meetings, in-service classes, and committee meetings as assigned.
Follows staffing guidelines for call-offs and accepts adjustments to assignments when needed.
Uses supplies and equipment efficiently and effectively
Demonstrates consistent ability to work cooperatively with residents, charge nurse, other nurse aide, physicians, families, consult personnel, and other department employees.
Provides nursing care as outlined by the Charge nurse, assignment sheets, and resident plan of care.
Accurately, completely, and timely documents resident care provided and resident's response or lack of response to care provided on nurse flow records, ADL tracking tools, assignments sheets, meal intake records, and any other documentation provided by a supervisor.
Report changes in residents' condition immediately to charge nurse.
Performs basic STNA skills such as toileting, transfers, bathing, feeding, personal hygiene, locomotion, and complete the ADLS for each resident according to the specific plan of care for that resident.
Seeks assistance when confronted with a resident problem that requires a special assessment.
Greets residents by name and speaks to each resident and family member in a kind thoughtful manner, observes each resident's right to privacy by knocking on doors prior to entry.
Listens to residents/family member complaints/concerns attentively and reports problems to charge nurse promptly.
Demonstrates concern for all residents' welfare by rendering immediate assistance to any resident in need.
Answers call lights in a timely manner.
Works with a cooperative and pleasant attitude wherever assigned.
Comes to work as scheduled and consistently demonstrates dependability and punctuality.
Comes to work in a neat, clean uniform and consistently presents a professional appearance at all times.
Assumes accountability for all data contained in the employee handbook.
Controls emotions for the best interest of all involved.
Protects the privacy of all residents at all times, including information contained in the resident's medical records.
Protects the privacy and interest of the facility at all times by not discussing confidential issues with unauthorized persons in or out of the facility. Also protects the interest of the facility at all times related to the personal property of the organization including but not limited to written policies, procedures, original proprietary documents, computer software, and any other facility owned resources, documents, electronic data, or equipment.
Maintains and communicates a positive image/outlook regarding the facility at all times.
Maintains proper standards of conduct at all times including following the chain of command and discussing issues related to the job description, facility operations with appropriate persons only; avoiding any situation that could be constructed as gossip, or slanderous to the facility or persons working at the facility.
Demonstrates knowledge and ability to operate mechanical lifts.
Other duties as assigned by the supervisor.
Physical abilities required include but not limited to; frequent bending, twisting, turning, pushing/pulling large medication/treatment carts weighing in excess of 100 pounds. Frequent lifting of up to 25 pounds independently, frequent need to lift in excess of 100 pounds with assistance, occasional need to support weight in excess of 100 pounds providing controlled lowering of patient to the floor in situations such as attempting to prevent a resident fall or reduce the impact of a resident's fall, ability to climb stairs on occasion. Potential occupational exposures, include but not limited to, odors, chemicals, biohazard fluids, materials, and aggressive residents.

We provide technology that community financial institutions use to manage risk and drive growth. Our solutions automate key processes – from anti-money laundering to fraud detection to CECL readiness to lending workflows – empowering our customers by addressing their Enterprise Risk Management needs.

This is an exciting opportunity for someone who is not only a master of their craft, but also shares our commitment to driving a strong company culture by putting their heart and soul into their work every day.

Abrigo is seeking a back-end oriented .NET Software Engineer to join our talented and dedicated development group as an integral part of building our data analytics platform and bringing simple solutions to complex banking problems to life. This position is a key role in our software engineering group. The perfect candidate is organized, self-motivated, is a master of their craft and success-oriented.

We are seeking a highly motivated and skilled Software Engineer to help us leverage and build upon our high performance data warehouse and analysis platform. The position will require development work in a fast-paced environment at a rapidly growing company. The expectation for this individual is to not only execute but innovate at a high level. Ideal candidates must be passionate about software development. Our culture allows for regular sharing of innovative ideas and implementation of the best designs all within a casual workspace environment and dog friendly office. We believe in challenging our developers with large-scale, intellectually stimulating work and rewarding them with very competitive compensation packages.


What You'll Do:
Build, maintain, and enhance complex financial software solutions.
Work in a full stack web-based development environment.
Work to architect an Enterprise Data Warehouse utilizing state of the art tools, platforms, and Data Vault 2.0 methodology.
Build prototypes, functional code, and automated tests.
Take ownership of your work, and provide feedback in a fast-paced, interactive development cycle.
Quickly find solutions to technical challenges, ranging from integrating disparate data sets into an Enterprise Data Warehouse to efficiently performing complex calculations to designing data structures to represent complex systems.
Make mistakes, fail fast, and grow quickly.
What You'll Need:
Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science or related field.
Experience in web development and Object-Oriented Design preferred.
Experience with the following technologies is preferred: C#, ASP.NET, Data Vault 2.0, Snowflake, Angular, Java, SQL.
Experience with the traditional front-end web stack is preferred (HTML, CSS, JavaScript).
Well-developed problem solving skills; critical thinking and ability to weigh pros/cons of multiple options.
Excellent communication skills.
Strong attention to detail.
What You’ll Get:
Market competitive total rewards package
To be part of the Heart & SOUL of a winning company with an inspiring mission
The opportunity to Make Big Things Happen
Competitive salary along with full health benefits with an HSA option
Unlimited PTO and bank holidays
401(k) plan and company match
We are an equal opportunity employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, gender identity, age, genetic trait, sexual orientation, national origin, disability status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Abrigo is committed to providing reasonable accommodations for qualified individuals with disabilities and disabled veterans in our job application procedures. If you need assistance or an accommodation due to a disability, you may contact us at Careers@abrigo.com with the subject line accommodation.

Job Title: LPN - Private Duty - Full Time - Mid-Shift
Job Description:
Description:

Offering Premium Pay, Comprehensive Benefits Package including

16 days of Paid-Time-Off, 7 Paid Holidays and 401 (k) with company match!

2:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m. - Monday thru Friday

10:00 a.m. to 3:00 p.m. - Saturday

Patient Home Location - Smyrna TN

Branch Office Location - Brentwood TN

We deliver individualized care . . . one patient at a time

Who we are

AbilisHealth is a leading provider of home health and skilled private duty services. We cover 61 counties, with close to 500 employees serving nearly 4,000 patients in the past year. Our model of tirelessly serving patients, caregivers, and the community will become the industry benchmark. Our success is largely based upon hiring ambitious team members who provide outstanding patient care.

Caregiver opportunity

We are seeking an empathetic, motivated and committed individual to fill our compassionate Licensed Practical Nurse / LPN opportunity. The skilled LPN will provide nursing assessment, planning, and care to maximize the comfort and health of our patients and their families. If you have a heart to serve others by caring for patients’ individualized needs the way you'd care for the needs of your own family, we want you on our team.

What this role can offer you

In this role, you will provide direct patient care within a patient’s home. You will have the satisfaction of knowing you're ensuring the patient receives optimal care, by assessing, planning, implementing, reevaluating and revising care and coordinating resources. Among other responsibilities, you will update and maintain patient records and implement orders for medications and treatments.

What AbilisHealth offers

FUN, POSITIVE, and PROFESSIONAL culture
HIGHLY COMPETITIVE pay
Be EMPOWERED by working INDEPENDENTLY with a FLEXIBLE work schedule
BENEFITS: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, Life insurance including 401(k) company match, Holiday Pay and Paid Time Off
Generous referral BONUSES
Continuing education and refresher training

Responsibilities

Perform selected nursing procedures within the scope of LPN practice
Provide patient and family teaching according to plan outlined by the RN
Monitor patient's vital signs and make specific measurements and observations
Monitor and record intake and output. Report significant changes immediately
Observe, assess and record patient's physical and mental condition and reports any changes
Administer medications as instructed and as ordered by the physician and instructed by the RN. Document the patient's file accordingly
Attend and participate in multi-disciplinary patient case conferences, staff meetings and in-service education programs as assigned
Cooperate with on-call schedule, weekends and after hour visits, as necessary
. Requirements:
Licensed Practical Nurse / LPN license in Tennessee in good standing
Previous experience in home health, hospice, hospital or skilled nursing preferred
Familiarity with medical software and equipment - Brightree a plus
Ability to build rapport with patients
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Reliable transportation, valid driver's license and current automobile insurance

PERSONAL CARE ASSISTANT (PCA) & *
CERTIFIED NURSING ASSISTANT (CNA) *
JOB DESCRIPTIONS
Department: *Nursing *Exemption Status: *Non-exempt (hourly)
Reports To: *Clinical Services Director *Date Approved: *October 2014
POSITION SUMMARY *
Under proper direction, provide residents with assistance in meeting scheduled needs as outlined in the care plan/service plan and in assisting with unscheduled needs when required according to established facility policies and procedures and as may be directed by their supervisor.
DUTIES & RESPONSIBILITIES *
Quality Care
• Assist residents with Activities of Daily Living (ADL’s) such as bathing, dressing, grooming, mouth care, toileting, or other needs in keeping with the individual’s care requirements;
Provide residents with warm and caring attention to encourage each resident’s ability to maintain or attain the highest practical physical, mental, and psychosocial well-being;
Maintain the comfort, privacy, and dignity of each resident in the delivery of services to them.

• Knowledgeable of each resident’s care plan and provides support accordingly;
Communicate and document any observations or information needed in coordination of the care planning process to the appropriate individual(s); Complete records documenting care provided in keeping with department policies; Report any changes in resident’s condition such as skin breakdown.

• Assist with orienting residents and their families upon admission and transfers; assist or transport residents to appointments, activities, throughout the facility, etc.

• Perform all job responsibilities in accordance with prescribed safety and infection control procedures including thorough hand washing, use of disposable gloves, and proper disposal of soiled materials.

Company and Interdepartmental
• Incorporate direction from Clinical Services Director and company strategic goals to refine and improve efficiencies.
• Maintain a high level of confidentiality with regard to business operations and resident privacy.
• Understand and support all aspects of resident’s rights, including the right to be free of restraints and free of abuse, through all interactions required to carry out your duties.

• Promptly report any evidence of resident abuse or violation of resident’s rights to the appropriate person.

• Support an atmosphere which promotes a homelike environment.
• Carries out delegated workplace safety activities and adheres to all company policies and practices regarding safety in the workplace.
• Uphold Edgewood Management Group’s mission and core values.
• Responsible to be knowledgeable and maintain compliance with federal, state, local regulatory requirements in department.

Customer Service Responsibility
• Maintain a high level of customer service satisfaction.
• Participate in property activities as required to ensure resident quality care and customer service.

Other Duties/Responsibilities
• Perform other duties and responsibilities as required or assigned.
• Other duties may include food preparation and service; activities coordination; housekeeping and laundry services.
SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES*
• A Personal Care Assistant / Certified Nursing Assistant / Certified Medication Assistant is delegated the administrative authority, responsibility, and accountability necessary for carrying out your assigned duties.
EDUCATION & EXPERIENCE*
• Valid/current state driver’s license required.
• High school diploma or General Education Degree (GED) required.
• Experience with activity or recreation programming strongly preferred.
CERTIFICATES, LICENSES & DESIGNATIONS *
• Must meet licensing/certification requirements as prescribed by city, state or federal regulations.
KNOWLEDGE, SKILLS & ABILITIES (with or without reasonable accommodation) *
• Must be able to read, write, speak, and understand the English language
• Strong interpersonal, verbal and written communication skills
• Knowledge of regulations of Assisted Living and Resident Rights.

• Knowledge of Vulnerable Adult Reporting requirements.
• Must be highly adept at handling situations that require a high degree of flexibility/adaptability; must be open to change
• Ability to respond effectively to the most sensitive inquiries or complaints.
• Ability to use a variety of general office equipment including but not limited to a personal computer, fax machine, copy machine, laminator and cameras.
• Knowledge of and skill in using a personal computer and related software including

Microsoft Word, Excel, PowerPoint, and Outlook.
• Skill in basic math including addition, subtraction, multiplication, division, fractions, percentages, and decimals
• Skill of developing and maintaining positive relationships with external and internal customers
• Knowledge of and ability to apply commonly accepted rules of grammar, spelling and punctuation in written communication to develop management reports and summaries
• Ability to identify and carry out actions to achieve goals while considering possible risks to effectively develop long- and short-range company objectives
• Skill in preparing written materials such as correspondence, reports and proposals to meet purpose and audience
• Skill of determining alternatives that would correct a situation to provide effective guest service
• Skill of receiving a message, understanding the intended message and giving feedback to ensure guest expectations are met
• Ability to work cooperatively within a group to make the work of the group successful and effective
• Ability to read and interpret documents such as equipment specifications, maintenance criteria, OSHA safety guidelines and procedure manuals, safety rules, and operation and maintenance instructions

• Must possess the ability to deal tactfully with personnel, residents, family members, visitors, government agencies/personnel and the general public

• Must possess the ability to make independent decisions when circumstances warrant such action

• Must possess ability and the willingness to work harmoniously with professional and nonprofessional personnel

• Must be able to cope with the mental and emotional stress of the position
• Must be able to assist in the evacuation of residents/residents
• Ability to follow procedures and give attention to detail

• May require use of gripping with hands, applying torque with the hands or arms, pressing, pushing and pulling with hands or arms, twisting, balancing, rapid mental-muscular coordination

• Requires use of gloves.
• Ability to Frequently stand for moderate periods of time (up to 4 hours.)

• Ability to Frequently stand for long periods of time (up to 8 hours.)
• Ability to Occasionally sit for moderate periods of time (up to 4 hours.)

• Ability to Occasionally sit for long periods of time (up to 8 hours.)
• Ability to Frequently walk for moderate periods of time (up to 4 hours.)
• Ability to Occasionally walk for long periods of time (up to 8 hours.)
• Ability to Frequently twist.

• Ability to Frequently stoop or bend.
• Ability to Frequently squat.
• Ability to Minimally climb ladders.
• Ability to Occasionally climb stairs.

• Ability to Occasionally walk on uneven ground.
• Ability to Minimally work above ground.
• Ability to Frequently lift 10-25 pounds.
• Ability to Frequently lift 25-50 pounds.

• Ability to Occasionally lift over 50 pounds
• Ability to Frequently carry 10-25 pounds.
• Ability to Frequently carry 25-50 pounds.
• Ability to Occasionally carry over 50 pounds

• Ability to Occasionally reach above shoulder height.
• Ability to Occasionally reach at shoulder height.
• Ability to Occasionally reach below shoulder height.
WORKING CONDITIONS *
• Occasional exposure to moderate to loud noise level.

• Occasional exposure to variety of resident behaviors related to the business.
• Minimal exposure to cigarette smoke.
• Frequent exposure to potentially infectious material.
• Minimal exposure to high heat.

• Minimal exposure to cold.
• Occasional exposure to dust, dirt and debris.
• Occasional work done with machinery involving moving parts.
• Occasional exposure to hazardous chemicals, solutions and solvents.

• Minimal risk of electric shock.
• Subject to frequent interruptions
• Is subject to falls, odors, etc. throughout the work day

• May be subject to hostile and emotionally upset residents, family members, personnel and visitors
