#Dice

Software Engineer

Investors Title Insurance Company

Morrisville, NC

***This is not a remote position***

Our team is building technology solutions that support current organizational operations, as well as developing state of the art systems that will provide the company a competitive advantage in the market place. Our products support our organization, as well as distributed partners that continue to drive our business.

In order for a candidate to be successful, you must be passionate about quality, highly self-motivated, committed to timely delivery of quality products and want to be part of an organization committed to continual improvement.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

ESSENTIAL:
Education: Bachelor of Science in related engineering or computer science discipline or equivalent experience.
4+ years of experience (multiple positions at multiple skill levels) working with database and/or reports work. SSRS and SQL Server experience preferred. ETL experience a plus. Must be able to maintain existing work as well as built out new functionality.
2+ years of experience constructing complex component and web-based applications, preferably but not limited to Microsoft .NET technologies.
As a software engineer:
You have proven proficiency in software engineering and have a track record of successful product delivery.
You must have worked closely with all stakeholders on feature priorization, planning production schedules and accurately estimating development work effort. You are comfortable and accountable for adhering to these established priorities and schedules.
You have successfully supported “today’s application” that is paying the bills, while at the same time worked on the next generation product that meets the organization’s strategic plans.
Skills: Undertakes detailed design and development work; excellent communication and organization skills; strong problem solving skills; Self-motivated and tenacious when tackling tough technical issues. Actively believes in and practices software engineering activities even when the near term costs are highly visible and the long term benefits are difficult to measure.
Knowledge: Solid knowledge of software engineering concepts and procedures. Understands Software Engineering and methodologies, and the impact of early decisions on later development stages of software projects.
DESIRED:
Proven proficiency in n-layered architectures. This means that you have designed and developed applications that separate the data layer, the business logic layer and the presentation layer.
Experience with Scrum or other agile and lean software development methodologies a plus.
Experience working in a “Continuous Build System”, such as with Team Foundation Server.
Familiarity with accounting and financial reporting applications, or insurance related field preferable.
Strong database programming and reporting skills.
Strong service-oriented (SOA) skills.
Demonstrated ability to write and utilize unit tests with minimal supervision.
Proficiency in C#, JSON, LINQ, MVC and SQL Server.
Proficiency in REST/WebAPI or similar HTTP-based technology
EXTRA CREDIT
Proficiency in ORM technologies such as NHibernate and Entity Framework.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Delivers quality software, undertaking design, estimation, development, testing and ongoing support of new and existing features in support of Investors Title’s business operations.
Supports, utilizes and promotes agreed upon engineering department standards and processes.
Actively participates in the code review process to ensure quality deliverables.
Writes and maintains documentation (in-line and external) to describe program development, logic, coding, testing, changes, and corrections.
Works collaboratively, and communicates well with technical and non-technical colleagues and business users.
Makes unit tests and service test scripts an integral part of software delivery.
Participates in backlog grooming and requirements analysis to insure understanding of business needs. With this knowledge, assists in the translation of business requirements into design and/or vendor selection while adhering to underlying solution architecture.
Provides both high level and detailed work estimations in support of the project. Participates in the formation and development of agile processes, including planning, scrums, retrospective, and process improvement.
Keeps abreast of the latest industry trends and transfers knowledge to the team, which will assist in product and feature prioritization.
Recognized as an industry leader, Investors Title Insurance Company provides residential and commercial title insurance and innovative business solutions for our partners. The Company has been recognized with an AM Best rating of A, assigned a Financial Stability Rating of A” Unsurpassed from Demotech and a Kroll Rating of A. Working at Investors Title, you will find a dynamic and supportive culture, outstanding training and development, a variety of career paths, work/life balance, and excellent benefits.

The Company is an equal opportunity employer. As such, the Company offers equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status and other protected class characteristics.

Job Title: Shop Mechanic (3 yrs exp required) Based in Salinas w/seasonal relo to Yuma
Job Description:
D’Arrigo Bros. Co., of California, a 100-year old, rapidly growing Salinas based agricultural company, is looking for an accounting professional to join an enthusiastic team. We are one of the largest vegetable grower, packer and shippers, and we offer opportunities with excellent benefits and compensation.

Andy Boy has a rich history as an industry trend-setter, not a follower. From the day the company was founded by Stephen and Andrew D’Arrigo, two immigrants from Messina, Sicily, innovation has been its hallmark. With third generation D’Arrigo family members at the helm of our West Coast operations, you can be sure that the traditions of being the very best in the business emanate from the top and are carried out by our dedicated family of almost 2000 employees. Would you like to join this team?
DUTIES -* Work under the direction of the Vice President, Service Center, and supervisors. Position will require working in the field and in the shop preparing, troubleshooting and repairing harvesting and production equipment. Occasional field repairs at late hours, some Saturdays. There will be extended stays in Yuma, Arizona and Brawley, California during the winter harvest season.
Qualifications: *
· Responsible for the repair, maintenance and troubleshooting of all harvesting/production equipment.

· Must be knowledgeable in electrical, hydraulic, diesel engines, welding and BIT Program Inspections

· Minimum 3 years experience with building, repairing or modifying machinery or vehicles

· Basic knowledge of shop equipment and use of mechanical tools

· Welding/fabrication skills

· Ability to read drawings, and schematics

· Creativity and aptitude for identifying problems and finding alternative solutions

· Good observation skills

· Valid Class B (minimum) driver’s license w/air brake CDL or ability to obtain before end of 90 day probation period. Clean record required.

· Must be able to walk through a vegetable field on uneven surfaces, climb up and down noisy harvesting equipment, and use both hands to perform various tasks and be willing to do so in inclement weather conditions (including wind, dust, rain, heat, cold)

· Must be able to lift 40 pounds

· Regular and consistent attendance mandatory

· Work schedule will include occasional long hours including weekends and some holidays

· Organized team player who works well with a variety of people with a minimum of supervision

· Thrive in a fast paced environment and handle pressure

· Able to handle multiple tasks

· Good communication skills

· Operation of standard office equipment, including personal computers, photocopier, fax machines and appropriate software such as Windows, Microsoft Office applications
Preferred: *
· Spanish speaking

· AS degree in relevant technology (Welding, Agriculture and Industrial Technology, or Industrial Mechanics)

· Prior knowledge of electrical, hydraulic and pneumatic systems

Pay: $0.00 per hour

Looking for employment AND an opportunity to make a difference? Join the PENRAD Imaging team! Discover how PENRAD Imaging provides excellent health care to the Southern Colorado region. PENRAD Imaging provides competitive salaries, a great working environment with state-of-the-art equipment & technology, and superior benefits which include low cost options for medical/dental benefits, and a fantastic 401k plan!

Exemplary patient care is just one of the many facets of health care that are valued here!

Summary Description
This position in responsible for applying their expertise in the area of obtaining diagnostic radiographic images while providing exemplary quality service to patients. This is a per diem position; the hours and location will vary based on business needs.

Essential Functions
Prepares patients for exams by greeting the patient by his/her name, obtaining patient history information necessary to perform or evaluate the procedure, and provides instructions and an explanation of the procedure to obtain the best possible image and reduce the patient’s anxiety.
Operates CT equipment to obtain high quality CT images as defined by exam specific protocols.
Prepares area for exam by ensuring the proper equipment and supplies are available before the patient is called for exam.
Performs venipuncture and obtains IV access for contrast injections.
Performs BUN and Creatinine clearance prior to injecting contrast to ensure patient safety.
Practices ALARA principles to reduce radiation exposure.
Works closely with the Radiologist to ensure proper protocol for exams performed.
Performs injections of nonionic contrast with a power injector, ensuring proper injection rates are used for optimal contrast enhancement. Documents the patient history and the amount of contrast injected.
Attends to patient’s care before, during and immediately following exam and notifies the appropriate party if patient’s condition changes at any time.
Performs daily inspections of equipment and reports immediately any quality concerns as well as equipment failures or deficiencies.
Sends all studies to PACS (image software), including any applicable prior studies.
Performs clerical duties related to the procedures including entering information into company-specific software and documenting information into patient charts.
Cleans exam rooms and restocks supplies for next patient.
Interfaces with Lead regarding any and all concerns.
Attends staff meetings regularly and follows all company policies and procedures.
Go to www.penrad.org to learn more about PENRAD Imaging. Visit the career tab for job opportunities and to submit an application and résumé, which are required to be considered.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Job Description:
Looking for a career with a dynamic and fun team that values your skills and encourages your continual growth? *_Plus pays competitive wage with a $1,000 hiring bonus_?*

If expecting the unexpected is your strength, this is the service for you! This highly dynamic team works with our internship-trained emergency veterinarians to provide critical care when our patients need us most. You will fully utilize and grow your skills by learning RECOVER CPR and advanced procedures on this service while being supported by a team of veterinary assistants and kennel assistants. This service has 24 hour staffing 7 days a week so several shifts are available including day, swing and overnight. *Overnight shifts qualify for differential pay.*

Madison Veterinary Specialists is seeking full time and part time Certified Veterinary Technicians to join our Emergency department. This position includes swing, overnight, weekends, and some holidays. Previous experience is preferred.

The Certified Veterinary Technician provides caring, compassionate and detail-oriented nursing care for hospitalized patients and outpatients. They are responsible for correctly and efficiently executing treatments, diagnostics, and medication administration at the appropriate times under the direction of a Veterinarian. They must maintain detailed and correct medical records in the MVS electronic medical record keeping system, ImproMed, while ensuring all charges are correctly invoiced, along with updating and communicating with clients in a timely and respective manner.

Our ideal candidate possesses the following skills:

· Ability to work in a collaborative team setting

· Good communication skills and enjoy working with people

· Enjoy learning new skills and exploring new technologies

· Willingness to participate in additional training programs

· Provide input and assist with all aspects of patient care

· Excel in technical nursing skills including but not limited to: Venipuncture, Catheter placement

· Ability to obtain accurate radiology views

· Effective anesthesia monitoring

· Physical examinations and patient assessment

· Good Laboratory skill set including but not limited to: Manual differentials, UA

· Possess or demonstrate desire to obtain a solid understanding of the common medications used within an emergency & specialty practice

· Provide compassionate and timely care for our hospitalized patients
Qualifications: *
· Current State licensure as a Certified/Registered/Licensed Veterinary Technician

· Prior experience in an emergency and/or specialists’ practice is a plus

· 1+ years’ experience as a Certified Veterinary Technician or veterinary assistant preferred

· Knowledge of ImproMed software a plus
Education: *
· High School diploma or equivalent

· Formal Veterinary Technology education preferred

Madison Veterinary Specialists & Emergency provides a fast-paced and collaborative environment. We are dedicated to providing the highest standard of medical care along with excellent customer service. We offer internal training for each position with competitive wages and benefits packages including medical insurance, flexible scheduling, 401K plan with matching, uniforms, and continuing education allowance, as well as discounted pricing for your pet's care. Wage commensurate with skill and experience. Overnight shifts include a differential pay premium.

If you are an experienced veterinary technician looking for the perfect opportunity to hone and expand your skills with a growing practice, apply today!

To learn more about our hospital visit mvsvets.com or like us on Facebook.

Job Title: Truck Driver Class A CDL OTR 2yrs Exp
Job Description:
We are looking for an experienced truck driver in the OH PA or Illinois area who is reliable and pro active. You have the opportunity to have a partnership with financial growth and possibility of owning your own truck(if you choose too). $1500 sign on bonus available. Paid vacation after 6 months. Get paid up to 60% for a load. You can absolutely count on getting paid every week with no discrepancies. Looking for a driver who is willing to stay on the road for at least 1 week and we are very flexible with home time.
Responsibilities*
Transport finished goods and raw materials over land to and from manufacturing plants or retail and distribution centers
Inspect vehicles for mechanical items and safety issues and perform preventative maintenance
Plan routes and meet delivery schedules
Comfortable choosing loads from load board
Document and log work/rest periods and miles spent driving and retain fuel/toll receipts
Comply with truck driving rules and regulations (size, weight, route designations, parking and break periods) as well as with company policies and procedures
Maneuver trucks into loading or unloading positions
Collect and verify delivery instructions
Report defects, accidents or violations
Skills*
2 yrs Proven work experience as a truck driver
Cdl A licence 2 yrs experience minimum
Hands on experience with electronic equipment and software (GPS, AVL units, CB etc)
Ability to drive long hours and travel regularly. Available to drive 2-3 weeks at a time.
Extensive knowledge of applicable truck driving rules and regulations
No recent moving or driving violations
Adaptability and foresight to handle unexpected situations (traffic, weather conditions etc)
Valid truck driving license
No more than 2 moving violations in the past 2 year
No felony convictions in the past 15 years
No preventable accidents in the last 3 years
No failed drug test
No equipment abandonment
Great work history, clean PSP, background check
Great communication, professional attitude
Must know how to use a smartphone

We are:


Enterprise Network Group: is integral part of our Intent Based Netowking Strategy. Our team works on long-lasting customer partnerships, together to identify our customers' needs and provide solutions that fuel their success. Cisco IOS-XE (Enterprise) technology solves, creates, inspires, heals and secures to help build your bridge to possible. We have products in Enterprise Networking space, Security and Collaboration and we operate in Enterprise, IOT, Service providers and Data Center market segments.

What You will do


Your role will be Software Engineer and you will be part of world-class engineering team that works on ground breaking technologies in Intent Based Enterprise Networking (IBNG) group. IBNG is responsible for all Routing/Switching, wireless controllers, Security and IOT platforms in CISCO. This team works on incorporating Open Source technologies and methodologies to facilitate CISCO IBNG journey to provide work class HW and SW products. DNA-C, SaaS, SD-WAN, Wireless Controllers etc. products/technologies will be your work area. You will have opportunity to work and contribute/maintain to Open Source community (Kernel/FOSS). You will be part of team who work on complex HW and SW issues and plan ahead roadmap of future technologies. CISCO is Platinum member of Linux Foundation and YOCTO communities and you will be part of this team.

Day to day work will involve but not limited to: writing/reviewing functional and design specifications, programming, unit and integration testing your own code etc. You will be part of team of 20+ engineers across globe. Work on ARM/x86/PPC/MIPS architecture based Platforms providing Kernel and Open Source code for IBNG platforms. You will work with Platform HW teams to understand architecture, develope/provide Linux-OS, FOSS (user-lang packages), drivers etc. You will work with Silicon vendors/OpenSource community to incorporate code in IBNG products.

Your Qualificaitons:


Self motivated, driven and a teammate. You are willing to learn and be passionate about working on a wide range of HW/SW networking products. Strong verbal and written communication skills. You have worked for 8-10 years on Linux based Networking product development with good exposure to Open Source Code usage in products. Excellent expertise on Open Source technologies, YOCTO, device drivers, Linux Distros etc. Experience as contributor or maintainer of Open Source will be a huge plus.

You must have worked with one of SoC architecture - ARM, x86, PPC, MIPS and famalier with many networking product system level tools used for debugging complex HW/SW problems. Good understanding of Linux kernel, drivers, PHY/MAC etc (work on HW board bring up will be plus). You are comfortable with using compilers, makefiles, Linkers etc and YOCTO/FreeOpenSourceSoftware tools and utilities.

Very good understanding of networking concepts, protocols and its usage in product configurations. Languages : c/c++, Python, shell scripts, exposure to JAVA are MUST. Exposure to very large code base and use of latest source code management/review tools is MUST (GIT, Gerrit etc.)

Why Cisco

We connect everything: people, processes, data, and things. We innovate everywhere, taking bold risks to craft the technologies that give us ability to learn cities, connected cars, and handheld hospitals. And we do it in style with rare personalities who aren’t afraid to change the way the world works, lives, plays and learns.We are leaders with vision, tech geeks, pop culture aficionados, and we even have a few purple haired rock stars. We celebrate the creativity and diversity that fuels our innovation. We are dreamers and we are doers.

We Are Cisco.

Company Bio: *
Jeunesse began in the hearts and minds of visionaries Randy Ray and Wendy Lewis.
Having achieved tremendous success in other enterprises, Randy and Wendy emerged from retirement to launch Jeunesse on September 09, 2009 at 9:00 p.m. The number 9, which represents longevity, reflected the founders’ desire to not only survive, but thrive.
Together we are creating a global movement that empowers people to reach their full potential — no matter their age, race, rank or income. Our story is just beginning.

Software Engineer

Investors Title Insurance Company

Morrisville, NC

***This is not a remote position***

Our team is building technology solutions that support current organizational operations, as well as developing state of the art systems that will provide the company a competitive advantage in the market place. Our products support our organization, as well as distributed partners that continue to drive our business.

In order for a candidate to be successful, you must be passionate about quality, highly self-motivated, committed to timely delivery of quality products and want to be part of an organization committed to continual improvement.

JOB QUALIFICATIONS AND REQUIREMENTS

ESSENTIAL:
Education: Bachelor of Science in related engineering or computer science discipline or equivalent experience.
4+ years of experience (multiple positions at multiple skill levels) working with database and/or reports work. SSRS and SQL Server experience preferred. ETL experience a plus. Must be able to maintain existing work as well as built out new functionality.
2+ years of experience constructing complex component and web-based applications, preferably but not limited to Microsoft .NET technologies.
As a software engineer:
You have proven proficiency in software engineering and have a track record of successful product delivery.
You must have worked closely with all stakeholders on feature priorization, planning production schedules and accurately estimating development work effort. You are comfortable and accountable for adhering to these established priorities and schedules.
You have successfully supported “today’s application” that is paying the bills, while at the same time worked on the next generation product that meets the organization’s strategic plans.
Skills: Undertakes detailed design and development work; excellent communication and organization skills; strong problem solving skills; Self-motivated and tenacious when tackling tough technical issues. Actively believes in and practices software engineering activities even when the near term costs are highly visible and the long term benefits are difficult to measure.
Knowledge: Solid knowledge of software engineering concepts and procedures. Understands Software Engineering and methodologies, and the impact of early decisions on later development stages of software projects.
DESIRED:
Proven proficiency in n-layered architectures. This means that you have designed and developed applications that separate the data layer, the business logic layer and the presentation layer.
Experience with Scrum or other agile and lean software development methodologies a plus.
Experience working in a “Continuous Build System”, such as with Team Foundation Server.
Familiarity with accounting and financial reporting applications, or insurance related field preferable.
Strong database programming and reporting skills.
Strong service-oriented (SOA) skills.
Demonstrated ability to write and utilize unit tests with minimal supervision.
Proficiency in C#, JSON, LINQ, MVC and SQL Server.
Proficiency in REST/WebAPI or similar HTTP-based technology
EXTRA CREDIT
Proficiency in ORM technologies such as NHibernate and Entity Framework.
ESSENTIAL JOB FUNCTIONS:
Delivers quality software, undertaking design, estimation, development, testing and ongoing support of new and existing features in support of Investors Title’s business operations.
Supports, utilizes and promotes agreed upon engineering department standards and processes.
Actively participates in the code review process to ensure quality deliverables.
Writes and maintains documentation (in-line and external) to describe program development, logic, coding, testing, changes, and corrections.
Works collaboratively, and communicates well with technical and non-technical colleagues and business users.
Makes unit tests and service test scripts an integral part of software delivery.
Participates in backlog grooming and requirements analysis to insure understanding of business needs. With this knowledge, assists in the translation of business requirements into design and/or vendor selection while adhering to underlying solution architecture.
Provides both high level and detailed work estimations in support of the project. Participates in the formation and development of agile processes, including planning, scrums, retrospective, and process improvement.
Keeps abreast of the latest industry trends and transfers knowledge to the team, which will assist in product and feature prioritization.
Recognized as an industry leader, Investors Title Insurance Company provides residential and commercial title insurance and innovative business solutions for our partners. The Company has been recognized with an AM Best rating of A, assigned a Financial Stability Rating of A” Unsurpassed from Demotech and a Kroll Rating of A. Working at Investors Title, you will find a dynamic and supportive culture, outstanding training and development, a variety of career paths, work/life balance, and excellent benefits.

The Company is an equal opportunity employer. As such, the Company offers equal employment opportunities without regard to race, color, religion, sex (including pregnancy), national origin, age, disability, genetic information, veteran status and other protected class characteristics.

Job Title: Shop Mechanic (3 yrs exp required) Based in Salinas w/seasonal relo to Yuma
Job Description:
D’Arrigo Bros. Co., of California, a 100-year old, rapidly growing Salinas based agricultural company, is looking for an accounting professional to join an enthusiastic team. We are one of the largest vegetable grower, packer and shippers, and we offer opportunities with excellent benefits and compensation.

Andy Boy has a rich history as an industry trend-setter, not a follower. From the day the company was founded by Stephen and Andrew D’Arrigo, two immigrants from Messina, Sicily, innovation has been its hallmark. With third generation D’Arrigo family members at the helm of our West Coast operations, you can be sure that the traditions of being the very best in the business emanate from the top and are carried out by our dedicated family of almost 2000 employees. Would you like to join this team?
DUTIES -* Work under the direction of the Vice President, Service Center, and supervisors. Position will require working in the field and in the shop preparing, troubleshooting and repairing harvesting and production equipment. Occasional field repairs at late hours, some Saturdays. There will be extended stays in Yuma, Arizona and Brawley, California during the winter harvest season.
Qualifications: *
· Responsible for the repair, maintenance and troubleshooting of all harvesting/production equipment.

· Must be knowledgeable in electrical, hydraulic, diesel engines, welding and BIT Program Inspections

· Minimum 3 years experience with building, repairing or modifying machinery or vehicles

· Basic knowledge of shop equipment and use of mechanical tools

· Welding/fabrication skills

· Ability to read drawings, and schematics

· Creativity and aptitude for identifying problems and finding alternative solutions

· Good observation skills

· Valid Class B (minimum) driver’s license w/air brake CDL or ability to obtain before end of 90 day probation period. Clean record required.

· Must be able to walk through a vegetable field on uneven surfaces, climb up and down noisy harvesting equipment, and use both hands to perform various tasks and be willing to do so in inclement weather conditions (including wind, dust, rain, heat, cold)

· Must be able to lift 40 pounds

· Regular and consistent attendance mandatory

· Work schedule will include occasional long hours including weekends and some holidays

· Organized team player who works well with a variety of people with a minimum of supervision

· Thrive in a fast paced environment and handle pressure

· Able to handle multiple tasks

· Good communication skills

· Operation of standard office equipment, including personal computers, photocopier, fax machines and appropriate software such as Windows, Microsoft Office applications
Preferred: *
· Spanish speaking

· AS degree in relevant technology (Welding, Agriculture and Industrial Technology, or Industrial Mechanics)

· Prior knowledge of electrical, hydraulic and pneumatic systems

Job Type: Full-time

Pay: $0.00 per hour

Benefits:
Dental insurance
Disability insurance
Employee assistance program
Health insurance
Life insurance
Paid time off
Vision insurance
Schedule:
8 hour shift
Monday to Friday
Overtime

mechanic: 3 years (Required)

Class B driver (Required)
Language:
Spanish (Preferred)

Job Description:
Looking for a career with a dynamic and fun team that values your skills and encourages your continual growth? *_Plus pays competitive wage with a $1,000 hiring bonus_?*

If expecting the unexpected is your strength, this is the service for you! This highly dynamic team works with our internship-trained emergency veterinarians to provide critical care when our patients need us most. You will fully utilize and grow your skills by learning RECOVER CPR and advanced procedures on this service while being supported by a team of veterinary assistants and kennel assistants. This service has 24 hour staffing 7 days a week so several shifts are available including day, swing and overnight. *Overnight shifts qualify for differential pay.*

Madison Veterinary Specialists is seeking full time and part time Certified Veterinary Technicians to join our Emergency department. This position includes swing, overnight, weekends, and some holidays. Previous experience is preferred.

The Certified Veterinary Technician provides caring, compassionate and detail-oriented nursing care for hospitalized patients and outpatients. They are responsible for correctly and efficiently executing treatments, diagnostics, and medication administration at the appropriate times under the direction of a Veterinarian. They must maintain detailed and correct medical records in the MVS electronic medical record keeping system, ImproMed, while ensuring all charges are correctly invoiced, along with updating and communicating with clients in a timely and respective manner.

Our ideal candidate possesses the following skills:

· Ability to work in a collaborative team setting

· Good communication skills and enjoy working with people

· Enjoy learning new skills and exploring new technologies

· Willingness to participate in additional training programs

· Provide input and assist with all aspects of patient care

· Excel in technical nursing skills including but not limited to: Venipuncture, Catheter placement

· Ability to obtain accurate radiology views

· Effective anesthesia monitoring

· Physical examinations and patient assessment

· Good Laboratory skill set including but not limited to: Manual differentials, UA

· Possess or demonstrate desire to obtain a solid understanding of the common medications used within an emergency & specialty practice

· Provide compassionate and timely care for our hospitalized patients
Qualifications: *
· Current State licensure as a Certified/Registered/Licensed Veterinary Technician

· Prior experience in an emergency and/or specialists’ practice is a plus

· 1+ years’ experience as a Certified Veterinary Technician or veterinary assistant preferred

· Knowledge of ImproMed software a plus
Education: *
· High School diploma or equivalent

· Formal Veterinary Technology education preferred

Madison Veterinary Specialists & Emergency provides a fast-paced and collaborative environment. We are dedicated to providing the highest standard of medical care along with excellent customer service. We offer internal training for each position with competitive wages and benefits packages including medical insurance, flexible scheduling, 401K plan with matching, uniforms, and continuing education allowance, as well as discounted pricing for your pet's care. Wage commensurate with skill and experience. Overnight shifts include a differential pay premium.

If you are an experienced veterinary technician looking for the perfect opportunity to hone and expand your skills with a growing practice, apply today!

Looking for employment AND an opportunity to make a difference? Join the PENRAD Imaging team! Discover how PENRAD Imaging provides excellent health care to the Southern Colorado region. PENRAD Imaging provides competitive salaries, a great working environment with state-of-the-art equipment & technology, and superior benefits which include low cost options for medical/dental benefits, and a fantastic 401k plan!

Exemplary patient care is just one of the many facets of health care that are valued here!

Summary Description
This position in responsible for applying their expertise in the area of obtaining diagnostic radiographic images while providing exemplary quality service to patients. This is a per diem position; the hours and location will vary based on business needs.

Essential Functions
Prepares patients for exams by greeting the patient by his/her name, obtaining patient history information necessary to perform or evaluate the procedure, and provides instructions and an explanation of the procedure to obtain the best possible image and reduce the patient’s anxiety.
Operates CT equipment to obtain high quality CT images as defined by exam specific protocols.
Prepares area for exam by ensuring the proper equipment and supplies are available before the patient is called for exam.
Performs venipuncture and obtains IV access for contrast injections.
Performs BUN and Creatinine clearance prior to injecting contrast to ensure patient safety.
Practices ALARA principles to reduce radiation exposure.
Works closely with the Radiologist to ensure proper protocol for exams performed.
Performs injections of nonionic contrast with a power injector, ensuring proper injection rates are used for optimal contrast enhancement. Documents the patient history and the amount of contrast injected.
Attends to patient’s care before, during and immediately following exam and notifies the appropriate party if patient’s condition changes at any time.
Performs daily inspections of equipment and reports immediately any quality concerns as well as equipment failures or deficiencies.
Sends all studies to PACS (image software), including any applicable prior studies.
Performs clerical duties related to the procedures including entering information into company-specific software and documenting information into patient charts.
Cleans exam rooms and restocks supplies for next patient.
Interfaces with Lead regarding any and all concerns.
Attends staff meetings regularly and follows all company policies and procedures.
Go to www.penrad.org to learn more about PENRAD Imaging. Visit the career tab for job opportunities and to submit an application and résumé, which are required to be considered.

We look forward to hearing from you!

Job Title: Truck Driver Class A otr 2yr exp
Job Description:
We are looking for an experienced truck driver in the OH PA or Illinois area who is reliable and pro active. You have the opportunity to have a partnership with financial growth and possibility of owning your own truck(if you choose to). $1500 sign on bonus available. Paid vacation after 6 months. Get paid up to 60% for a load. You can absolutely count on getting paid every week with no discrepancies. Looking for a driver who is willing to drive for at least 1 week straight and we are very flexible with home time.
Responsibilities*
Transport finished goods and raw materials over land to and from manufacturing plants or retail and distribution centers
Inspect vehicles for mechanical items and safety issues and perform preventative maintenance
Plan routes and meet delivery schedules
Comfortable choosing loads from load board
Document and log work/rest periods and miles spent driving and retain fuel/toll receipts
Comply with truck driving rules and regulations (size, weight, route designations, parking and break periods) as well as with company policies and procedures
Maneuver trucks into loading or unloading positions
Collect and verify delivery instructions
Report defects, accidents or violations
Skills*
2 yrs Proven work experience as a OTR driver
Must have CDL A for minimum of 2 years
Hands on experience with electronic equipment and software (GPS, AVL units, CB etc)
Ability to drive long hours and travel regularly. Available to drive 2-3 weeks at a time.
Extensive knowledge of applicable truck driving rules and regulations
No recent moving or driving violations
Adaptability and foresight to handle unexpected situations (traffic, weather conditions etc)
Valid truck driving license
No more than 2 moving violations in the past 2 year
No felony convictions in the past 15 years
No preventable accidents in the last 3 years
No failed drug test
No equipment abandonment
Great work history, clean PSP, background check
Great communication, professional attitude
Must know how to use a smartphone

Job Title: Commission Only - Experienced salesperson - restaurant software.
Job Description:
We are looking for e*xperienced sales persons* only, specifically, sales to restaurants.

If you do not have recent or relevant sales experiencein your resume, respectfully, we will not accept your application. Thank you for understanding.

However, if your experience includes more than *2 years of sales to restaurants as a vendor or supplier* including cold calling, or some other type of service to small restaurants in your area, we want to hear from you.

Compensation is *Commission only,* and all Sales Contractors will be 1099 independent contractors. If you are not familiar with this lifestyle, it may not be for you. There is no health insurance, and no guaranteed income. You earn based on what you can produce. Please be aware of this up front since this type of compensation will not be suitable for most people's life situation.
Restaurants need our help*
Many local and regional governments have recently ordered that all restaurants shut down dine in service, or severely limit their capacity. As a result, all restaurants must have online ordering in order to survive in the new reality.

The existing well known platforms for online ordering and delivery are very expensive or difficult for restaurant owners to set up and use, and many do not connect restaurant owners directly to their own customers for feedback and follow up.

You can help them solve this problem. We are a small tech startup who have created an online ordering platform for takeout and car hop that is affordable, simple to use, and accessible for late adopters of technology in a number of ways. But we need your help to reach them.

We are searching for Outside Sales representatives and account managers willing to work as *independent contractors* in assigned territories throughout the United States.

Top performers could have the potential to earn a handsome income. Our associates earn 50% of net on all residual monthly subscription fees. Competitors charge in the range of $30 - $300+ per month for similar services, so you can do the math. We handle all the tech development and tech support for the platform. You handle customer service that is not tech related only for your clients, such as training and help with setup.
Why should you work with us?*
Be your own boss - make your own schedule, work at your own pace.
Residual Commissions – Sell once, keep earning every month. As long as the contract is active.
Growing Industry – Many tech startups in restaurant technology have gone from zero to billion dollar businesses, you can become an expert in that industry.
Earning Potential – As a sales agent, your ability to grow is limited only by your ability and ambition.
Flexible Schedule – You can create your own hours to best meet your goals.
Our Value Propositions – Our mission is to provide an overwhelming value for our clients.
Required Qualifications: *
As previously mentioned, this is an offer for an *independent contractor* as defined by your state of residence. Compensation is *Commission only*. All Sales Contractors are 1099 independent contractors and are responsible for incorporating for themselves within 30 days if not already incorporated.

We are primarily looking for sales experience, especially sales to restaurants, such as a restaurant supplier or service, who has many contacts with small businesses in their local area.
*2+ years experience selling products or services to local restaurants *in your area.
Motivated professional engaged in a long-term career in sales.
Self-starter, but able to work within a team environment.
Compassionate individual with a passion for helping small business owners succeed. Ethical behavior and integrity is required.
Background free from serious criminal offenses, current criminal investigations, or restraining orders.
Familiarity with social media and social media advertising.
Comfortable with software and technology or willing to learn.
Dedication to training to continuously improve as a salesperson.
Have own laptop, smartphone.
Ability to network and self-generate sales
Driver’s license, auto insurance, and vehicle required
Preferred Qualifications: *
Connections with many local independent restaurants
In some areas such as Southern California, it would be an advantage to be a native or fluent Spanish speaker.
Experience in networking within the community, especially restaurants.
Sales Representative responsibilities include: *
Cold Calling restaurants throughout assigned territory to sell online menu and online ordering Software As A Service (SAAS) products to restaurants.
Presenting our value proposition and cost-benefit analyses to existing and potential customers.
Maintaining positive business relationships to ensure future sales.
Negotiate prices and contracts.
Demonstrate products using phone and laptop, and emphasizes product features.
Set up and maintain account for restaurant by creating and updating online menus, or training their staff how to do it.
Take photos, or schedule local photographers, or train restaurant to take photos of menu items and upload them to the website.
Help restaurant set up Google My Business, Facebook Pages, Instagram etc.
Follow up on new leads and referrals resulting from field activity or lead generation.
Quotes and negotiates prices and credit terms and prepares sales contracts for customer accounts obtained.
Our company provides equal opportunities to all employees and contractors without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity or expression, national origin, age, disability, or genetics. We expect the same from our contractors, associates, business partners, suppliers, and affiliates.

\*\* Because of Covid-19, and that this role may require visiting restaurants in person (at your discretion). If so, you must be free from conditions that are considered as risk factors for Covid-19 infection as defined by the CDC. https://www.cdc.gov/coronavirus/2019-ncov/need-extra-precautions/people-with-medical-conditions.html

You also may wish to interact with restaurant owners in person at times. If so you should be familiar with, and willing to take precautions such as wearing masks and social distancing as appropriate.

Do you love the feeling at the end of the day, knowing you have changed someone's life?

Are you looking to become part of a family, instead of becoming just another employee?

Aurora Santa Rosa Hospital is an Acute Psychiatric Hospital that caters to patients who suffer from a wide variety of Mental Health diagnoses. We pride ourselves on our Patient-Centered care while maintaining an engaging environment for our staff. Our Vision Statement "Empowering people to embrace healing for fulfilling and productive lives" pertains not only to our patients but also to our visitors and employees. The Hospital believes in bettering the lives of everyone who walks through our doors.
Benefits For Full-Time Employees Include: *
· Medical

· Vision

· Dental

· 401K

· 5 Weeks Paid Time Off

· Tuition Reimbursement $3,000 a year and $12,000 Lifetime

· CEU's (Continuing Educations Units) are provided at no charge to the employee

· $25,000 Life insurance policy is provided at no charge to the employee

· Relocation expenses can be discussed and be part of the employment offer
DESCRIPTION OF POSITION: *
Organizes and administers areas of Nursing Services to attain the facility’s objectives established by the governing authority.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: *
· Organizes programs, policies and procedures that are developed to assess, evaluate and meet the needs of patients of inpatient psychiatric services, psychiatric outpatient clinics and transitional psychiatric programs.

· Plans, supervises and coordinate(s) care given by RN, LVN, LPT, and other mental health workers.

· Plans and assigns staffing rations based on patient needs, acuity, staff competency and regulatory requirements

· Implements standards of nursing practice in the behavioral healthcare setting, annually reviewing and revising as necessary to reflect changes in nursing practice.

· Addresses and supports cultural practices as long as such practices do not harm others or interfere with the planned course of therapy.

· Clear, concise and current written policies and procedures are available to assist the staff and minimize risk factors.

· Performs all aspects of patient care in an environment that optimizes patient safety and reduces the likelihood of medical/health care errors.

· Supports and maintains a culture of safety and quality.

· Serves as the internal Infection Control liaison to the corporate Infection Prevention consultant.

· Perform and direct surveillance and related activities, including the investigation of clusters of infections above expected levels and single cases of unusual health care associated infections, ongoing collection and review of data as well as required follow-up and collaboration/cooperation with the Infection Preventionist.

· Provide consultation on surveillance measures and infectious diseases as required.

· Monitor implementation of infection control policies, procedures, and practices.

· Participate in the development and implementation of improved patient care procedures, employee health activity, and infection control in-service education.

· Assist with verification of required reporting to public health authorities.

· Provide information and reports relative to all aspects of the infection control program as may be required by the Safety/Infection Control Committee is reported to the PI and MEC

· Provides oversight of the infection surveillance, environmental rounds, hand hygiene audits, and immunization program performed by staff in the Nursing Department.

· Recommends modifications, additions or deletions of personnel policies to ensure reasonable hours and acceptable working conditions to provide patient care coverage.

· Initiates and participates in problem solving, policy forming conferences for psychiatric patient care services. Maintains close coordination with all departments to ensure continuity and collaboration of services.

· Participates with the Governing Body, management, medical staff and clinical leaders in the facility's decision-making process.

· Plans and recommends to CEO new facilities or equipment or modifications thereto needed to provide patient care.

· Serves as a member of professional staff committees in matters pertaining to patient care.

· Participates in the Executive Finance, Board of Trustees and Medical Staff departmental meetings.
KEY RESPONSIBILITIES: *
· Plans and coordinates with the Vice President of Finance, utilizing the respective service managers for planning the budgeting requirements for staff, performance of work, supplies and equipment.

· Responsible for cost controls to ensure maximum effectiveness of funds expended from approved departmental budgets.

· Implements an effective, ongoing program to measure, assess and improve the quality of nursing care delivered to psychiatric patients.

· Ensures each nursing department's performance improvement program interfaces with and supports the nursing department performance improvement program.

· Assures that nursing leaders review monthly performance improvement compliance with established indicators and sees that corrective actions are taken when negative outcomes are identified.

· Collaborates with facility leaders in developing, implementing, reviewing, revising and monitoring facility wide performance improvement activities.

· Facilitates the patient's access to the appropriate level of care and setting.

· Performs related duties, as requested.

· Upholds the Organization's ethics and customer service standards
Knowledge and Experience: *
· Graduate of an accredited school of nursing

· Master’s Degree in Healthcare Management or Nursing, or related field

· Minimum of five (5) years prior experience in patient care services

· Current CA RN License
Skills and Abilities: *
· Maintains confidentiality of patients at all times

· Sensitivity to and willingness to interact with persons of various social, cultural, economic and educational backgrounds.

· Proficiency with software and/or equipment (Microsoft Office applications including Outlook, Word, Excel and PowerPoint.)

· Strong organizational skills with ability to prioritize projects, work relatively independently, manage multiple tasks, and meet deadlines.

· Strong written and verbal communication skills.

· Strong interpersonal skills. Ability to work with people with a variety of background and educational levels.

· Ability to work independently and as part of a team.

· Good judgment, problem solving and decision-making skills.

· Demonstrated commitment to working collaboratively as well as possessing the skills to lead, influence, and motivate others.

· Ability to work in a fast-paced, expanding organization.

Physical Requirements*:

· Use standard office equipment and access, input, and retrieve information from a computer. Use computer keyboard with manual and finger dexterity and wrist-finger speed sufficient to perform repetitive actions efficiently for extended periods of time.

· Communicate effectively in person or via telephone in a manner which can be understood by those with whom the person is speaking, including a diverse population.

· Give and follow verbal and written instructions with attention to detail and accuracy.

· Perform complex mental functions and basic arithmetic functions; interpret complex laws, regulations, and policies; collect, interpret, and/or analyze complex data and information.

· Vision: see details of objects at close range.

· Coordinate multiple tasks simultaneously.

· Reach forward, up, down, and to the side.

· Sit or stand for minimum periods of one hour at a time and come and go from the work area repeatedly throughout the day.

· Lift up to five (5) pounds.

Summary: *Diagnose, service, repair, recondition and assemble new and used customer and dealership equipment including small handheld equipment to large row crop equipment. Maintains and operates shop equipment and tools, performs quality work, as quickly and profitably as possible. Must be able to learn and use lap-top / tablet communications software. *Preferred 5 years of experience.*
Essential Duties and Responsibilities *include the following. Other duties may be assigned.
Diagnose, repair, recondition, service, and assemble equipment as assigned by Service Manager.

Repairs equipment, including but not limited to, all size tractors, small engines, lawn mowers, all-terrain vehicles, construction and farm equipment.

Maintains accurate and easy to read records of work performed.

Reports any work shortages and malfunctions of shop equipment to Service Manager.

Completely disassembles and inspects equipment as quickly as possible, so parts may be ordered promptly, and machine work can be properly quoted and scheduled.

Recommends any additional necessary repairs to Service Manager and/or Customer.

Keeps shop vehicles clean and properly serviced. Reports any problems with vehicles to Service
Manager.

Stays up to date with technical changes and participates in continuing education with factory service schools.

Pays special attention to repeat repairs or comebacks to correct problems and avoid future job comebacks and unnecessary dealership expenses.

Fabricates and welds metal parts together when necessary.

Makes service calls as assigned by Service Manager.
Competencies: *To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies:
Problem Solving - Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations.

Technical Skills - Assesses own strengths and weaknesses; Pursues training and development opportunities; Strives to continuously build knowledge and skills; Shares expertise with others.

Adaptability - Adapts to changes in the work environment; Manages competing demands; Changes approach or method to best fit the situation; Able to deal with frequent change, delays, or unexpected events.

Dependability - Follows instructions, responds to management direction; Takes responsibility for own actions; Keeps commitments; Commits to long hours of work when necessary to reach goals; Completes tasks on time or notifies appropriate person with an alternate plan.

Planning/Organizing - Prioritizes and plans work activities; Uses time efficiently; Plans for additional resources; Sets goals and objectives; Organizes or schedules other people and their tasks; Develops realistic action plans.

Quality - Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness; Looks for ways to improve and promote quality;
Applies feedback to improve performance; Monitors own work to ensure quality.

Quantity - Meets productivity standards; Completes work in timely manner; Strives to increase productivity; Works quickly.

Safety and Security - Observes safety and security procedures; Determines appropriate action beyond guidelines; Reports potentially unsafe conditions; Uses equipment and materials properly.
Qualifications: *
To perform this job successfully, an individual must be able to perform each essential duty satisfactorily.
The requirements listed below are representative of the knowledge, skill, and/or ability required.
Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. Must own a large assortment of hand, pneumatic, and/or cordless tools.
Education/Experience: *
Preferred Associate degree (A. A.) or equivalent from two-year college or technical school; and/or 3 years of minimum related experience and/or training; or equivalent combination of education and experience.
Language Ability: *
Ability to read, analyze, and interpret general business periodicals, professional journals, technical procedures, or governmental regulations. Ability to effectively present information and respond to questions from groups of managers, clients, customers, and the public.
Math Ability: *
Ability to add, subtract, multiply, and divide in all units of measure, using whole numbers, common fractions, and decimals. Ability to compute rate, ratio, and percent and to draw and interpret bar graphs.
Reasoning Ability: *
Ability to define problems, collect data, establish facts, and draw valid conclusions. Ability to interpret an extensive variety of technical instructions in mathematical or diagram form and deal with several abstract and concrete variables.
Computer Skills: *
To perform this job successfully, an individual should have knowledge of or the ability to gain knowledge of Microsoft Internet Explorer or an equivalent and Keystone Industry Software.
Certificates and Licenses: *
Valid Texas Driver License
Preferred: Technical school certification; certified air conditioning repair certification and forklift certification.
Other Requirements: *
Must supply your own hand tools and keep them in a tool chest that is in good condition.
Supervisory Responsibilities: *
This job has no supervisory responsibilities.
Work Environment: *
The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.

While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly exposed to work near moving mechanical parts; work in high, precarious places; fumes or airborne particles; toxic or caustic chemicals and outdoor weather conditions. The employee is occasionally exposed to vibration.

The noise level in the work environment is usually loud.
Physical Demands: *
The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 100 pounds. Specific vision abilities required by this job include close vision, distance vision, peripheral vision, depth perception and ability to adjust focus. While performing the duties of this job, the employee is regularly required to stand; walk; use hands to finger, handle, or feel and reach with hands and arms. The employee is frequently required to stoop, kneel, crouch, or crawl; talk or hear and taste or smell. The employee is occasionally required to sit and climb or balance.

About SugarCRM, Inc.
SugarCRM is a customer experience (CX) leader enabling businesses to create profitable customer relationships by delivering highly relevant, personalized experiences throughout the customer journey. We empower companies to strengthen existing customer relationships, create new ones through actionable insights and intelligent automation and better understand the customer at every stage of the journey. This enables businesses to accelerate demand generation, grow revenue, deliver superior customer care and increase loyalty. Our easy-to-use, intuitive platform makes customer experience easy and accessible for everyone, allowing marketing, sales and services professionals to focus on high-impact, value-adding activities that create customers for life.

As an Integration Engineer you will play a critical role in connecting Sugar’s Marketing platform to its many partners and data sources, helping to architect the underlying frameworks that facilitate the exchange of data. In addition to integrations with leading CRMs and other marketing data sources you’ll work on challenging pipelines connecting the marketing platform with our ever-growing customer base. You have a high attention to detail, and like being the swiss army knife in a technical role.
Impact you will make in the role:
Design and develop integrations to CRMs, social media platforms, etc.
Design and implement custom integrations to the Sugar Marketing platform
Contribute to the overall architecture of Sugar Marketing integration platform and layered frameworks
Develop applications written in Microsoft .NET framework / C#
Invest in automated testing and surrounding best practices
Develop microservices and associated APIs
Provide engineering support for existing integrations as an escalation path from support
Expertise you will bring in:
2-4 years of experience with Microsoft .NET development
Experience integrating with third-party APIs using both SOAP and RESTful approaches
Strong familiarity with object-oriented principles, design patterns, and SOLID principles
Experience with .NET Core and C# development over Linux as well as Windows
Experience with event frameworks (Kafka, Kinesis, RabbitMQ, etc.)
Exposure to Agile methodologies
Experience with package management (nuget, myget)
Working experience with AWS, and Server Management
High attention to detail and quality-driven development mentality
Experience with automated unit testing highly desired
Excellent written and verbal communication skills including the ability to interact directly with customers
Exceptional problem solving and resolution skills
Innate drive, self-motivation and work ethic
BS/MS in Computer Science (or related) or equivalent work experience
We understand that no candidate is perfectly qualified for any job. Experience comes in different forms; many skills are transferable; and passion goes a long way. Even more important than your resume is a clear demonstration of dedication, impact, and the ability to thrive in a fluid and collaborative environment. We want you to learn new things in this role, and we encourage you to apply if your experience is close to what we’re looking for. We also know that diversity of background and thought makes for better problem solving and more creative thinking, which is why we're dedicated to adding new perspectives to the team.
Benefits and Perks:
Beyond a stellar work environment, friendly people, and inspiring work, we have some great benefits and perks:

- Excellent medical, dental and vision coverage for you and your family, along with other benefit plans including 401(k) match
- Unlimited Paid Time Off
- Wellness Reimbursement Program
- Onsite Programs, depending on location, such as Dry Cleaning, Car Washes, Massage, Yoga, and more
- Career & Personal Development Program – multi-platform
- Regular social events
- Ownership is the greatest self-identity at SugarCRM - you are making an immediate impact
- We are a merit-based company - many opportunities to learn, excel and grow your career

Job Title: Front End, Back End and Full stack Developers and Database Developers. Virtual Hiring Event
Job Description:
Software Developer Virtual Career Chat

Event Details
Date: Thursday, October 29, 2020

What We're Hiring For

Front End, Back End and Full stack Developers and Database Developers.

Intake Details:

Requirements

Applicants must be authorized to work for any employer in the U.S.

Technical requirements

How does a virtual event work?
Register: Create a Brazen account (name, email, password) and complete the registration form
Explore: View information about SAIC and career opportunities
Attend: Log into your Brazen account and join the chat from any device, at any time
Chat: Participate in 1-on-1 chats with our hiring team
What to bring to this event

Explore our NEW careers page: jobs.saic.com

What to wear

Dress code is whatever you want! There is not a video feature for this event..

About SAIC

SAIC® is a premier Fortune 500® technology integrator driving our nation’s digital transformation across the defense, space, civilian, and intelligence markets. Our offerings include high-end solutions in engineering, IT modernization, and mission solutions. Headquartered in Reston, Virginia, SAIC has approximately 25,500 employees and annual revenues of about $7.1 billion.

What is a Virtual Hiring Event?
Virtual hiring events are a great way for employers and jobseekers to connect, even if they aren't in the same physical location. Hiring is a human process, and they would like to talk with you online (either through chat, on the phone, or video) to see if you’re a fit!

As part of our team, responsibilities may include:

Supporting the planning, requirements, design, development, testing, deployment, and maintenance of high performance, innovative software applications
Integrate best practices in software design, development and deployment
Implement high quality, secure and maintainable code using standard software design patterns and best practices
Troubleshoot software problems and provide solutions to overcome those problems using the latest technologies
Work in team environments across a diverse set of projects with multiple stakeholders

Job Title: LPN - Private Duty - Nights - $1,000 Sign-On Bonus
Job Description:
Description:

Offering Premium Pay, Comprehensive Benefits Package

including Paid-Time-Off, Vacation Pay and 401 (k) with company match

7:00 p.m. to 7:00 a.m. - 12-hour shifts

Week #1 - Monday/Tuesday/Saturday/Sunday

Week #2 - Wednesday/Thursday/Friday

Rotating Nights Every Other Week

Patient Home Location - Buchanan TN

Branch Office Location - Martin TN

Providing individualized care . . . one patient at a time

Who we are

AbilisHealth is a leading provider of home health and skilled private duty services. We cover 61 counties, with close to 500 employees serving nearly 4,000 patients in the past year. Our model of tirelessly serving patients, caregivers, and the community will become the industry benchmark. Our success is largely based upon hiring ambitious team members who provide outstanding patient care.

Caregiver opportunity

We are seeking an empathetic, motivated and committed individual to fill our compassionate Licensed Practical Nurse (LPN) opportunity. The skilled LPN will provide nursing assessment, planning, and care to maximize the comfort and health of our patients and their families. If you have a heart to serve others by caring for patients’ individualized needs the way you'd care for the needs of your own family, we want you on our team.

What this role can offer you

In this role, you will provide direct patient care within a patient’s home. You will have the satisfaction of knowing you're ensuring the patient receives optimal care, by assessing, planning, implementing, reevaluating and revising care and coordinating resources. Among other responsibilities, you will update and maintain patient records and implement orders for medications and treatments.

What AbilisHealth offers

FUN, POSITIVE, and PROFESSIONAL culture
HIGHLY COMPETITIVE pay.
Be EMPOWERED by working INDEPENDENTLY with a FLEXIBLE work schedule
BENEFITS: Medical, Dental, Vision, Disability, and Life insurance plus 401 (k) with company match and Paid Time Off
Generous referral BONUSES
Continuing education and refresher training.

Responsibilities

Perform selected nursing procedures within the scope of LPN practice
Provide patient and family teaching according to plan outlined by the RN
Monitor patient's vital signs and make specific measurements and observations
Monitor and record intake and output. Report significant changes immediately
Observe, assess and record patient's physical and mental condition and reports any changes
Administer medications as instructed and as ordered by the physician and instructed by the RN. Document the patient's file accordingly
Attend and participate in multi-disciplinary patient case conferences, staff meetings and in-service education programs as assigned
Cooperate with on-call schedule, weekends and after hour visits, as necessary
. Requirements:
License Practical Nurse / LPN license in the state of Tennessee, in good standing
Previous experience in home health, skilled private duty nursing, hospice, hospital or skill nursing facility setting
Familiarity with medical software and equipment / Brightree aplus
Ability to build rapport with patients
Strong problem solving and critical thinking skills
Ability to thrive in a fast-paced environment
Reliable transportation, valid driver's license and current auto insurance

ACV Auctions is reinventing a $100 billion industry through an online, wholesale vehicle marketplace that provides car dealerships a more effective and transparent way of buying and selling wholesale vehicles through 20-minute auctions. Our technology modernizes the entire arc of auction operations, providing third- party inspections, account management, title and payment processing, managing arbitration and transportation. The company strives to be the most trusted source in the industry for dealers to buy and sell wholesale vehicles. The company is growing 300% year-over-year and recently completed a $150 million Series E funding round from investors such as Bessemer Venture Partners and Bain Capital Ventures.

Who we are looking for:


ACV Auctions is looking for a Software Engineer that will work on the Front-End Infrastructure team. This team is focused on building and delivering new product features that will change the way our customers experience and interact with ACV auctions. We are committed to being an innovative leader in the online auction space and we are seeking strong talent who can deliver on audacious goals and product features. In this role you will get to work alongside a team of software and production engineers, creating new features related to our core auction and bidding systems.

We value practical software experience in addition to a thorough understanding of computer science fundamentals. The technologies you are familiar with are less important to us than your ability to solve complex software problems and apply software engineering best practices.

What you will do:
Design, develop, and maintain code for our online vehicle listing and bidding platform.
Develop code to enhance the inventory viewing and bidding experience for our customers
Design and deliver solutions that add transparency and trust to the virtual auction space.
Collaborate with software and production engineers to design scalable services, plan feature roll-out, and ensure high reliability and performance for your products.
Conduct code reviews, contribute high-quality documentation and build robust test suites for your products.
Grow and mentor other engineers within the team and cross-functionally based on personal strengths and capabilities.
Have the opportunity to be active in community events surrounding the tech start-up and incubator space here in downtown Buffalo.
What you will need:


BS degree in Computer Science or a related technical discipline or equivalent practical experience.
Minimum 5 years of experience working with relational and distributed databases.
Minimum 5 years of experience working with at least one or a combination of the following: AngularJS, React, Vue.js
Experience in a highly iterative environment with automated testing and continuous delivery.
Minimum 5 years of experience developing highly trafficked front-end web applications
Minimum 7 years of experience programming with Javascript.
Preferred Qualifications
Experience working on distributed computing problems. Knowledge of the CAP Theorem and trade-offs between different consistency models.
An understanding of fundamental functional programming concepts.
Experience building RPC services using either Thrift, gRPC, or equivalent
Experience with containers and Kubernetes.
Experience with Domain-driven Development.
ACV Auctions is an equal opportunity employer (EOE) and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law.

Job Title: Executive Director - MUST HAVE ASSISTED LIVING EXPERIENCE
Job Description:
The Executive Director is totally responsible for the management of the Assisted Living and Memory Care community. Also, ensures high quality resident care services, within budgetary guidelines, while meeting or exceeding Harbor Retirement Associates, LLC, standards, and responsible for compliance with federal, state, local and HRA policies, procedures and regulations. The Executive Director is responsible to lead the community by example exhibiting the CORE Values through servant leadership.
Essential Functions: *
Internal Community Relations: *
Develops and implements community resident relations programs; solicits feedback from residents, families, and others to maintain and/or improve community hospitality and services
Establishes effective relationships with other community department heads to ensure high quality resident care while fostering an inter-departmental cooperation.
Oversees and monitors nursing services (if applicable) to ensure high quality nursing delivery systems
Monitor resident care on a daily basis; conduct daily rounds; implement quality assurance programs for all departments.
Establish positive rapport with regulatory agencies; keep updated on changes in federal, state, and local regulations
Oversee facility management of the community
Directs community safety and loss prevention program; monitors adherence to safety rules and regulations and takes remedial action when necessary
Contacts the resident’s family when a change in services is needed. Leads and participates in a resident/family conference to review changes in services
Ensures a high degree of customer satisfaction
Assist in the development of the residence’s budget
Make final decision on resident move-ins and move-outs based on the well-being of the resident and in accordance with the residence policies and procedures
Financial: *
Plans and develops operating budget within HRA guidelines
Regularly monitors department performance and regularly analyzes the community P&L status taking corrective action when necessary
Is prepared for and attends monthly P&L teleconferences as scheduled

Directs and monitors community inventory control systems
Responsible for managing all contracted services
Marketing: *
Maintain a high level of occupancy
Associate Relations:
Oversees the recruitment, selection, retention and termination of all community associates
Ensures adequate and effective orientation and training of community job-specific duties
Supervises and evaluates all community managers by providing ongoing coaching and timely feedback
Ensures that all associates meet or exceed HRA’s standards of appearance, sanitation and health standards
Establishes positive associate relations programs, recognition programs and practices
Oversees and manages the community compensation, recommending wage increases and adjustments when necessary
Ensures that all staff maintains and protects the confidentiality of resident information at all times
Provides an “open door” to associates and address any concerns and grievances within a timely manner and in accordance to company standards
Ensures the appropriate handling of on-the-job injuries as reported by associates
Provides leadership and direction in the marketing of the residence including developing relations with local referral sources Represents the residence to the community, family members, and visitors and develop positive relations with all customers
Non-Essential Functions: *
Encourages teamwork and promotes company philosophy
Participates Life Enrichment activities when able
Is prompt and able to perform the required duties of the position on a regular, predictable basis
Becomes familiar and understands how to report a missing person using the Safe Return program or equivalent
Becomes familiar and understands the steps for fire evacuation
All associates are responsible for maintaining a safe and secure environment for all community residents
Qualifications/Skills/Educational Requirements: *
Bachelor’s Degree
Current s ECC and/or CORE Training certification as required and/or Community Residential Care Facility Administration (CRCF)
Strong leadership skills with a minimum of two (2) years’ experience in supervising and management
One to two years
Experience using Microsoft Office and Outlook software. Mid-level typing skills required
Able to communicate effectively with all levels of management, associates, residents, family members, and outside contacts
Able to calculate figures and amounts such as discounts, interest, commissions, proportions, percentages, etc. Able to manage revenue and expense budget
Knowledge of current Federal and State laws pertaining to IL, AL, MC, SNF communities respectively
Able to make independent decisions
Must possess a passion to work with and around senior citizens
