Resilient Coders is a highly competitive, free and stipended not-for-profit coding bootcamp. We train young adults of color from low income backgrounds in software engineering, and connect them with jobs as such. We do this because we believe in social justice through economic empowerment; and we understand that we all have a moral and economic imperative to create pathways to automation-resilient careers in our Black and Latinx communities.

We’re looking for a Development Associate. We’re growing this year, and we need to grow our philanthropic efforts. You will be working alongside (and reporting directly to) the Chief of Staff.

Your mission will be to:
Prospect. Identify prospective funders. This includes foundations and individual donors. You’ll use your research skills to learn about the local philanthropy landscape and help design strategies for our donors.
Write. You will be writing grant applications and reports. You will also be communicating with our donors through emails and newsletters relying on historic communications.
Manage our database. You will be the keeper of our donor data. Your role will consist of entering and updating our donor information in our CRM database (Hubspot).
Here are the specific competencies and attributes we’re looking for in an ideal candidate:
You’re mission-focused. You care deeply and intimately about the economic wellness of our Black and Latinx communities here in Eastern Massachusetts. We’ll look forward to hearing examples from your past in which you’ve acted on this passion.
You’re organized. You will be managing lots of information. You build and rely on systems to keep your data accurate, updated, and communicable. We look forward to hearing examples of moments in which you took piles of data and designed a system by which to manage and understand them.
You have the written communication skills to adequately and equitably represent our students. You’ll be spending most of your time writing. We’ll look forward to your persuasive arguments in favor of your candidacy.
We are, first and foremost, a community of activists. Our work is rooted in history, social justice, and empirical evidence. Our team is an exceptional group of fighters who act with a sense of urgency, as though the economic wellness of their neighborhoods is under threat. We see Resilient Coders as a vehicle towards a bigger movement. Similarly, our fundraising values are rooted in community organizing. The goal of the development team is to maximize the financial well-being of the communities we serve through movement building. The number of people who commit to racial equity and join our coalition is as, if not more, important than the amounts they give.
We’re CORI friendly and indifferent to whether or not you have a college degree. Please send an email to hiring_at_resilientcoders.org, with your resume attached and the initials of our Chief of Staff in the subject line, along with the position you’re interested in. Please let us know, in your email, why you’re right for this role. We may invite you, within a week, to respond to a brief online survey in lieu of a phone screen. We do regret that we’re unable to respond to all applicants.
This role will be fully remote through the end of 2020.
Resilient Coders is an equal opportunity (EEO) employer. We hire without regard to age, color, disability, gender (including gender identity), marital status, national origin, race, religion, sex, sexual orientation, veteran status, or any other status protected by applicable law.

Provident Memory Care is currently seeking Certified Nursing Assistants and Certified Medication Attendants. Qualified candidates must be willing to work 12 hour shifts and be a team player. Interested parties may submit a resume. *
JOB DESCRIPTION AND PERFORMANCE STANDARDS*
Position Title: _Medication Attendant_*
Facility Name: Purpose of this position
The purpose of this position is to follow facility policies and procedures to implement medication order; to administer medications in an accurate and timely manner.
Qualifications*
Education: High School Graduate or equivalent

License or Certification: Certified in Texas as a medication aide or completed RN Delegation for medication administration

Experience: One year experience in a medical setting preferred
Delegation of authority
Authority is delegated to the individual in this position to:
Follow established facility policies and procedures to administer medications to residents in accordance with physician’s orders.
Provide emergency care to resident when necessary.
Requisition adequate medications and supplies to administer mediations in a timely manner.
Participate in supervision of care provided to residents.
This position reports to: * Resident Care Supervisor
_Medication Attendant Performance Standards_*
Follow established standards to implement facility policies and procedures related to medication administration.
Interpret existing policies and procedures related to medication administration to nursing assistants, residents, and families.
Obtain report from nurse being relieved and record sufficient information related to medication administration to implement accurate medication administration.
Administer and document medications to residents in an accurate, timely manner according to physician orders.
Monitor residents for effectiveness of drug therapy and occurrence of adverse effects. Notify charge nurse of problems.
Performs nurse aide functions when not administering medications.
Responsible for the distribution and documentation of resident snacks and supplements.
Attend staff meetings, interdisciplinary team meetings, rehabilitation meetings, in-service classes and committee meetings as assigned.
Assume responsibility for compliance with federal, State and local regulations within the assigned unit.
Perform comprehensive assessment of residents as assigned.
Promptly report changes in residents’ conditions to the charge nurse and take follow-up action as necessary.
Follow facility discharge /transfer procedures related to medication transfer providers.
Respond to residents’ call for assistance promptly.
Verify accuracy of narcotic count, check emergency kit and exchange keys.
Order, receive and store medications accurately and appropriately.
Document resident progress notes as required.
Administer and document medications to residents in an accurate, timely manner according to physician orders.
Order, receive and store medications accurately and appropriately. Maintains neat and orderly medication room.
Maintains a homelike atmosphere. Maintains clean, neat, comfortable, safe environment for residents, staff, and visitors including housekeeping duties as assigned.
Assists with resident activity programs as assigned.
Assist with serving meals and dining room duties as instructed. Escorts residents to and from dining room while encouraging residents to find their own way.
Demonstrates knowledge of infection control via proper handling of equipment, soiled linen, bedpans, urinals, and adequate hand washing.
Receives report from the previous shift and medication assistant.
Reads the shift-to-shift report and shower schedule for information and changes before coming on shift. Documents in the shift-to-shift report book and ADL binder before going off shift.
Consistently work cooperatively with residents, nursing staff, physicians, families, consultant personnel, community agencies and ancillary service providers.
Observe all facility policies and procedures.
Come to work in a clean, neat uniform and consistently present an appropriate professional appearance.
Come to work as scheduled and consistently demonstrate dependability and punctuality.

Job Title: Experienced Electrician Specialist- Full Time- Harrah's & Harveys
Job Description:
JOB SUMMARY: *
This is a technical trade position requiring a substantial level of experience and confidence in working with various types of electrical systems and equipment. This role has responsibility for ensuring safe and efficient operation of critical assets and building systems. Candidate will also be responsible for accurate reporting in the department MMS system and any other reporting tools, timely completion of work assignments with a high level of productivity while maintaining high positivity in a fast paced work environment. Job duties will include the following but will not be limited to;

KEY JOB FUNCTIONS*:
Troubleshoot electrical assets and systems typically associated with commercial Casino Resorts.
Professionally install electrical conduit, conductors and equipment with the ability to properly calculate the appropriate sizing of all components involved.
Demonstrate competency in tools of the trade.
Demonstrate full competency and comply with electrical safety measures required by OSHA, NFPA, NEC. All work should properly utilize Lock Out Tag Out resources when applicable and proper safety PPE shall be utilized accordingly.
Understands all regional permitting and administrative codes to ensure full compliance with regulatory requirements. Ensures permit required electrical work performed by self is in full code compliance with the National Electrical Code and properly permitted through local regulating agencies.
Per OSHA guidelines must participate in all company provided safety training and follow all required safety guidelines and processes established in the department.
Will be required to hit deadlines and complete job tasks as set by Facilities leadership without direct monitoring or oversight.
Will support team compliance to company and department policies and procedures.
EDUCATION and/or EXPERIENCE: *
Must have at least 3 years of recent electrical experience in maintenance management and building automation systems
High school diploma or equivalent
QUALIFICATIONS: *
Literate and fluent in English
Able to read work orders, apply knowledge and experience with materials to determine types and amounts of materials required to cover work pieces.
Strong understanding of AC and DC electrical systems up to and including 480 volts.
Strong computer skills and software knowledge will be required. Position will be in consistent use of Microsoft office programs, building management/automation software, electronic MMS work order systems, and company specific programs.
Should possess basic blueprint reading skills to help ensure understanding of existing systems or any proposed as built additions.
Ability to uphold and demonstrate the highest level of integrity in all situations and recognize standards required by a regulated business
Acts as a role model to other Team Members and always presents oneself as a credit to Caesars Entertainment and encourages others to do the same.
Adheres to all regulatory, company and department policies and procedures
PHYSICAL, MENTAL and ENVIRONMENTAL DEMANDS: *
Visual and auditory field must include immediate environment.
Physical mobility to move about property quickly.
Must have the ability to handle tools, supplies and equipment exceeding 50lbs, utilizing tool assistance as needed.

_Our Company_*
Code Platoon is a non-profit coding bootcamp that prepares US military veterans and military spouses for software development careers. We’ve served 120+ students over 14 cohorts since 2016 with a strong 80%+ job placement rate due to our small class sizes, industry volunteers, and excellent instruction. We are looking for a full-time software engineering instructor to continue this history of excellence.
_Role Description_*
As a Software Engineering Instructor, you will lead instruction to develop our students into software engineers. You’ll lead lectures alongside our Lead Instructor, work personally with students, and facilitate an inclusive and collaborative classroom community. Overall, you will ensure that each student has an exceptional experience and is well-prepared for the software engineering world. You understand that good software developers don’t just know how to code; they have the emotional intelligence that allows them to give and receive feedback. They know that the way forward is often through pure grit and determination. You will help model and advance these skills.

This is a full-time role that will report to our Director of Education. Our hours are Monday – Friday from 8:30 AM to 5:30 PM (central time). We have three full-time 15-week cohorts per year with a week-long break in the middle of each cohort and at least a one week break between cohorts.
_Responsibilities_*
Lead instruction on software engineering in various settings, including an entire class, small groups of students, and individually
Support students in their learning and growth
Create a positive, professional, and inclusive learning environment for our students
Iterate on our curriculum and adjust based on student feedback and industry trends
_Qualifications_*
A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, or 2+ years of professional work experience as a software engineer
A strong understanding of our core technologies: Python and/or Javascript, SQL, Django, React, and the command line
Experience as a teacher or mentor in a technical setting (e.g., bootcamp instructor, college TA in a CS class, tech tutorial video maker, etc.)
An entrepreneurial mindset, always looking to grow, improve Code Platoon’s programs, and further our mission.
A formal background in education is a plus.

Why did you decide to become a teacher? Chances are it was because you wanted to make a difference in a child’s life. As a teacher at Horizons for Homeless Children, you’ll do just that in a warm and supportive environment where your personal and professional growth are also part of working on our team.

For more than 30 years Horizons has worked to improve the lives of young children and their families experiencing homelessness. We support homeless families exclusively by providing high-quality early education, opportunities for play, and comprehensive family support services. Nobody knows early childhood homelessness – both the challenges and solutions- better than us.

Horizons currently operates three Early Education Centers in Boston – Roxbury, Jamaica Plain and Dorchester. A new state of the art building where all the centers will be moving is opening next year. It is an exciting time to join our growing and thriving team of education professionals!

As an organization that strives to be culturally inclusive and continuously improving, we are committed to bringing learning opportunities within reach for our team. Training through the Touchpoints Center at Boston Children’s and Lesley University are just two of the professional development opportunities from which our employees can benefit. We also provide support to teachers seeking Early Education Certificate (EEC) certification.

Education & Experience

CDA, AA or BA Degree in ECE or related field, minimum 15 credits in ECE.
Must be Fluent in Spanish
Minimum of 3 credit-bearing hours of specialized college-level course work in administration, leadership or management
Minimum 12 training hours that are related to management knowledge or skills and to early childhood knowledge or skills
Minimum of 1 year work experience in an NAEYC Accredited program or 3 years’ experience in a program not accredited by NAEYC
Department of EEC Teacher qualified

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Demonstrated excellence in communication and problem solving skills
Ability to collaborate and solve problems using a team approach
Ability and willingness to handle all sensitive information confidentially
Ability to lift 50 pounds
Priority will be given to individuals who have had previous experience working with homeless children and families, multi-ethnic urban families or with children-at-risk
Bilingual capacity preferred
Proficiency in using MS Office applications and other relevant ECE software applications

Must be able to embody the values of Horizons for Homeless Children:

Collaborative – “We get more done together”

Inclusive – “We are culturally responsive”

Innovative – “We ask, what would it take?”

Passionate – “We are inspired by our mission”

Horizons for Homeless Children offers a competitive salary and a highly competitive benefits package. Salary commensurate with skills and experience.

Horizons for Homeless Children is an AA/EEO employer.

GILLIG LLC is the largest and most dependable manufacturer of custom built buses for the passenger transit industry in North America. Our customers are in all 50 states, and include cities, counties, transit districts, universities and major private fleet operators. We are headquartered in Livermore, CA.

ABOUT THE ROLE

The Engineer ll - (Electrical) - Vehicle Controls will be a key member of the New Product Engineering team, responsible for the development of the vehicle body controller algorithms for all future products. You will continue to be challenged to develop unique solutions for various controls problems from multiple domains including electrical, mechanical, and thermal. You will be part of the team to develop the controls logic for the first in class zero emission bus. Assignments are broad in scope and highly complex that require outstanding creativity, superior initiative, good judgement, and leadership skill.

This Engineering position is responsible for engineering design, problem resolution and other engineering duties in support of the design and manufacturing of parts and sub-systems. This person will have direct influence at the part level to optimize the piece parts and sub-systems. This position reports to the Engineering Supervisor but may also get direction/guidance from senior engineers. This is a direct, full-time position with GILLIG.

THE DAY TO DAY

• Evaluates customer product requirements and develops product designs to meet customer needs
• Collaborate with cross functional teams to develop customized algorithms for all sub-systems and components on the bus
• Implement the controls logic and functional checks in simulation as well as on the vehicle
• Design and document solutions, within the scope of concepts, for components and modules, taking project guidelines (e.g. safety, quality, costs, weights and dates) into consideration
• Create and maintain Bill of Materials (BOM) along with all project documentation
• Support production ramp & ongoing/continuous product/process improvement
• Perform and coordinate laboratory testing of prototypes for component characterization
• Work with the test engineer(s) to create DVP&R, execute the defined test plan and review the test results/reports
• Provide technical design support to sales, product engineering, manufacturing, and quality organizations
• Support purchasing, field service and other internal customers as required
• Lead or support prototype order and procurement
• Applies industry practices and standards (NFPA, NEC, APTA, etc.) at the direction of senior engineers
• Area of expertise at the component level
• Hands on troubleshooting of vehicle systems
• Released designs are cost effective, manufacturable, serviceable, meet all performance objectives and meet customer requirements

We are interested in every qualified candidate who is eligible to work in the United States. However, we are not able to sponsor work visa's now or in the future

ABOUT YOU

• Understanding of Heavy-Duty Transit Bus Duty Cycle
• Working knowledge in electrical power distribution including AC and DC systems
• In-depth knowledge of the electrical load calculation and circuit protection
• Ability to diagnose and troubleshoot automotive electrical systems
• Experienced with:
o High voltage system design and necessary safety guidelines
o Low voltage harness design
o Generating harnesses and electrical schematic using CAD software
• Familiarity with:
o Automotive components such as circuit breakers, relays, and wiring, etc.
o Automotive industry standards such as SAE, NFPA, FMVSS, etc.
o Manufacturing processes and environment
• BS in Electrical Engineering
• Minimum 3 years of engineering experience

ABOUT THE ENVIRONMENT

• Ability to lift up to 25 lbs.
• Working environment is primarily indoors (office and production environment), however, at times may require time spent outdoors.
• Regularly required to sit, stand, and walk; occasionally kneel or squat.
• May be required to work overtime based on business needs
• Limited domestic travel
• Daily start time 6AM

GILLIG offers an excellent compensation and benefits package including 100% company-paid premiums for medical, dental and vision for employees and their families. Other benefits include a unique 401k profit-sharing plan. We are an equal opportunity employer that supports a drug-free workplace.

GILLIG is an equal employment opportunity and affirmative action employer.

Description

SHIFT: Mixed (rotating weekends)

SCHEDULE: Full-time

Are you looking for a role to utilize your House Supervisor, Emergency, Trauma or Critical Care Nursing experience that goes beyond the bedside? Are you looking for a company that places integrity over their bottom line? Here at HCA Healthcare, our everyday decisions are founded on compassion. Apply today and join a team that is dedicated to serving others in need.

HCA Healthcare is a leading healthcare provider with over 31.2 million patient encounters a year at locations in 21 states including the UK. We care about our community! HCA Healthcare has continually, been named one of Ethisphere’s most ethical company’s in the world since 2010. In 2018, HCA spent an estimated $3.3 billion in cost for the delivery of charitable care, uninsured discounts, and other uncompensated expenses.

We offer you an excellent total compensation package, including competitive salary, excellent benefit package and growth opportunities. We believe in our team and your ability to do excellent work with us.

Your benefits as a fulltime employee include Medical, Dental and Vision Insurance, Medical and Childcare Flex Spending Accounts, Life and Disability Insurance, Paid Time Off, Paid Family Medical Leave, Clinical Certification Support, Tuition Reimbursement, 401k with Corporate Matching, Employee Stock Purchase Program Employee Discount Program and Identity Theft Protection.

Be a part of an organization that invests in you. We are actively reviewing applications. Highly qualified candidates will be contacted, promptly for interviews. Submit your application and help us raise the bar in patient care!

Our Transfer Center teams are committed to providing streamlined access to the right facility at the right time for every patient, every day, throughout the continuum of care. Join us in our efforts to better our community.

Intrigued? CLICK HERE to learn more!

The HCA South Florida Transfer Center handles the patient movement and logistics for over 34 HCA hospitals and free-standing emergency rooms across the east and west Florida divisions. Our mission is to assist in the clinical placement and movement of critical patients both into and out of our facilities providing timely access to care for our patients when minutes matter the most. The transfer center is staffed 24/7 with seasoned clinical professionals who collaborate between physicians, hospitals, and other immediate health care settings to coordinate the timely movement of high acuity patients such as STEMI, stroke, trauma, neonatal care, and so forth. Our team is committed to the care and improvement of human life; impacting over 70,000 patients annually through support to hospital clinical and medical staff both for our HCA facilities and other facilities locally or in outlying markets. At the HCA Transfer Center, we also assist in arranging transportation services when needed through connection with ground and air services. Our goal is to provide comprehensive solutions that allow health care providers the ability to stay at the bedside with the patient while we assist in locating placement, transport, and other needed logistics for getting this patient the access to care that they need.

As a member of our team, you will:

Be responsible for coordinating direct admissions and hospital transfers to an appropriate HCA Division hospital.
Coordinate ambulance transfers from the HCA Division hospitals to other facilities and post-acute care providers.
Work in a customer-centric transfer and transport call center; respond to all callers with the aid of an electronic database of service profiles, approved clinical protocols and healthcare information.
Efficiently and effectively, manage all hospital transfers. Consult with on-call physicians regarding patient care issues, needs and concerns and advise when appropriate.
Work collaboratively with HCA facilities to manage all internal and external patient movements and the allocation of bed assignments.
Apply your nursing knowledge derived from education and experience as foundation for gathering appropriate clinical data to ensure appropriate placement, transfer facilitation, communication, and accurate documentation.
Facilitate inner facility transfers, maintaining communication with all parties including but not limited to attending/accepting MD and referring facility.
Communicate with physicians and outlying facilities if placement of a specific patient will be problematic. Use problem-solving skills to determine the best course of action, which will be satisfactory to the patient, the MD, and the hospital.
Make suggestions, and utilize creative thinking and acquired knowledge to assess situations and improve department decision-making and action.
Be responsible for documenting and tracking all hospital transfers and transports.
Assist in data collection, monitoring, evaluation, and analyzing of transfer problems for the purpose of developing and implementing protocols, policies and procedures.
Follow specific protocols, policies, procedures, and utilize established resources.
Work collaboratively with team members ensuring appropriate patient admissions and exceptional consumer experience
Exhibit excellent customer relationship skills including telephone and personal contact with all of the call center’s customer groups, i.e. physicians and their office staffs, nurses, vendors and fellow employees, etc.
Establish and maintains a high degree of awareness and knowledge of participating HCA hospital’s medical staff, services and special programs
Maintain composure and customer-centric communication with challenging callers.
Practice and adhere to the “Code of Conduct” philosophy, and “Mission and Value Statement.”

What Sets Us Apart…?

"I enjoy the welcoming and fast paced environment, and constant learning! There is never a dull shift and it’s truly a great team to work with!"

"Working at the Transfer Center is AMAZING! After being a nurse for over a decade, this is the best place I have ever worked. Management is fantastic. I leave on time every day, and I still get to use my critical thinking skills in a Nursing capacity. We are like a little family here, everyone works together to get things done. It’s wonderful!"

Education and Requirements:

Graduate from an accredited ADN or Diploma nursing program

Current license to practice professional nursing in the state of Florida

BLS, ACLS, PALS Certifications (If not currently certified with ACLS and/or PALS: must obtain within 6 months)

Minimum 5 years acute care RN experience

Preferences:

BSN or Bachelor’s degree in nursing

2 years of Critical Care nursing to include ED, ICU and/or House Supervisor experience

Helpful Experience:

Must be proficient in EMTALA.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills including diplomatic and friendly telephone manner and use of professional vocabulary
Ability to self-manage by taking responsibility to initiate, assess and take action
Ability to function calmly in stressful situations
Knowledge of Division hospital services lines and clinical capabilities
Basic typing skills, 35 Word Per Minute
Knowledge of Computer Software; Meditech, Tele-Tracking, Central Logic, Bed Management, Microsoft Office, Internet searches and relevant Data Bases
Problem-solving skills to determine the best course of action, which will be satisfactory to the patient, the physicians, and the hospital.
Ability to analyze information of a complex nature.
Ability to organize and prioritize multiple complex tasks.
Ability to work independently and under pressure to follow through on issues.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing.
Ability to establish and maintain long-term customer relationships, building trust and respect by consistently meeting and exceeding expectations.

Job Title: Software Developer (Django Web Application) Full-Time Opportunity
Job Description: Overview We blend deep domain expertise in health IT, life sciences, public safety, and grants management with advanced technologies to help Federal agencies solve complex problems that improve, protect, and save lives. As a rapidly growing company, we combine entrepreneurial spirit, customer focus, and an outcomes-based approach to cultivate a culture of innovation, customer success, and employee growth. Duties & Responsibilities In March 1985, the National Library of Medicine (NLM) began implementation of DOCLINE, its automated interlibrary loan request routing and referral system. By the end of fiscal year (FY) 1987, over 1,400 biomedical libraries in all seven regions of the Regional Medical Library network were using the system. In March 2006, NLM released DOCLINE version 2.7 adding several major enhancements to the National Library of Medicine's interlibrary loan request routing and referral system. DOCLINE® is the National Library of Medicine's automated interlibrary loan (ILL) request routing and referral system. The purpose of the system is to provide efficient document delivery service among libraries in the National Network of Libraries of Medicine (NNLM). MSC is searching for a Software Developer to work in the Docline Project at OCCS/NIH. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, disability or veteran status. _Our Company_*
Code Platoon is a non-profit coding bootcamp that prepares US military veterans and military spouses for software development careers. We’ve served 120+ students over 14 cohorts since 2016 with a strong 80%+ job placement rate due to our small class sizes, industry volunteers, and excellent instruction. We are looking for a full-time software engineering instructor to continue this history of excellence.
_Role Description_*
As a Software Engineering Instructor, you will lead instruction to develop our students into software engineers. You’ll lead lectures alongside our Lead Instructor, work personally with students, and facilitate an inclusive and collaborative classroom community. Overall, you will ensure that each student has an exceptional experience and is well-prepared for the software engineering world. You understand that good software developers don’t just know how to code; they have the emotional intelligence that allows them to give and receive feedback. They know that the way forward is often through pure grit and determination. You will help model and advance these skills.

This is a full-time role that will report to our Director of Education. Our hours are Monday – Friday from 8:30 AM to 5:30 PM (central time). We have three full-time 15-week cohorts per year with a week-long break in the middle of each cohort and at least a one week break between cohorts.
_Responsibilities_*
Lead instruction on software engineering in various settings, including an entire class, small groups of students, and individually
Support students in their learning and growth
Create a positive, professional, and inclusive learning environment for our students
Iterate on our curriculum and adjust based on student feedback and industry trends
_Qualifications_*
A Bachelor’s Degree in Computer Science, or 2+ years of professional work experience as a software engineer
A strong understanding of our core technologies: Python and/or Javascript, SQL, Django, React, and the command line
Experience as a teacher or mentor in a technical setting (e.g., bootcamp instructor, college TA in a CS class, tech tutorial video maker, etc.)
An entrepreneurial mindset, always looking to grow, improve Code Platoon’s programs, and further our mission.
A formal background in education is a plus.

Why did you decide to become a teacher? Chances are it was because you wanted to make a difference in a child’s life. As a teacher at Horizons for Homeless Children, you’ll do just that in a warm and supportive environment where your personal and professional growth are also part of working on our team.

For more than 30 years Horizons has worked to improve the lives of young children and their families experiencing homelessness. We support homeless families exclusively by providing high-quality early education, opportunities for play, and comprehensive family support services. Nobody knows early childhood homelessness – both the challenges and solutions- better than us.

Horizons currently operates three Early Education Centers in Boston – Roxbury, Jamaica Plain and Dorchester. A new state of the art building where all the centers will be moving is opening next year. It is an exciting time to join our growing and thriving team of education professionals!

As an organization that strives to be culturally inclusive and continuously improving, we are committed to bringing learning opportunities within reach for our team. Training through the Touchpoints Center at Boston Children’s and Lesley University are just two of the professional development opportunities from which our employees can benefit. We also provide support to teachers seeking Early Education Certificate (EEC) certification.

Education & Experience

CDA, AA or BA Degree in ECE or related field, minimum 15 credits in ECE.
Must be Fluent in Spanish
Minimum of 3 credit-bearing hours of specialized college-level course work in administration, leadership or management
Minimum 12 training hours that are related to management knowledge or skills and to early childhood knowledge or skills
Minimum of 1 year work experience in an NAEYC Accredited program or 3 years’ experience in a program not accredited by NAEYC
Department of EEC Teacher qualified

Knowledge, Skills and Abilities

Demonstrated excellence in communication and problem solving skills
Ability to collaborate and solve problems using a team approach
Ability and willingness to handle all sensitive information confidentially
Ability to lift 50 pounds
Priority will be given to individuals who have had previous experience working with homeless children and families, multi-ethnic urban families or with children-at-risk
Bilingual capacity preferred
Proficiency in using MS Office applications and other relevant ECE software applications

Must be able to embody the values of Horizons for Homeless Children:

Collaborative – “We get more done together”

Inclusive – “We are culturally responsive”

Innovative – “We ask, what would it take?”

Passionate – “We are inspired by our mission”

Horizons for Homeless Children offers a competitive salary and a highly competitive benefits package. Salary commensurate with skills and experience.

Horizons for Homeless Children is an AA/EEO employer.

Kalos Health is a regional nonprofit Health Insurance Company that provides health insurance coverage through Kalos Health Managed Long Term Care (MLTC) Plan. The Care Manager coordinates the care and service of selected member populations across the continuum of illness. This position is located in Chautauqua County.
Responsibilities*
· Work with the Medical Director, Quality Assurance, Interdisciplinary team and Director of Clinical Operations to assess, plan, implement, coordinate, monitor, and evaluate services and outcomes to maximize the health, well-being and satisfaction of all members under their purview.

· In conjunctions with the PCP and member, complete a comprehensive assessment and develop a care plan utilizing clinical expertise to evaluate the members need for alternative services. Assess short-term and long-term needs and establish case management objectives.

· Manage a mean of 65-100 active cases based on case intensity and acuity. Handle more complex or delicate members and work with interdisciplinary team to effectively manage these cases.

· Interact continuously with member, family, physician(s), other providers and the Kalos interdisciplinary team utilizing clinical knowledge and expertise to determine medical history, current status and identification/facilitation of member needs. Assess the options for are including use of benefits and community resources to update the care plan.

· Utilize clinical knowledge and expertise to determine medical history and current status. Assesses the options for care including use of benefits and community resources to meet member’s needs reflective in the plan of care.

· Act as liaison and member advocate between the member/family, physician and facilities/agencies.

· Maintain accurate records of case management activities in the electronic health record using clinical guidelines. Coordinates community resources with emphasis on medical behavioral and social services.

· Report critical incidents and information regarding quality of care issues.

· Participate in regularly scheduled chart audits.

· Primary clinical contact for in-network providers (i.e. answering questions).

· Maintain compliance set forth by Director of Clinical Operations and Quality Manager.

· Participate in on-call, after hours’ coverage.
Qualifications/Requirements*
· Current NY State RN licensure, CCM certification preferred.

· 5+years clinical experience, preferably in home health, physician’s office or public health.

· 2 years’ current case management or managed care experience preferred.

· Experience and knowledge with electronic health record software preferred.

· Bilingual skills a plus.

· Demonstrative effective communication methods to assist in training and to relate effectively to reams and management.

· Ability to work independently, handle multiple assignments and prioritize workload.

· Demonstrates high level time management and priority setting, ability to adapt to changing priorities.

· Strong oral and written communication skills.

· Ability to create, review and interpret treatment plans.

· Demonstrate negotiation skills.

· Demonstrate collegiality and teamwork and fosters same within their team.

· Abel to effectively demonstrate critical thinking skills.
Kalos Health offers outstanding benefits, including: *
· 19 days of paid time off in your first year

· Health insurance starting on your first day

· Inexpensive insurance options for medical, dental and vision

· Holidays

· And Much More!!

We offer the opportunity to be part of a very dedicated organization that cares for others. If you enjoy working in healthcare and being part of a great team, we invite you to join us. Please visit us at KalosHealth.org.

Our Transfer Center teams are committed to providing streamlined access to the right facility at the right time for every patient, every day, throughout the continuum of care. Join us in our efforts to better our community.

Intrigued? CLICK HERE to learn more!

The HCA South Florida Transfer Center handles the patient movement and logistics for over 34 HCA hospitals and free-standing emergency rooms across the east and west Florida divisions. Our mission is to assist in the clinical placement and movement of critical patients both into and out of our facilities providing timely access to care for our patients when minutes matter the most. The transfer center is staffed 24/7 with seasoned clinical professionals who collaborate between physicians, hospitals, and other immediate health care settings to coordinate the timely movement of high acuity patients such as STEMI, stroke, trauma, neonatal care, and so forth. Our team is committed to the care and improvement of human life; impacting over 70,000 patients annually through support to hospital clinical and medical staff both for our HCA facilities and other facilities locally or in outlying markets. At the HCA Transfer Center, we also assist in arranging transportation services when needed through connection with ground and air services. Our goal is to provide comprehensive solutions that allow health care providers the ability to stay at the bedside with the patient while we assist in locating placement, transport, and other needed logistics for getting this patient the access to care that they need.

As a member of our team, you will:

Be responsible for coordinating direct admissions and hospital transfers to an appropriate HCA Division hospital.
Coordinate ambulance transfers from the HCA Division hospitals to other facilities and post-acute care providers.
Work in a customer-centric transfer and transport call center; respond to all callers with the aid of an electronic database of service profiles, approved clinical protocols and healthcare information.
Efficiently and effectively, manage all hospital transfers. Consult with on-call physicians regarding patient care issues, needs and concerns and advise when appropriate.
Work collaboratively with HCA facilities to manage all internal and external patient movements and the allocation of bed assignments.
Apply your nursing knowledge derived from education and experience as foundation for gathering appropriate clinical data to ensure appropriate placement, transfer facilitation, communication, and accurate documentation.
Facilitate inner facility transfers, maintaining communication with all parties including but not limited to attending/accepting MD and referring facility.
Communicate with physicians and outlying facilities if placement of a specific patient will be problematic. Use problem-solving skills to determine the best course of action, which will be satisfactory to the patient, the MD, and the hospital.
Make suggestions, and utilize creative thinking and acquired knowledge to assess situations and improve department decision-making and action.
Be responsible for documenting and tracking all hospital transfers and transports.
Assist in data collection, monitoring, evaluation, and analyzing of transfer problems for the purpose of developing and implementing protocols, policies and procedures.
Follow specific protocols, policies, procedures, and utilize established resources.
Work collaboratively with team members ensuring appropriate patient admissions and exceptional consumer experience
Exhibit excellent customer relationship skills including telephone and personal contact with all of the call center’s customer groups, i.e. physicians and their office staffs, nurses, vendors and fellow employees, etc.
Establish and maintains a high degree of awareness and knowledge of participating HCA hospital’s medical staff, services and special programs
Maintain composure and customer-centric communication with challenging callers.
Practice and adhere to the “Code of Conduct” philosophy, and “Mission and Value Statement.”

What Sets Us Apart…?

"I enjoy the welcoming and fast paced environment, and constant learning! There is never a dull shift and it’s truly a great team to work with!"

"Working at the Transfer Center is AMAZING! After being a nurse for over a decade, this is the best place I have ever worked. Management is fantastic. I leave on time every day, and I still get to use my critical thinking skills in a Nursing capacity. We are like a little family here, everyone works together to get things done. It’s wonderful!"

Qualifications

Education and Requirements:

Graduate from an accredited ADN or Diploma nursing program

Current license to practice professional nursing in the state of Florida

BLS, ACLS, PALS Certifications (If not currently certified with ACLS and/or PALS: must obtain within 6 months)

Minimum 5 years acute care RN experience

Preferences:

BSN or Bachelor’s degree in nursing

2 years of Critical Care nursing to include ED, ICU and/or House Supervisor experience

Helpful Experience:

Must be proficient in EMTALA.
Excellent communication and interpersonal skills including diplomatic and friendly telephone manner and use of professional vocabulary
Ability to self-manage by taking responsibility to initiate, assess and take action
Ability to function calmly in stressful situations
Knowledge of Division hospital services lines and clinical capabilities
Basic typing skills, 35 Word Per Minute
Knowledge of Computer Software; Meditech, Tele-Tracking, Central Logic, Bed Management, Microsoft Office, Internet searches and relevant Data Bases
Problem-solving skills to determine the best course of action, which will be satisfactory to the patient, the physicians, and the hospital.
Ability to analyze information of a complex nature.
Ability to organize and prioritize multiple complex tasks.
Ability to work independently and under pressure to follow through on issues.
Ability to communicate clearly and concisely, both verbally and in writing.
Ability to establish and maintain long-term customer relationships, building trust and respect by consistently meeting and exceeding expectations.
Ability to work effectively with other employees and external parties.
Positive, enthusiastic, helpful personality
Customer service oriented

Job Summary: * This person must be able to multi-task and function in a fast-paced environment while contributing to a positive environment for patients and staff and participating in problem-solving activities. He or she must be detail oriented; sensitive to the patient’s needs, and require minimal supervision in order to function efficiently. The person holding this position assists the providers in the clinical treatment of the patient. This position requires close communication with the patient, other nurses, medical assistants, providers and case managers in order to coordinate care. This person is also responsible for coordinating care with outside pharmacies, providers and programs. This person must be able to control patient flow in the exam area by prioritizing tasks to minimize patient wait time. Communication with and respect for the patient is essential to build rapport. Good patient assessment skills are essential. This person must prioritize tasks and use space and time efficiently. The person in this position must be able to think critically and logically. This is a position of trust.
Communication: * Good oral and written communication skills are required for this position. Information must be exchanged using tact and persuasion appropriately. The person in this position must be able to communicate with the patients, staff, and others; and contribute to a positive environment. *The ability to communicate in Spanish, Creole, or both is a plus.*
Key Responsibilities: *
Maintains professional behavior, and attitude towards patients, visitors, and coworkers.
Rooms are to be kept neat and clean for each patient.
Appropriately triage patients to determine if they need to be seen urgently or referred elsewhere.
Conduct medication adherence counseling and fill medication boxes as needed.
Responsible for maintaining the in-stock medications, to ensure they are not expired. Obtain scripts from providers to replace these medications.
Responsible for cleaning and keeping the supply closets and sample closets up to date.
Assist patients to complete applications for pharmaceutical drug assistance programs.
Complete prior authorization process for medications or specialty services.
Communicate with pharmacies and ADAP to monitor patients’ adherence to therapy.
Prepare prescriptions to be sent to ADAP on patients’ behalf.
Monitor and ensure the pre-operative clearance process is completed as requested.
Orders needed supplies with an adequate amount of time to prevent running out.
Perform vital sign measurements on all patients presenting for care.
Perform reason for visit and review of systems for patient complaints.
Review medications and lab results with patient at each visit to ensure compliance of treatment.
Perform diagnostics such as EKG or Blood Glucose as directed by the provider.
Perform routine vaccinations as directed by the provider.
Document and track vaccinations on the appropriate log.
Prepare and administer medications or injections as directed by the provider.
Set up and assist providers with GYN exams on females.
Set up and assist providers with rectal/STI exams on both males and females.
Prepare and assist in small outpatient procedures.
Process prescriptions and refill requests as directed by the provider.
Document patient chart as directed by the provider.
Provide appropriate patient education when necessary.
Documents patient contacts and progress in the EHR.
Cross train as a Medical Assistant to provide coverage when needed.
Assist front desk with answering phones when needed.
Attends educational offerings as appropriate.
Performs other duties and responsibilities as assigned.

We are looking for a full time and PRN CNA to join our new branch! James River Home Health and Hospice is expanding to Farmville and surrounding areas! We are passionate about making an impact on patients’ lives each day and are looking for dependable, compassionate people interested in gaining experience and helping us grow in a new location.

The Hospice Aide is responsible for providing personal care under the direction of a Registered Nurse and take responsibility for the following tasks:

Perform personal care services (bathing, dressing, toileting, feeding, etc) as instructed in the Hospice Aide Plan of Care.
Document the care provided according to agency policy.
Report any deviations from the Plan of Care to the Case Manager.
Take vital signs when indicated on the Hospice Aide plan of care.
Measure and re ord fluid intake and output.
Record and report changes in the patient's physical condition, behavior or appearance to the health care professional managing the patient's care.
Foster cooperative effort among personnel by actively participating in team and staff conferences.
Provide proper care and observation of patients' skin conditions to prevent skin breakdowns. The Aide is responsible for reporting any changes or areas of concern to the Case Manager.
Assist with ambulation, transfers, range of motion, and other support as documented on the Hospice Aide plan of care.
Perform other duties that you may be qualified to do with additional training and demonstrated competency, within state guidelines.
Provide respite for patient's family and/or caregiver when on-site, as appropriate.
Participate in QAPI activities.
Participate in IDG meetings, as appropriate

Job Conditions

The Hospice Aide needs to be able to access patients' homes, which may not be have wheelchair accessibility.

Hearing, eyesight, and physical dexterity must be sufficient to perform a physical assessment of the patient's condition and to perform patient care as outlined in the Hospice Aide plan of care.

Physical activities will include walking, sitting, stooping, and standing; minimal to maximum lifting and turning of patients is also expected.

The Hospice Aide needs to be able to use a telephone, tablet, thermometer, blood pressure cuff, and other basic office and medical equipment.

Qualifications

The qualified applicant should have a minimum of 75 hours of classroom and supervised practical training with at least 16 hours devoted to supervised practical training and at least 16 hours of classroom instruction completed.

One year experience as a CNA, Hospice Aide or Home Health Aide. Hospice experience is preferred.

Must be at least 18 years old.

Must be a licensed driver with an insured automobile in good working order.

Aides must be able to speak, write and read English and meet one of the following qualifications:

Certification as a Nurse Aide issued by the Virginia Board of Nursing OR

Completed a Nurse Aide education program approved by the Virginia Board of Nursing OR

Be enrolled in a nursing education program preparing for registered nurse or practical nurse licensure and have currently completed at least one nursing course that includes clinical experience involving patient care OR

Have satisfactorily completed a nursing education hospice program preparing for registered nurse licensure or practical nurse licensure OR

Satisfactorily completed training using the Personal Care Aide Training Curriculum of the Dept of Medical Assistance Services.

Respiratory Therapist

The Respiratory Therapist performs routine respiratory care procedures, varying in complexity. These include, but are not limited to: preparation, administration and monitoring of medication and treatment modalities and gas therapy, ventilator support, spirometry and assistance with procedures as requested.

Job Duties and Responsibilities

· Responsible for respiratory care and treatment of patients at facility, with particular emphasis on post-anesthesia patients.

· Responsible for observing and implementing policies and procedures that guide the respiratory care and treatment of patients.

· Monitors all scheduled cases at the hospital for which respiratory care and treatment is anticipated.

· Participates in the treatment of all patients that fall in the above criteria and coordinating such participation with the PACU, where applicable, and the ER/Med Surg units, and the Director of Anesthesiology.

· Set up and administer all routine and complex respiratory therapy procedures to patients as prescribed by a physician.

· Performs assessment of the patient, determining needs related to frequency and duration of treatment regimen ordered by the physician, and makes appropriate recommendations to the physician as needed.

· Observes the response of patients to therapy, evaluates and records in patient chart.

· Maintain safe and clean working environment by complying with procedures, rules and regulations.

· Demonstrates appropriate interpersonal skills to work productively with patients, families, staff and coworkers.

· Demonstrates the spirit of the philosophy, mission, and values of the hospital through words and actions and implements them into departmental processes, programs, and the working environment.

· Applies the principles and values of customer service and continuous quality improvement while performing day to day activities of the position.

· Maintains and protects confidentiality regarding all aspects of patient care, personnel and strategic issues. Adheres to Confidentiality Policy.

· Maintains positive working relationships and fosters cooperative work environment. Adheres to the hospital’s compliance program_._

· Displays honesty and mutual respect when communicating with peers and other departments.

· Follows through on problems that may compromise effective job performance by using appropriate chain of command.

· Adheres to safety practices and meets requirements of National Patient Safety Goals.

· Performs other duties as assigned.
Qualifications (**Education, Experience and Certifications)*
Education: Must have completed a two or four year accredited program in Respiratory Therapy.
Certification, Licensure: *Current licensure in Respiratory Therapy from the State of Texas is required. BLS, ACLS, PALS certification required.
Education, Knowledge, Training: Two (2) years hospital related experience required.

KNOWLEDGE, Skills And Abilities

Excellent organizational skills with ability to work in high stress environment. Excellent communication skills required. Must possess knowledge of Microsoft Office and hospital related software.

Job Description

ENSCO Avionics supports challenging engineering programs on a broad range of aerospace platforms including modern control units and display systems for fixed wing and rotorcraft/helicopter programs.

ENSCO Avionics is looking for talented Software Engineers to help design, develop, and verify embedded applications for the next generation of commercial and military aircraft. Your responsibilities will span the full DO-178C software development lifecycle, from writing and reviewing software requirements to designing and executing requirement-based verification.

At ENSCO Avionics, we take our tagline “Ideas to Reality” very seriously. Joining ENSCO is an opportunity to advance humankind through technological and scientific discovery. Our dedicated workforce is diverse—in background, experience, skills, and interests. ENSCO Avionics employees are encouraged to be courageous and innovative in their ideas and work collaboratively to help develop cutting-edge technology and inventions that make future dreams a reality. ENSCO Avionics offers a supportive and unique culture, positive work environment, and flexible work schedules that empower its employees to achieve their maximum potential.

If you have the skills, experience, and desire to join our talented team and contribute to the needs of today’s modern aircraft, we want to talk to you about this opportunity.

Qualifications Required (Skills)

BS degree in Computer Science, Computer Engineering, or equivalent with a minimum of 2 years of experience
Strong understanding of C Language
Experience with Requirements Based Testing and a strong understanding of software verification principles
Excellent interpersonal skills including working in team environments
Excellent written and verbal communication skills
High level of professionalism, work ethic, and attention to quality
Must be a U.S. Citizen

Qualifications Desired

Training or background in Embedded Software Development
Experience writing software requirements
Experience using VectorCast or other verification tools (LDRA, RTRT…)
Experience with Low Level and/or integration testing
Experience developing and testing to DO-178 guidelines
Experience with Configuration Management systems such as Subversion (SVN) or GIT
Experience with Requirements Tools such as IBM Rational DOORS or Siemens Polarion

At Skyways we are building a new form of air transportation -- some people call it the flying car. We believe large unmanned aerial vehicles (UAVs) represent a unique opportunity to move things and ultimately people in new, more efficient ways. Skyways is an early stage VC funded startup based near Austin TX. We were part of *YCombinator*, S17 batch.

We are growing and looking for *a senior Software Engineer* specialized in *Machine Learning / Computer Vision / AI* to join our team. You are excited about things that fly and you want to advance the future of our civilization by working on new fundamental ways to go from A to B. You are excited about joining a startup. You are able to think in abstract ways, come up with solutions to tough engineering challenges, and you are willing to implement and work directly on the aircraft. You are comfortable with extremely fast-paced environments and limited budgets.
Responsibilities*
take ownership of *computer vision* related projects at Skyways
*collect training data, set up training pipelines, produce models*, rinse and repeat
invent, design new systems and go through *design review* process
reason about your decisions based on data (experiments, math/science)

Job Title: Part-Time Veterinary Technician for Evening Pet Urgent Care
Job Description:
We are seeking a highly motivated, gregarious individual with a minimum of 1 year experience as a veterinary technician to join our team.

For consideration, please submit a cover letter, resume and 2 employment references.

PriorityVet LLC is the first and only after-hours urgent care facility for dogs and cats in Toms River. Pets are largely treated on an out-patient basis with short-term admission for diagnostics and minor anesthetic procedures (lacerations, urethral obstruction, splinting, etc). Pets requiring prolonged anesthesia, major emergency surgery, hospitalization or overnight care are referred to a 24-hour care facility following any necessary emergent interventions. The facility is well-equipped with full in-house laboratory, digital radiography, ultrasound, EKG, BP, Tonopen, pulse oximetry, fluid pumps, Isoflurane and cloud-based practice software.

Business hours: 4PM-12M Friday-Monday 6PM-12M.Tuesday-Thursday

Friday, Saturday and Monday evenings are currently available.

Position is immediately available.

Primary responsibilities include:
Assist the veterinarian

Perform patient diagnostics and administer treatment
IV catheter placement, phlebotomy +/- cystocentesis
Short anesthesia induction, maintenance and monitoring
Assist in minor surgical procedures
Temporary inpatient nursing care and treatment
Dispense pharmaceuticals
Medical record documentation
Maintain and troubleshoot laboratory and treatment equipment,
Assist the Lead Technician with supplies and inventory
Train and supervise Client Care Representatives/Assistants
Perform customer service tasks as needed

This position creates value for the facility by performing preventative and corrective maintenance leading to increased uptime and reliability, thus helping the facility to meet their production and quality goals.

Job Title: Behavioral Health Technician- Med Clinic/ UR/ Clinical
Job Description:
PURPOSE*
Under the supervision of the Behavioral Health Department Director this Behavioral Health Technician (BHT) will work alongside medical and behavioral health professionals providing care for clients who suffer from a variety of psychiatric and emotional problems. This position will provide important services that support the psychiatric medical prescriber during Med Clinic hours and essential reviews of Behavioral Health (BH) Department client records for timeliness and completeness of records.
ESSENTIAL FUNCTIONS*
Approximately 40% of this BHT position will function as patient navigator and care manager for patients attending appointments with our psychiatric medical provider. Those duties include: initial patient assessments, developing and updating care plans, transitioning patients in and out of telehealth service appointments, doing patient vitals, and entering information into the electronic medical record.

Approximately 25% of this BHT position will function as a reviewer of BH client charts for timeliness of Medicaid requirements as directed by the BH department director. This will include the use of a spreadsheet to report on various BH clinical tasks: verifying dates of service, checking on timeliness of services, dates of discharges and outreach attempts.

Approximately 35% of this BHT position will function as a member of the counseling staff. The essential functions will be to perform initial assessments, develop behavioral health service plans with patients, and use counseling strategies to help patients meet their treatment goals. These functions will be trained by the Director and other external educational providers.
MINIMUM QUALIFICATIONS*
· High School Diploma or GED equivalent.

· Experience in the medical field is a plus.

· Exposure to computer systems, such as, Word, Excel, or other software programs is expected.

· The ability to write and read English fluently is a must, the ability to speak Spanish is a plus.

· The specific job duties and tasks will be trained by the BH Department, and the applicant must be organized and a quick learner.
WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL REQUIREMENTS*
Air-conditioned office, considerable work on desktop computer, frequent interruptions in routine, considerable sitting required. Some infrequent travel required.
_As a condition of employment, DSCHC employees are required to qualify for an Arizona Level One Fingerprint Clearance Card_*

In addition, all personnel actions such as compensation, promotion, demotion, benefits, transfers, staff reductions, terminations, reinstatement and rehire, company-sponsored training, education, social and recreational programs will be administered in accordance with the principles of equal employment opportunity.

Plan, implement, upgrade, or monitor security measures for the protection of computer networks and information. Provide technical assistance to our team members. Answer questions or resolve computer problems for team members in person, or via telephone or electronically. Provide assistance concerning the use of computer hardware and software, including phone system, CRM, printing, installation, word processing, electronic mail, and operating systems.

DUTIES:
Develop plans to safeguard computer files against accidental or unauthorized modification, destruction, or disclosure and to meet emergency data processing needs.
Monitor current reports of computer viruses to determine when to update virus protection systems.
Encrypt data transmissions and erect firewalls to conceal confidential information as it is being transmitted and to keep out tainted digital transfers.
Perform risk assessments and execute tests of data processing system to ensure functioning of data processing activities and security measures.
Modify computer security files to incorporate new software, correct errors, or change individual access status.
Review violations of computer security procedures and discuss procedures with violators to ensure violations are not repeated.
Document computer security and emergency measures policies, procedures, and tests.
Confer with team members to discuss issues such as computer data access needs, security violations, and programming changes.
Monitor use of data files and regulate access to safeguard information in computer files.
Coordinate implementation of computer system plan with establishment personnel and outside vendors.
Train team members and/or other users and promote security awareness to ensure system security and to improve server and network efficiency.
Answer team member inquiries regarding computer software or hardware operation to resolve problems, and provide technical assistance and support.
Assess and track compliance with regulatory and legal requirements relevant to our business such as the CCPA, GLBA, and Payment Card Industry Data Security Standard Coordinate with 3rd party audits.
Oversee the daily performance of computer systems.

Technical requirements

Please disconnect from your VPN and make sure you don't have any video conferencing software open (zoom, etc). Try to find a quiet place with good lighting and a stable internet connection.

What to bring to this event

Have have updated resume ready and research Atrium Health prior to event.

What to wear

Dress code is Business casual (dress pants/skirt, button down/blouse, optional tie).

About Atrium Health

Our mission is to improve health, elevate hope and advance healing - for all. The name Atrium Health allows us to grow beyond our current walls and geographical borders to impact as many lives as possible and deliver solutions that help communities thrive. For more information, please visit atriumhealth.org/about-us

Atrium Health (formerly Carolinas HealthCare System) is one of the nation’s leading healthcare organizations, connecting patients with on-demand care, world-class specialists and the region’s largest primary care network. A recognized leader in healthcare delivery, quality and innovation, our foundation rests on providing clinically excellent and compassionate care.

We’ve been serving our community since 1940, when we opened our doors as Charlotte Memorial Hospital. Since then, our network has grown to include more than 40 hospitals and 900 care locations ranging from doctors’ offices to behavioral health centers to nursing homes.

Our focus: delivering the highest quality patient care, supporting medical research and education, and joining with partners outside our walls to keep our community healthy.

Atrium Health is an EOE/AA Employer

What is a Virtual Hiring Event?
Virtual hiring events are a great way for employers and jobseekers to connect, even if they aren't in the same physical location. Hiring is a human process, and they would like to talk with you online (either through chat, on the phone, or video) to see if you’re a fit!

Completing our application form prior to the event is strongly encourage and will speed up the process.

Job Summary

Our team members are part of an environment that fosters health, hope and healing-for all, driven by the principles of Our Atrium Health Way to create a welcoming and professional environment. Supports and functions under the direction of the care team with various office and clinical duties to keep our healthcare practice running efficiently. Demonstrates critical thinking skills and decisive judgment in an often-hectic environment and possess the ability to work cohesively on a team and independently with minimal supervision
Follows patient intake/rooming work policies in place at the practice and maintains examination areas

Job Description:
Looking for a new home where your skills are valued by the company and the customers? Are you worried that your present employer may not around in the future? Are you working with obsolete diagnostic equipment and tools?

We offer a very peaceful, high-quality, professional work environment *with a great career path and compensation package $120000.*

Holland Car Care (Holland Car Care) is expanding its highly talented team. We're the best German car repair service in the Peninsula & Silicon Valley. We've been in business over 40 years and have a fantastic reputation.

Holland Car Care is looking for a master technician auto tech (German Car product knowledge). Minimum of 5 years experience with either BMW or Mercedes-Benz and Diagnostic abilities.

Our San Mateo and San Carlos shops are some of the best shops in all of California. We only hire the best!

As one of our wonderful techs who used to work at a Mercedes dealer says:

" *_I wish I had joined Holland Car Care sooner rather than work at the Mercedes dealer. I had no idea that a work environment could be so pleasant and rewarding. The owner is an experienced technician and respects what techs have to do every day."_*

We're proud of our integrity as we never sell unneeded work unlike dealers. We're specialists in Mercedes, BMW, Audi, and MINI only. Our customer love us! We have almost 200 5-star customer reviews.

Our shops have everything the dealers have but without the headaches, including:
$120K potential income.
Five-day weeks, no weekends.
Our shops are immaculate and our techs love working here.
Our equipment is the latest and state-of-the-art with all of the latest software updates. We continue to aggressively in the latest equipment and our techs.
We have 2 - 3 lifts per tech so our techs don't waste their time.
We stress a collaborative, team-oriented approach among our techs.
Our auto techs have many years of experience unlike most dealerships.
Unlike dealers, we do not do factory warranty work. Therefore, labor times aren't drastically reduced.
We offer pay scale well above dealership levels, along with paid medical, dental, 401(k) matching and profit sharing.
We dispatch work fairly across all technicians.
We're not a large, heartless corporation. We care about our people as they are the heart and soul of our operation.
If you are under-compensated and under-valued this will be a great opportunity. Come join our highly successful team!
About Holland Car Care*
Over 40 years ago, Holland Car Care pioneered premium independent auto service in the San Francisco Bay Area. We focused on making customers, offering service far superior to that of any dealer.

Today, Holland is known as the leader in the area of German auto service. The Bay Area _loves _German cars. Our elite team of experienced master technicians are known throughout the area as the "go-to guys" for knowledgeable, fast, "do it right the first time" service.

Job Description:
Summary

Education/Formal Training

Work Experience

Credential/Licensure

Minimum of five years of clinical nursing experience.

Licensed as RN in the state where work is performed.

PREFERRED:

Bachelor’s degree in Nursing from an accredited program

Prior experience in Case-management, Care Coordination, Care facilitation, and discharge planning.

Certified Case Manager

N/A

N/A

N/A

Knowledge/Skills/Abilities
Advanced knowledge and experience in coverage practices, terminology, and requirements for referrals and authorization/pre-certification used by third party payers, Medicare, and secondary payer rules.
Experience working with pre-certification and/or medical codes.
Demonstrated analytical ability to collect and interpret insurance and contract information. Clinical knowledge to effectively manage pre-certifications for more complex surgical and invasive procedures.
Experience dealing with PPO and Managed Care insurance.
Strong attention to detail and critical thinking skills. Ability to make decisions based on clinical knowledge/practices.
Experience with a computerized healthcare information system required. Familiarity with fundamental Microsoft word software
Excellent verbal and written communication skills.

Key Job Responsibilities
Responsible for precertification of eligible medical services and procedures for inpatient, diagnostic, and outpatient services based on medical plan documents and medical necessity. Manages pre-certifications for more complex surgical and invasive procedures that require strong clinical knowledge.
Reviews clinical information submitted by medical providers to evaluate the necessity, appropriateness and efficiency of the use of medical procedures. Expertise in clinical knowledge of invasive procedures, and demonstrates understanding of medical procedures and equipment use.
Coordinates all documentation required for precertification of services. Ensures medical documentation is sufficient to meet insurer guidelines for medical necessity documentation and procedure payment. Performs research regarding denials or problematic accounts as necessary. Works to identify trends and root cause of issues and recommend resolutions for future processes.
Establishes a good working relationship with physicians, physician office staff, patients, and other members of the healthcare team.
Notifies physician office and/or patient when services are not approved. Follows process and protocols for appeals and precertification decisions. Documents and codes accounts in Cerner according to established procedures
Understands, applies, and supports departmental/hospital policies, procedures, and standards.
Actively participates in problem solving methodologies; identifies and communicates areas for improvement in ongoing efforts for quality care; assists in gathering, analyzing and presenting data in the assigned populations.

Must have good balance and coordination.

The Associate is required to have close visual acuity including color, depth perception, and field of vision to perform an activity, such as assessing patients, preparing and analyzing data and figures; transcribing; viewing a computer terminal; or extensive reading.

Frequent non-invasive patient contact.

Exposure to patient body fluids as well as exposure to hazardous or poisonous materials.

Ability to react quickly to emergency situations.
